course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Business Statistics
course.description: Collection, tabulation and presentation of numerical data; concepts of probability and probability distributions; sampling; statistical estimation and hypothesis testing; correlation and regression analysis.
course.exclusions: CIVL 2160, IEDA 2520, IEDA 2540, LIFS 3150, MATH 2411, MATH 3423

reviews.author: ustgrad
reviews.title: ISOM 2500 Review
reviews.comment_content:
The content was actually very well organized as compared with other classes. Lecturer goes very systematically according to his slides and the textbook is well-aligned with class content.

However, there is a lack of exercise given by lecturer in class which makes practice for complicated contents inadequate.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style of professor is very orderly. There is always an explanation to every line in the notes and the professor will not skip any parts and always ensure his students pay attention in lessons. His major pet peeve is using the mobile phone in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is really bad for as the mean for every examination is really high. The assignments are all expected to score 100% in order to secure a better grade.

I obtained a 87 in my final grade and it was a B so you can imagine the mean.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is acceptable. There is little/ no class exercises but assignments are okay if you are doing it with your groupmates. Acceptable workload, overall.

reviews.author: Rexchan
reviews.comment_content: The content is not hard. Also, the professor does not go deep into the content. He just follows the powerpoint to teach which is quite boring
reviews.comment_teaching: Can't understand what is he talking about. His accent is very bad. I think there is no difference if you skip his lesson or not. You won't understand what he is talking about. And his lesson is very boring
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite competitive. Because there is only MC in all the test. It can be a huge difference in grades if you got a few questions wrong. However, I got an average mark in all the test, I still got a B for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite easy. Just some group assignment and some random pop-up quiz in the class.

reviews.author: HKUST sucks
reviews.title: I love Du Lilun, reg his course!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content: Pls refer to other's reviews.
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Teaching is good. Lectures are useful and clear.

- He has a weird accent but you will fully get used to it after 2-3 lectures.

- Have Zoom recording for each lecture.

- He organizes extra office hours before each quiz and final exam, which is useful for last-min fighters like me

- He ans students' questions clearly and patiently. Don't be afraid to ask whenever you have any question
reviews.comment_grading:
- quiz 1 (20%): mean 16.5, sd 2.6
- quiz 2 (20%): mean 15.7, sd 2.8
- final (40%): mean 23.5, sd 6.8
- hw x3 (5% each): mean is very very close to full mark
- attendance (5%): randomly choose 5 lectures to take attendance

- My score: above mean ard 1 sd in quiz 1, quiz 2 and final exam, got almost full mark in the 3 assignments, and lost 1% attendance mark :(

Overall mark: 87.9%
Letter grade: A-
If I had the 1% attendance mark, I would get  an A, fml
Very very lenient in grading.
(You can get an A- with 84% overall mark.)


Some tips on getting a good grade:
1. Attend each lecture and get all 5% attendance mark

2. {MOST IMPORTANT} Do the practice qs he gives out before quizzes and finals and make sure you understand all of them. More than 5 Qs from each quiz and final are EXACTLY the same as practice questions (at least for my year).

3. choose your groupmate wisely and try to score as much as possible in the three assignments. (TA this year is extremely lenient in terms of marking assignments)

4. Be mindful in differentiating population and sample *throughout the entire course*. The whole course is about statistical inference, which is to obtain information of the population from the sample. Therefore, it is important not to confuse the notations (e.g. μ and x̄). You have to know when, how to use what formula, and why.

5. Constantly put in effort throughout the semester, don't be a deadline fighter like me

6. Make a proper cheatsheet which at least includes all the formulae to be tested
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely Light.
3 assignments in total, 7-8 questions each.
And you form group of 3 students to finish it together.

reviews.author: Brian Lee
reviews.comment_content:
Very good content. I once thought that statistic was just about playing with numbers and nothing else, while in this course I learned how powerful statistics is in representing real-life data and its power in forecasting.

Syllabus:
- Data and variation.
- Time series data.
- Transform data.
- Probability and its rules.
- Tools for organizing probability.
- Probability models.
- Variance and volatility of investments.
- Association and dependence.
- Covariance and portfolio.
- Normal probability distribution.
- Sampling.
- Sampling distributions.
- Standard errors and confidence intervals.
- Statistical hypothesis testing.
- Fitting equation to data.
- The simple regression model. ( Everything learned before is preparing you to delve into this course's most important part!! Regression is used to do forecasting!)
- Inference about SRM
- Introduction to multiple regression.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Hu teaches experientially, using real-life cases and experiments to demonstrate the statistics concepts. Contrary to the mathematical way of teaching, this method vividly illustrated that there were stories behind the seemingly lifeless numbers. I learned to really appreciate the beauty and the power of the statistical tools mentioned.
reviews.comment_grading:
My grade: A+

Grading system:
Attendance: 5%
Assignment: 15%
Exams: 80%

2 group assignments.

The format of midterm1,2 and final will be all multiple choices.

There are two weighted methods for midterms and the final exam, and whichever favors me more will be my score.
Method 1: midterm1*20%+midterm2*20%+final*40%
Method 2: midterm1*5%+midterm2*25%+final*50%
So if I screwed up my midterm1, I can still double it down on my mid2 and final to rescue my grade.

My score:
Attendance: 5/5
Assignments: 15/15, ( mean: 13.2)
Midterm1: 23/23, ( mean:18.8)( coverage: data, variation, and probability)
Midterm2: 24/25, ( mean: 20.2)( main coverage: confidence intervals, hypothesis testing)
Final: 41/44, ( mean: 29, sd: 6.14)( main coverage: Regression)

All the midterms and final are non-cumulative but bear in mind that previous knowledge is a prerequisite for understanding subsequent content, so even if they are not tested, you have to know the prior content very well in order to beat the final boss: Regression.
reviews.comment_workload:
The content is not easy. I spent a lot of time searching on the web myself to get a more thorough understanding of some unfamiliar concepts.

Assignments are easy, but sometimes there're typos in the questions, so make sure you email your TA to clarify any doubts. Maybe it's not your fault when you're puzzled by the confusing workings.

reviews.comment_content: mainly about R coding and statistical analyzing, quite interesting if the course is not this difficult

reviews.comment_grading:

Final 30%
I don't really know how grading of the assignments work because there's this one time when I did nothing right but I had 10/10. And then there's this another time when I was pretty confident and some of my answers were similar to the model answer, but I got a 7.5 out of 10, which is really low since the average is like 9/10 every single time

my overall percentage for the assignments is 54/60 (90%)
I don't know my final exam score but my grade is B
(and my friend had a C even though she had a higher percentage for the assignments)
reviews.comment_workload: about one assignment every two weeks. There are around three questions per assignment.The professor would give you around one week to finish every assignment. For me personally, the programming for the assignments is wayyy too difficult to figure out. And so I would need a day or two (literally) to finish an assignment, even if my friends and I try to solve the questions together. Maybe the workload would be okay for you if you're good at programming. But it's definitely not okay for people like me :)

reviews.author: Bubblebot
reviews.title: Easy for those who have taken IB HL math Stat option
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very similar to IB HL Math statistics option. Simple statistics in the core section is also covered.

I think it could be quite difficult to those without any stat background because some of them really need deep understanding. If you don't understand the beginning part, you cannot understand the rest. So don't miss the first few lectures.

Also, make sure to remember all the glossaries and terms. Some jargons are quite confusing but you have to understand. Concepts like the difference between sample and population can be quite confusing if you don't pay attention!

Random attendance (really matters at the end due to small std)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Du lilun is ok - he is not too bad but not that good either. But he will answer your questions pretty well if you ask him. The presentation really helps you to revise so make sure to have a look at it.

To me, the teaching was quite boring but to some of you the pace might be slightly fast.
reviews.comment_grading: I really hated this course because the standard deviation is so small that one mistake will drag you down so much. I scored 7 in my hl math stat option paper, but I only got a B in this course. All the exam papers are PURE MCP which is quite shit tbh. It means really simple questions and hard questions worth the same. There are difficult questions like hypothesis testing and t-test. But they worth the same in the exam... kinda lack the ability to differentiate students who actually understand the course.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload for this course is ok. Problem sets are doable. Make sure to do them cuz they really help unlike some other courses.

reviews.author: ShinySunny
reviews.comment_content:
The content is mainly about basic statistical knowledge, mainly about understanding concepts, with low requirements for calculation. Before Quiz1, the content was relatively simple, and the content between Quiz1-2 was barely understandable (z statics, confidence interval). However, the content after quiz2 was relatively abstract (hypothesis test, linear expression), which required extra time to do questions and check concepts, but it was not so difficult after understanding.
Overall, I thought it was very interesting.

内容主要是基础的统计知识，理解概念为主，对计算要求不高。quiz1之前的内容较简单，quiz1-2之间的内容勉强可以理解(z statisics, confident interval)，但是quiz2-final的内容比较抽象（hypossis test, linear regression),需要额外花时间做题，查概念，不过理解了之后就感觉也没那么难。
总体感觉还挺有趣的
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor taught very well, and the PPT was very clear. When reviewing, you can clearly understand the logic between knowledge by looking at the PPT.
The teaching is relatively shallow. Many mathematical proofs of formulas will not be taught in class (due to the curriculum design), but the professor will be very careful when asked after class
(However, sometimes I feel the pace of the course is a little slow.)
The professor is very friendly.
教授教得非常好，PPT很清晰，复习的时候看PPT就可以清楚的了解到知识之间的逻辑。
教的比较浅，很多公式的数学证明不会在课上讲（是课程设计的原因），但是课下去问的话教授会很仔细地讲）
（不过，有的时候感觉课程节奏有点慢。）
教授本人很有亲和力，课后可以用普通话答疑，内地学生可能感觉比较亲切
reviews.comment_grading:
group assignment 15%
quiz1 20%
quiz2 20%
final 40%
attendance 5%

The distinction between quiz1 and quiz2 is very small. The test questions and practice are almost the same. The main test is not to understand the content, but to be careful and diligent. The average score can reach 18/20
The final is difficult. There is a big difference between the test questions and practice. The requirements for understanding are higher. You should review it carefully. If you didn't do well in quiz1 and quiz2, it is very promising to rely on the final to pull it back.

quiz1和quiz2 区分度非常小，试题和practice 几乎一样，主要考的不是对内容的理解，而是仔细和勤奋。平均分可以达到18/20.
final比较难，考题和practice差异比较大，对理解的要求高一些，要好好复习，如果简单的quiz没考好的话，靠final拉回来还是很有希望的。
reviews.comment_workload:
Small
There are only three group assignments
If you want to review for the exam, just do the practice question carefully
比较小
作业只有三group assignment
考试复习的话，认真做practice question 就行

However, in the second half of the course, things became more complicated. reviews.author: CL是人生
reviews.title: BEST Learning Experience in My First Semester
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus (Difficulty):
1. Descriptive Statistics (★☆☆)
2. Probability Concepts, Random Variables and Expected Values (★☆☆)
3. Binomial Distribution (★☆☆)
4. Normal Distribution (★☆☆)
5. Sampling Distribution (★★☆)
6. Confidence Interval Estimation (★★☆)
7. Hypothesis Testing (★★★)
8. Correlation and Regression Analysis (★★★)

The First 4 parts are VERY EASY, you can handle them very well even if you do not have any past knowledge of statistics (which I don't have).
For chapters 5-7, things are getting hard. But if you pay attention in class, that would not be big trouble.
Chapter 8 requires a high level of understandings of both chapters 6 and 7. Spending one whole day clearing up concepts would be ideal.
reviews.comment_teaching:
BEST PROFESSOR EVER.
He got an award in teaching years ago, and you can see it on the glass board outside LTA. He really deserves it.

He has a very local accent, so for Hong Kong students, you will understand his lectures very well.

He is very experienced in teaching new concepts. His lecture notes are well-prepared. As long as you pay attention to every lecture, you will have a deep understanding of Statistics. He is the best professor in my first semester.

Also, he included many examples of daily applications in his lectures. For those who really want to learn something, you will find his lectures very satisfying and inspiring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Coursework (3 Assignments, Groupwork): 20%
Midterm 1 (20 MCs): 20%
Midterm 2 (20 MCs): 20%
Final Exam (40 MCs): 40%

OPEN BOOK EXAMINATIONS.
Courseworks require you to use Excel. As long as you attend (or watch the recording of) the tutorials, you can get a high mark.
For midterms and final, 1 MC = 1 mark. So please be really careful in answering.

========================================
I think the grading is relatively lenient.
FYI, my scores (no M1):
Assignment 1: 13/13 (mean 11.81)
Assignment 2: 11/11 (mean 10.3)
Assignment 3: 26/28 (mean 23.98)
Midterm 1: 18/20 (mean 13.93, sd 3.11, max 19)
Midterm 2: 19/20 (mean 15.7, sd 3.55, max 20)
Final Exam: 34/40 (not disclosed, unknown mean and sd)
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
LOW.
There are only 3 assignments. Finish them and done.

reviews.author: Wolfheart
reviews.title: Insanely high mean; class tests how careful and attentive you are to mistakes
reviews.comment_content: Content in his class was fine. It’s generally manageable relative to other courses. Intro statistics course, after all.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is passionate about the course. He is kind and approachable during and after lectures. Some students complain of his thick accent, but you’ll get used to it after 3 or so lectures, and the accent doesn’t affect the content he teaches.

T.A. was responsive to e-mails so if you have any queries, just keep bothering the T.A. especially during preparation for finals (lower mean of the finals shows its increased difficulty compared to the two quizzes).

I also tried contacting the professor through e-mail, but he would take longer to respond.
reviews.comment_grading:
With regards to the university grading scheme, the grading is fair. It is, after all, a statistics course that teaches you about the normal distribution curve lol. However, my largest complaint is that the course tests your consistency (like how careless) more than your understanding of the material -- misreading even a single question will impact the grade you receive because of the insanely high mean.

Quiz 1 was a replica of the sample quiz the professor provided, Quiz 2 was almost the same as the sample but with a few questions he answered in class (so stop skipping class after Quiz 1), and finals was more difficult and placed greater emphasis on testing your logical thinking and understanding of the course beyond the slides.

Assessment Weights:
10% Homework
10% Participation (6% for reciting 6 times, 4% for not disturbing class)
45% Quizzes 1,2
35% Finals

Exam Statistics:
Quiz 1 – Mean of 20.3/22, SD of 3.2
Quiz 2 – Mean of 17.4/23, SD of 4.7
Final – Mean of 25.1/35, SD of 5.9

I received 21/22 for Quiz 1, 21/23 for Quiz 2, and 26/35 for Finals; participation was perfect and lost a few marks in homework, but still above mean. I think the mean of the final grade for the course is around 78% and I received 84.1%. That was a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very light. Just three assignments with about 5 to 6 questions each; professor gives a MCQ sample midterm/final and asks you to logically show how you arrived at your answer for some questions. He also provides the answer key to the samples, so no problem.

No other BS like constructing spreadsheets was covered. Other professors had groupworks to construct an Excel sheet as assignments. But then, Excel is a pretty good skill, so if you want to learn, take the class of another professor.

If you generally do well in exams, and can ensure that careless mistakes will be minimised, definitely take this class. However, for most other people, you will likely beat yourself up for getting a mistake in a question. There’s also the tendency to feel that your efforts aren’t rewarded due to the disproportion of the insanely high mean and your level of understanding/effort that you invested to revise the powerpoint.

reviews.author: boi

reviews.comment_content:
It's basic stats.
Lecture material is very easy and straightforward, but the exam questions are significantly harder. You can learn all of the course's basic materials in one week, but if you want a good grade you have to grind hard and do all the practice questions.
reviews.comment_teaching:

Assignments - oof. Quite hard, but still doable and its in groups
Random Quizzes - Usually easy if you're up to date on the material and it's only graded for submission
Final Exam - Ouch. Hard. Make you sure you do lots of practice problems if you don't want a thicc C

Basically nothing at all.

SIKE

Also, his powerpoint slides are confusing with an excess amount of unrelated graphics and little content.
reviews.comment_grading: It is not hard to get a decent grade from him as he is lenient and kind as a person. There are 15% of free marks from participation in CANVAS, while the mid-term and final is not too difficult if you studied the basic concept of statistics and excel.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is moderate. While there are no assignments and only two projects, the projects are quite difficult as you need to 'google search' everything and analyse the performance of stock indexes. Good teammates are very important in the projects as it would be near impossible to finish the project alone.

reviews.author: itzjust.harry
reviews.title: Good Grade Professor
reviews.comment_content: If you have done IB HL applications and interpretations or A level Mathematics Stats option, the content should be relatively straight forward as it covers most of the fundamental statistical concepts such as normal, binomial distribution, descriptive stats, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals (this was heavily emphasized in the final exam). The last topic, being the simple regression model is slightly new so you may need more time to digest the concept.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although Kohei sustains a thic japanese accent, his lecture slides and resources are quite informative and useful so therefore, unless you cannot grasp or comprehend a certain concept, referring to the lecture slides will suffice.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite generous, as it is based off absolute grading.

Homework (Best 6):
30/30 (30%)

Midterm quizzes:
Quiz 1: 18/20 (Mean 17.316/20 SD 2.091)
Quiz 2: 20/20 (Mean 18.338/20 SD 1.991)
Final: 34/40 (Mean 28.897/40 SD 5.925)

Final Grade: A-

I was not expecting an A range so Kohei was quite lenient with the grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are around 20-25 pieces of homework which has to do with calculations and excel spreadsheet work and Kohei usually takes the best 6 so it is strongly encouraged that you max out the first 6 pieces of homework as they are relatively the easiest. After that, it just comes down to preparation for the midterms and finals.

If you have not studied stats before, the course may be challenging as there are some advanced concepts towards the end, especially after the mid terms (Don't be fooled by the level of difficulty of the first midterm quiz!).

Although, if you have prior stats knowledge, e.g. IB SL analysis and approaches, assuming that you have studied normal distribution in the past, you may be familiar with concepts up to the midterm but towards the finals the concepts will be slightly different and a bit more in depth such as T test, Z test, hypothesis testing, regression analysis.

If you have taken more advanced stats courses in High school ie A level further math stats, IB HL applications, AP stats, etc.. there should be around an 80-90% course overlap so therefore, most of the course content should be relatively straightforward. However, bear in mind that towards the end the inferential statistics gets rather interesting and sophisticated.

reviews.comment_teaching: I think professor DU must be the most good-tempered and patient teacher I've ever encountered in my life so far. Let me give you an example. Before midterms and final, he would always provide us with some practice questions, which is really nice since I didn't get many chances to practice in my other enrolled courses. To answer questions arising from doing the practice, professor would always arrange a tutorial session on the night before the exams. I remembered some people kept asking the same questions which had already been explained before. If the same thing happens to my high school teacher, I think my high school teacher will be mad as hell. However, the professor just explained the same question again and again in an encouraging tone without any impatience, unbelievable! Frankly speaking, I think professor DU's course is so underrated. Although he speaks English with his unique accent, you will definitely get used to it after 2 or 3 classes. Professor would always explain the abstract concept in a very simple way by giving some concrete samples. For those who commented that they couldn't understand a thing, I think maybe it is because they didn't even try to listen to him in the first place. If you are a good student who always pays attention in class, no worries at all; what he said really make sense~
reviews.comment_grading:
Three non-accumulated exams.
Midterm 1: 20%  Mean: 13.9
Midterm 2: 20%  Mean: 14.6
Both of them are 20 MC questions to be finished in one hour. I think midterms are not too hard (compared to the final) and you will do fine after finishing the practice questions provided by the professor. Just be aware of some tricky questions and don't fall into those traps to get a high score.
Final: 40%  Mean: 23.1
40 MC questions in two hours. Kind of hard, make sure to be really familiar with the course materials and calculation process. Again, read the questions carefully to identify those tricky questions!
3 Assignments: 16% (5%,5%,and 6% for each assignment) All of them have extremely high mean.
Attendance: 4%  Mean: 3.6
At the end of the semester, the professor would randomly choose four classes to take attendance. Just try to attend every class to get a full mark on this.
Final Score:  Mean: 69.6
My final score is 91.17 while the high is 98.4 (Wait, What???! It's almost full marks!). I've read a lot of comments about how competitive the course was and it seemed that your grade had to be perfect to get an A range. Much to my surprise, I got an A+ in the end. I'm soooooo grateful!!!
reviews.comment_workload: Only three group assignments and that's all. The number of questions in each assignment is roughly around 5 to 7 questions and you have 2 groupmates, not heavy at all. Besides, I highly recommend going through those homework questions one by one since it really helps to understand and clarify the course materials.

Although his English is not very good, I still like his teaching approach. He explains concepts with clear logic flow and daily examples, so putting his English aside, he actually teaches quite well. He will encourage students to ask questions by saying that "ahh, it's a good question....".  I am pretty sure that he will make you understand the lecture content afterwards. Although I saw some reviews saying that his lecture is boring, I personally don't think so. I think both the content and his teaching is not boring, and sometimes even quite interesting. reviews.comment_workload: Light. Only 3 assignments, and they aren't difficult to handle. You can do them in groups or individually. Sometimes the assignments require you to use excel, which is a little time consuming if you aren't familiar with it. Some extra efforts may be needed for understanding the lecture content. I would say the overall workload is light.

reviews.author: fghh
reviews.title: Prof matters!
reviews.comment_content: Similar for all professors, but he skipped the part on population. Nothing special, just calculations
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor accent and always make mistakes.
Even if you’re extremely focused on lectures, you can barely understand him because of his accent.... When he just explained for an example and calculated the answer, he said oh sorry guys I just make a mistake. So you wont know what he just taught is correct or not. His slides are hard to understand...you dont get a detailed problem solving process on the slides so if you dont understand the things he taught on class, just reading slides does no help. U have to self study on your own, hopefully you got a fd to study with you.
reviews.comment_grading:
Above 1 sd in 1st midterm
Mean in 2nd midterm
Below 1 sd in final.
C+.

reviews.comment_workload: U needa spend lots of time studing thr content by yourself because his teaching is too difficult to understand. So I basically self study the content and ask friends for other professors’ slides(wanxuhu’s are hard to understand coz he used python and his barely provide explanation on the slides clearly)

reviews.author: chocomilk
reviews.comment_content:
His powerpoint is filled up with Python codes, where you are not required to know in this course, and it will not be assessed.

He sometimes mess up his Python codes, formulas, and some simple calculations.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His teaching is a bit messy, sometimes he skips some of the chapter and concepts. It is difficult to understand what he is teaching.

But he is kind, nice,encouraging, willing to answer questions (though his answers may not resolve your problem)

He also opens extra Q-A sessions before quiz and exam.

His TA, Isaac, is very good. He devoted lots of efforts to make tutorial video, notes and also exercises for us.
reviews.comment_grading: I got better grade than I expected. I remember my quiz is below mean, the final should be around mean, homework not getting full marks at all. But still secure a B range. Thanks to Prof and Isaac.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite ok. Just a few group assignments.
You can form a group by yourself or do it own your own as well.
TA will also help to form a group if you cannot form the group by yourself.

reviews.author: Kobe_chh
reviews.comment_content: Content唔係好難，操一操就已經可以去考，佢教既topic比其他既prof少
reviews.comment_teaching: Lucy好passionate，好用心答學生問題。教書都好清晰，教完會系下堂review翻上堂既重點。PowerPoint好好，簡略精要，無乜垃圾。Email都好快复。
reviews.comment_grading:

reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light. Only 4 homework in one semester. But, there are two quizs. Luckily, the content covered is very little.

reviews.author: IDK123
reviews.comment_content:
Some basic statistics concepts (the first few weeks are very easy, seems like junior form mathematics)
- The professor also adds how to use excel in his teaching, but those IT skills will not be tested in exams (but you will need them when completing your homework)
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a good teacher. He is very nice and has always tried his best to answer all your enquiries. Though his accents may be a little bit hard to understand at first, you will get used to it after a few weeks. Also, it is not very hard to understand what he is saying as he follows his PowerPoint at most of the times.

He also tries to show how to apply those concepts in actual business scenarios and shows students how to use excel to help you analyze the data.
reviews.comment_grading:
The assignments and mid-terms are easy to score high, as long as you have paid attention in class.

This year, due to the social events, classes have changed to online-teaching and the exam (which originally should consist of both short questions and mc) consists only MC, so it is not hard to score high in exams. But I'm not sure if 'normal final exam' would be hard or not.

Results:
Assignments: 4,4,4,4,4 (Total 20/20)
Mid-term: 20/20 (median 18, sd 1.856); 20/20 (median 15, sd 2.872)
Final: 36/40 (median 29, sd 5.805, max 37)
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is bearable.
There are assignments after each lecture, but they are rather simple and straight-forward. Also, those assignments are questions similar to the examples in the powerpoints, which he will explain thoroughly during the lectures.
Also, you just need to hand in 5 out of 19 assignments to get full marks (he will only count the 5 assignments with the highest score.)

There are 2 mid-terms and 1 final. The mid-terms are very easy and straight-forward. You will be able to get full marks if you have revised the mid-terms seriously. Also, he will provide you with mock papers, which are almost identical to the mid-terms' questions. So you will do great if you treat the mock papers seriously.

reviews.author: GUESSSME
reviews.title: Fair grade, low workload, hard to understand, no need memorize at all
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite boring. For those who studied M1 will have advantage cuz there will be some probability questions
reviews.comment_teaching:
It's hard to understand but if you ask in the lessons, prof will answer patiently and make sure you understand it.
The ppt contains little content, it is better for you to attend to understand it or you can watch tutorial video on youtube.
The teaching is pretty fun as well as the prof.
reviews.comment_grading:
As you can have a cheat sheet, so you can simply put everything inside.
Participation: no need (no marks count towards that)
There will be 3 group assignment, you can form group with others online even you dont know them.
The mean of the assignment is pretty high for the first 2 assignment as they are easier.
If you do not really understand the content but have studied the ppt and content and past paper question, you will get below mean a little bit cuz the mean for exam and also quizzes are not high at all.
There will also have 2 quizzes.
I got pretty high marks in first two assignment and marks below mean for both quizzes and exam
I can still manage to get a B-
So i think its not reli strict at all
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy at all. 2 Quizzes and 3 group assignment in total, no individual work.

reviews.author: ustkatielaw
reviews.comment_content: the beginning of the course (up till the second mid-term) was trivial. it was like an introduction to statistics and some calculations about probability and different types of data and distributions. If you studied M1 in HKDSE it should be simple. Even if you didn't have such backgrounds it is very achievable given that you study the materials before the midterms. The difficulty increased by A LOT after the mid-terms as they were about regression. Make sure you understand what is going on.
reviews.comment_teaching: If you understand kawaguchi's english, then you don't know english. his japanese accent makes it extremely difficult to follow during lessons, and he simply talks according to the powerpoint slides. Since attendance is not required, you could skip his lessons and just watch the slides and it wouldn't affect your study at all.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term 1: 20/20
Mid-term 2: 18/20
HW: 20/20
Final: 35/40
overall grade: A

First two mid-terms are rather easy. Kawaguchi directly copies questions from his practice and pastes into the real mid-terms, so study a bit and it should pay off. Homeworks are easy as well as kawaguchi uses excel for teaching, follow the videos and his instructions and you are guranteed to get full marks. kawaguchi is known for his killer long questions in his finals, but due to the special circumstances this semester it was all MC, so the mean was much higher and much easier
reviews.comment_workload: super light workload. No attendance is required and the homework (5 required) shouldn't take more than 20 minutes for each one since there is literally a tutorial guiding you step by step.

reviews.author: kyddet
reviews.comment_content: Course content is actually not THAT difficult. In the first part of his lectures he will teach some basic excel skills which will not be tested on. Then he will start teaching some basic statistics like probabilities, normal distribution etc., which are also relatively easy. At last he will teach about simple regression which is the most difficult part of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Don't expect to understand anything he says during lectures. English is impossible to understand. Yet he tries really hard to explain important concepts and answer questions students ask. Appreciate his sincerity and effort.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is relatively fair. His midterm papers are relatively easier when compared to other professors. He is said to be famous for his killer questions in finals yet due to the special situation this semester we did not have a chance to experience that so I would not comment on his finals. Did not go to 90% of his classes, did homework, was around mean in midterms, got A- in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is really light. Attendance is not compulsory. For homework they are super easy and you only have to finish a few out of all. For exams, there are two midterms (all mc) and one final.

reviews.author: Serene
reviews.title: Interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
Quite hard. For those who have no M1 background like me, it's quite hard to catch up with all the stuff. But actually the topics are quite interesting, I can handle it moderately even I hate maths.

Topic 1 Data description
Topic 2 Probability
Topic 3 Estimation
Topic 4 Hypothesis testing
Topic 5 Simple Linear Regression
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a patient and interesting professor who make jokes during the lesson and answer questions after lessons. She also gives out participation cards when I ask her questions after lessons, so the participation marks are quite easy to earn from her.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not bad. I got a B given that I did not put a lot of effort into quiz and exams.

reviews.comment_workload:
Not big.

4 assignments, 2 quizzes, and a final exam, that's all.
All of the quizzes and exams are MC questions with cheat sheets.

You can find the answers to some assignments online.

Basically, you only need to attend 5 lessons to get full marks in attendance, participate in 2 games and get 3 participation cards from her, or getting 5 participation cards, 10 marks, here you go.

reviews.author: awesomedoncic
reviews.comment_content: The slides is easy to follow with, you need to fill in the blanks on slides during lecture. The lecture slides did mentioned the critical concept. Practice quiz would be given before exam and it's very similar to the real exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor has a very "unique" accent, it's actually hard to understand word that comes out from his mouth.  
Ex: he pronounce "deviation" as "dewiation".
Except the accent issue, most of his teaching is fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 10%
Assignment 10%
Quiz 1 & Quiz 2 45%
Final 35%
Quiz 1 is simple, Quiz 2 is a little harder and  the final is a disaster. You might need to spend more time on the final.
i got full mark in participation, loses some point in homework.
i scored all above mean in Quiz 1 and Quiz 2, only 1 point below mean in final. The total grade shows that i was 3 point above mean and i got a B-. So the letter grade of mean might be around C+ to B-
reviews.comment_workload:
only three assignment are needed and you need to hand it before each exam.
each assignment would only contain 6 to 8 question, only required you to write down your calculation and answer.
very light workload

reviews.comment_content: Probability, Normal Curve, Hypothesis Test, Confident Interval etc.

Some said the prof. is good to have(for mainlanders - the prof. is from mainland - thus can use manderin to ask questions after class).

reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is pretty hash.
There are 2 midterms and 1 final
All 20 Questions each.

In order to have a high mark on the tests, the past papers are important.

There will be 5 pop quizes in class, that count for attentance.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy, 3 assignments.
You can group with your classmates of your choice(max. 3) or do it alone if you are confident in your ability.

PS. Most questions in the assignment has little relation with the lecture. If you want to do well on the assignments, go to the lab sessions(the lab sessions are before the due dates of the assignments).

The TA is goood. If you have questions about the assignments you can ask the TA for help. He will answer you clearly.

reviews.author: puddypie
reviews.title: ISOM Review
reviews.comment_content: Very easy content. Don't really need to attend lectures (but you have to for the attendance points).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Du is very cute. People find him hard to understand due to his accent but I personally find it bearable. Very nice guy who would bother clarifying with you and uses very simple concepts to help you understand the course.
A review session will be given before every Quiz (2 per sem) and a final review. A lot of practice questions will be given to you as well.
I think that doing the practice questions helped alot on my learning as they are fairly repetitive and tests your general knowledge.
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy content but steep bell-curve. 1 mark off and you'll get a B- from a B+.
A cheat sheet can be used during the quizzes and the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is a B*tch.
3 Homeworks are given to self-allocated groups. If you don't have friends like me, and the group allocation message comes in the middle of the night, you'll be left with 2 options:
1) Tank the entire project on your own
2) Form groups with people who are free-riders

The assignment given is fairly simple, and therefore the mean for this is extremely high. I find this the most difficult part of the course.

reviews.author: AL_

reviews.comment_teaching:
Just like everyone said, if you understand his English, then you don't know English.
He went through the materials, with many pauses since the powerpoint is not made by him and he doesn't know what is coming and students ask lots of useless questions to get the participation mark.
He provided some proofs but not much of us understand.
Support is not really enough.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% participation mark
- you get one point if you ask a question in class
- this clever idea make student ask "useful questions" in class :) for example: why is the answer A? Do we need to revise the formula?

15% assignment
- there are 3 assignments that are REALLY HARD
- you need to cooperate and work for hours
- I got 2 of them nearly full marks, spending around 5 hours per 1

40% midterm
- there are 2 midterm
- questions are quite hard and don't think that it will be like the sample midterm
- NOT THE FOCUS DURING LESSON: WHAT HE SKIPPED, WHAT HE TEST
- 20 MC per 1
- the mean is really high, one is 16.3/20, one is 16.4/20

40% Final
- If you have self-esteem, you won't anymore after the exam
- He said there will be 40 MC and turn out we got 2 long questions, require you to proof :)

reviews.comment_workload:
Apart from the hard assignments, the workload is low if you just want to get average grades.
No attendance required but make sure you ask 5 questions since the percentage equals to a full mark assignment.

reviews.author: Po/Alex
reviews.title: Easy but hard to get good grades
reviews.comment_content: Very easy compare with other professor. No need to study computer programming language. Just use simple calculation is fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great English with “Great” accent. He is very good and friendly that you can even ask him to teach the question of paper. He is super nice that you can even find him anytime.
reviews.comment_grading: Since the paper is super easy, many people get high marks. I got 91.3 but only B+. 92.7 is the cut off of A and B.
reviews.comment_workload: No very hard since it only takes three assignments and two exam. You can also bring cheat sheet into the examination venue. It is easy for year one student.

reviews.author: VLi
reviews.title: Strongly recommended if your math is bad
reviews.comment_content:
The things taught in this course is actually quite hard.
Most of it requires you to spend time and understand the logic behind statistics.
I've never skipped a single class in ISOM2500, but I come to class every time clueless and I leave class confused.
You will feel confused, but it's normal, Professor Lancelot understands that you are confused.
He will guide you through the quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Lancelot is a realistic and humorous instructor.
He does not use Python and Minitab and all the extra tools to make the content extra complicated.
He tries his best to explain the contents in the simplest way, to a point I felt like I was stupid to not be able to understand what he was talking about.
All you have to learn is some excel, how to use a calculator and some formulas in his slides.
If you come to class, he will give you a sneak peek of what will be tested in the quizzes.
Just don't be rude in class; don't come late, don't leave early, he really doesn't like it.
reviews.comment_grading:
4-5 Quizzes every once in a while - 40% - released
Finals (not easy at all) - 40% - not released
10% participation - not released
10% Assignment - not released

Despite the low transparency, Professor Lancelot will not give you a bad grade as long as you submit your assignments on time, come to class and do your studying on his slides.

I honestly do not remember most of the things that he taught in class, and I remember not knowing half of the questions in the final exams (40%). I mainly focused on studying the components he said was important during class.

Somehow I got a B+, how? I don't really know.
reviews.comment_workload:
Attendance not compulsory.
2-3 Group Assignments from the textbook.
As long as the workload is distributed well, you will be fine.

The quizzes and finals conducted open book, open notes, and open laptop. Just that you can't use the internet.
So make sure you understand everything before the quiz and finals; in my opinion, understanding everything he was trying to teach requires the greatest effort and attention.

And yes, all quizzes and finals are MC.

reviews.author: Jackie0925
reviews.title: GOOD COURSE ORIGINALLY BUT POOR PROFESSOR
reviews.comment_content:
The content is originally good.

However, the professor uses Python to teach, which makes the course really difficult to understand. Also, the course content has shifted to programming

Only this professor uses Python to teach, which makes the students in this lecture unfair. We have to spend plenty of time to understand how to use Python.

I don't think a business student has to focus so much on programming. I think the professor did not make a wise choice.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The TA, LOK HIU FUNG is totally useless. His manner is extremely horrible. He is not willing to answer students' questions(including face-to-face and email questions). He has a passive manner. He doesn't care about students at all. He is the worst TA I've met in HKUST. I think UST should fire him immediately.

The professor is not very helpful as well, but much better than the TA. He just keeps on teaching but actually, little people understand what he's saying.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is poor as well. The exams are so difficult because of the use of Python. I received a C- in this course. It's hard to compete with students who have a programming background.

The grading scheme is as follow:
four group assignments 50%
mid-term exam 15%
final exam 35%

Everyone got very high marks in the assignments and mid-term exams(since the marking scheme is very loose). Therefore, the only differentiation of the course is the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not very high but it's extremely time-consuming to learn how to use Python. There are four group assignments, one mid-term and one final exam.

reviews.author: BillKam
reviews.title: Rubbish
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly about R studio(Programming).
English is impossible to understand.
If u are year one student and have no background respect to programme , better quit this lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching: Better skip every lessons to save time for your assignments.As u would get nothing after attending the class.Better buy the book and google for the codes u need.
reviews.comment_grading: Well......No comments.Plug many things in , and u can get almost full in your assignments
reviews.comment_workload:
Many programming assignment
Seek help from TA as fast as u can,
One assignment every week on average.
Luckly is that the final exam is very short.

reviews.author: whalewhalewhale
reviews.comment_content:
The first few topics (for the mid-term) are very similar to the M1 curriculum, where you learn topics such as:
- Probability
- Confidence Interval
- Random Variable
- Sampling Distribution
However, the mid-term also covers new topics, including covariance.
As for the final exams, you will learn about linear regression and hypothesis testing.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very willing to help students, and is usually available to have appointments with to ask questions. He also holds optional tutorials before the exams and provides a lot of practice questions that are similar to the exam question types.
However, some may find his accent difficult to understand. Additionally, he may avoid more advanced question types (e.g. MBA level questions) that is provided in the practice questions, as he doesn't think it's necessary for us to learn it, which may limit your learning if you're interested in statistics.
Overall, a pretty good professor.
reviews.comment_grading: The exams are purely MC questions, and are non-cumulative. The mean and SD for this course is pretty high, as the questions in the exams and assignments are quite straightforward.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is a little bit heavy, as the assignments are long question types, and would also require the usage of Excel. However, you may pair up with two more students for the assignments, and the questions are not too advanced and are easy to tackle if you understand what is being taught in class.

reviews.author: charissa
reviews.comment_content: Not the best course if you don't have any background knowledge on statistics. This course not only teaches you general statistics, it also teaches you the program R, which is basically coding for statisticians. If you don't have any knowledge of stats, it will be a little difficult to learn both R and statistics.
reviews.comment_teaching: This professor's english is really not that great. His accent is very strong, and there are times when I really cannot understand what the professor is saying. He also just reads off the powerpoints and doesn't add much of his own knowledge. The powerpoint slides are straight from the textbook, and although he says that the textbook is online, only the first few chapters are. I ended up studying with the textbook, as it explains concepts better than in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 70%
Final: 30%

At the beginning of the semester, the professor told us that there would be 7 assignments, each worth 10%. However, we ran out of time, and we ended up with only 6 assignments. If you attempt every question, you should be able to receive at least a 7/10. However, the assignment cannot be late, or else he will give you a 0.

It's not too difficult to receive high marks on the assignments, so it will provide a cushion for you to not do as well on the final exam. The final exam was very similar to the study guide, so make sure you fill it out.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was ok. One assignment every two weeks, but it was all done on the R program. The assignments differ in difficulty, some questions are able to be done, but some questions were very difficult and can only be done through thorough reading of the textbook. I had to buy the textbook, but for those people who didn't own the textbook, it would be quite hard to complete the assignment.

reviews.author: Jiny
reviews.title: not bad - maybe hard if you haven't took stat before
reviews.comment_content: content itself is not hard. However the professor does not go deep into each concept and his ppt is quite vague.
reviews.comment_teaching: Difficult to understand his teaching - not only due to his accent but also to his vague powerpoint slides. His material focuses more on practical questions which may make it difficult to those who did not get the concept.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean is quite high - you may get a not-so-decent grade even though you did an ok performance due to your smart classmates :(
reviews.comment_workload: three assignments - not so much of workload

Final contents a lot inside his class notes, if you can't remember lots of things together in a short time maybe you can't get good grades in final.

reviews.author: manyan
reviews.comment_content: It is all about R Studio. However, the exam does not include the coding, just only the proof of some probabilities. He only uses the last few lessons to teach the content that is tested in the final.
reviews.comment_teaching: he tries very hard to teach us, but no one understands. It is quite fast for someone don't how to use R.
reviews.comment_grading: for me, it is bad grading. the lesson does not help to improve the skills. on the other hand, it is good that the mark of assignment is 70%, which is much higher than the final 30%.
reviews.comment_workload: each assignment waste a lot of time to do, but i cannot get a good score. Many classmates get a full mark in every assignment, so i totally don't know how the tutors mark the assignment

reviews.author: Nicphobia
reviews.title: Heavy workload in "R" coding
reviews.comment_content: Learn more about using "R" and social issues instead of business cases. There are a lot of examples and concepts in class which benefits me a lot. Only in the last few lecture notes are really related to business statistics while in the beginning, most of them are focusing on social science issues as compare to some of the social science courses in other college.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Strong accent
The notes are what you need for the class, the notes are useful for both exams and assignments.
Some of the concepts are harder, don't miss those class
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 70%
Final 30%
The grades are not really good as compare to other classes, a lot of effort is needed to complete assignments to get a high score which greatly influences the grade as the mean is high.
reviews.comment_workload:
No attendance recorded, and the notes are really important to get a higher score in assignments and exams
For assignments, if you don't know the coding for R, go search online videos from youtube or other sources, spend some time and you will get the way to complete them, sometimes even quicker way is used.
Personally, I spend a lot of time doing the assignments since I focus on coding and reaching a higher score.
The workload is really heavy, if you have a heavy workload courses, suggest you take another prof's course.

reviews.author: February
reviews.comment_content:
Basically statistics and mathematics
Many definition
Not many requirements on application in real life
Maybe too theoretical and basic to be useful
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Du's English is bad and too Chinglish.

I would suggest native English speaker not to enroll in this course.

But if you would like to make appointments with him to ask questions you are confused with, you will find actually he is very nice and patience.

Though sometimes many local student always chat in the class and show no respect to him, he never loses his temper.

If you are not focus on the class and try to figure them out after class, you can seek for Du's help because he is just very kind.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since the course is not hard, it is actually quite competitive
Every test and quiz is important.

Believe it or not, you might know get A that easily.
reviews.comment_workload:
Most of the time you will be required to work in a team so it's better to enroll in the course with your friend.

Workload is light.

reviews.author: Crystalhsu
reviews.title: R language and business statistics
reviews.comment_content:
Kosuke Imai, 2017, Quantitative Social Science: An Introduction, Princeton University Press.

Chapter 1: Introduction
Chapter 2: Causality
Chapter 3: Measurement
Chapter 4: Prediction
Chapter 5: Discovery
Chapter 6: Probability
Chapter 7: Uncertainty

From 1~5 chapters are mostly relate to the introduction of  R language.
From 5~7 chapters are relate to the concepts of business statistics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Hard to understand what the professor said because of the strong accent.
Final examination is unrelated to the content he taught so students had to study by themselves for the final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
7 Assignments >> 70%
final exam >> 30%
reviews.comment_workload:
Super heavy.
The question in the seven assignments were quite unclear. It was hard to realize the meaning for each questions.

reviews.author: H.W.
reviews.title: disaster
reviews.comment_content: The professor demonstrated statistical techniques by using R language. The content includes dealing with business and social problem. The course helps us to know more about data analysis with real data and social experiments.
reviews.comment_teaching: Strong Japanese accent but still able to understand what he's talking about. It's rather clear when showing the demonstrations.
reviews.comment_grading: Really bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Seven assignments in total. There are roughly three to four questions per assignment. You have to spend a lot of time to figure out what the questions exactly talking about, and you have to apply the techniques you learn in class in your work.

reviews.author: Trafalgar Law
reviews.title: New professor: learn coding in "R"
reviews.comment_content:
Has to learn a program language in a platform called "R", but in fact pretty easy. The content is basically standard ISOM 2500 things.
It is quite interesting if you like programming.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His English is basically Japanese. You are welcome to take his course if you are a Japanese or Japanese speaker who understand Japanese-English. To understand his lessons is a disaster for every students
Well but he is indeed a good person and very patient to explain things. So you can understand things as long as you spend time.
After this course, I am trained to understand 70% of what he says, and I am amazed by my hard work hahahhhaa
reviews.comment_grading:
70%assignments, 30%final (WTF??)
NO MIDTERM
In my opinion if you do spend time and effort in doing assignments, the assignments are pretty easy to score full mark.But you really have to try very hard and double-check it again and again.

As the assignments are mostly coding and have definite answer, and at the same time the professor is quite open-minded to issue like marking mistakes, it is quite easy to score good grades for me.
My marks:
Assignment 1 10/10 (mean: 9.8)
Assignment 2 10/10 (mean: 9.5)
Assignment 3 10/10 (mean: 9.4)
Assignment 4 10/10 (mean: 8.9)
Assignment 5 10/10 (mean: 8.2)
Assignment 6 9.5/10 (mean: 8.6)
Final exam: no data
So average for assignment is 9.067. If you wanna have good grade you have to be super serious and careful on assignment. Even a bit mistake can cause you to drop a grade, given that the assignments actually quite easy (but getting harder in the late stages)
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: 1 assignment per 1.5 week. If you are serious about assignment it may take you some time to finish them. For me I am a very serious person who want good grade. So the workload is extremely hard for me. It's like over 10 hours per assignments. Sometimes a spend a whole holiday on it to figure out what to do. As the course is 70% assignment, I really spend lots of time in assignment and it is quite chur for me sometimes actually

reviews.author: FrozenHeat9
reviews.title: Have absolutely no idea what happened throughout this course
reviews.comment_content: The content is mainly about R coding and statistical analyzing. Most other ISOM2500 classes work on trivial business statistics such as sd, mean, bar charts, and so on, so in comparison, the material of our class is extremely difficult even without considering the R coding part. Since the professor it a Japanese, many of its contents are statistical concepts mainly focused by Japanese researchers. Also, the analysis we do in the assignments mainly focuses on social science and economics instead of actual business practice, and I guess this is because the professor is actually from the ECON department (not ISOM) and he used to teach at Hitotsubashi University (which focuses on social and economic studies) before he came to HKUST in 2017.
reviews.comment_teaching: The Japanese professor is nice but his heavy accent is a huge problem for understanding. Also, what he mainly do in class is reading his lecture notes and reciting what the textbook says. Yet, he is actually a nice person and is willing to answer your questions and is never impatient to repeat his answers several times. If you pay a lot of attention in class and ask him questions after class, you could probably understand his teaching (though I tried to and failed).
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 70%
Final: 30%

The assignments are mainly about R coding. Yet, the assignments have unreasonably high means (something around 9/10) and to my suspect, this is because the TA gives out very general scores. I spent a lot of time working on the assignments to get full marks, while some of my friends got 7s and 8s with answers randomly guessed. This is very unfair for students that actually worked hard on the assignments.

As for the final exam, it is mainly about statistical concepts and quantitative reasoning. It consists of 3 parts: True or false (10%), calculations and formula proving (10%), and R code reading (10%). Strangely, the final exam had nothing to do with what we did in the assignments. The final exam is mainly derived from the lecture notes and it seems that the professor expects you to cram and memorize the everything from the 500 pages of powerpoints. Also, surprisingly, some of the questions on the final exam is exactly same as the ones on the mock exam, so it is unwise to skip the mock exam thinking that the actual exam will not have questions from the mock exam (which was exactly what I thought ugh).

As for me, I got an average of 96.67% (58/60) for my assignments and the final exam is not released. Eventually, I got a B+ overall. (WTF)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is unbelievably heavy if you have no basic knowledge of R coding (and I suppose over 90% of our class don't). We usually have an assignment every 2~3 weeks and typically I have to spend 6~8 hours on each assignment to achieve a 10 or 9.5 out or 10. I spent about 16~18 hours cramming the lecture notes before the final exam. The only good news is that the professor did not take attendance (though I suspect he will for his later on classes) and during the latter half of the semester, only about 25 students showed up for his class (full attendance should be somewhere around 80) (and yes I actually counted).

reviews.author: USTAsiaNo1
reviews.title: "Good" grade course with great knowledge
reviews.comment_content: Topic including basic stats and probability, linear regression, and big number theorem, with coding in R
reviews.comment_teaching:
All is good beside the accent of lecturer...
But it greatly effects the class experience...
btw, he is very kind and willing to answer your question

/

If you smart enough and talented in programming, you may learn by reading slides only, it's enough to deal with this class
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean of every assignment is unreasonably high.
It means once you fail one assignment greatly, all your work before is useless.
I got average 94% on my assignment but the final grade is B+, what the...? 94% can't even get an A range? Terrible...

/

70% depends on assignment
30% depends on final exam
reviews.comment_workload:
Huge, extreme, super heavy, unprecedented workload
For each assignment, I spent average 7-8 hours to finish, some of them even overnight.

You are expected to use some programming technique like loop, function.  I learned a bit C++, but I still spent some time to train my skill in R.

reviews.author: Human
reviews.comment_content: 教普通statistics嘢,有M1底會比較好,如果上堂唔明可以上網睇片學,教得更加清楚
reviews.comment_teaching: 佢講英文好難聽,照住個PowerPoint讀,上堂好悶,但你會feel到佢好有心教,有時想搞下笑,落堂之後好歡迎你問佢同TA問題,係一個唔錯嘅professor
reviews.comment_grading:
好grade

Quiz 2: 20%
Final: 40%
Attendance: 5%
全部quiz同final都係MC,同埋可以帶cheat sheet,基本上好易攞高分
my grade:

quiz 2: 17/20
final: 38/40
assignment: 46/52, 60/60, 59/60
attendance: 5/5
最後攞A
reviews.comment_workload: 有3份assignment,可以分組做,問題唔算難,可以幫你溫書,基本上識做assignment就代表你識做quiz同final,考試題目同佢派嘅practice quiz差唔多,做熟曬就可以攞高分

reviews.author: JSS
reviews.title: Try to avoid this prof.
reviews.comment_content:
To be honest, the content was actually exciting. You get to learn about data analyzation through computer program (R),  making predictions based on historic data sets, and how to manipulate the data to obtain what you want.

The only problem is that you can learn them even without attending to the lectures as self-studying with slides actually turned out to be more efficient than participating in lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Although you will see that he is an intelligent researcher, but he is not good at presenting his knowledge to students.

All he does in his class is repeating what's written on the power point.

I'm giving him D because he at least shows efforts to make developments through feed backs from the students.
reviews.comment_grading:
7 Assignments = 70%
1 Final Exam = 30%

Which means one mistake in finals will throw your efforts in assignments into garbage can.
reviews.comment_workload:
7 assignments throughout entire semester and a final exam.

No need to show up in class (actually self-studying with the slides makes it less confusing).

reviews.author: smallpotatoes
reviews.title: Du lilun is good in terms of grading
reviews.comment_content: Fair.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Du has Chinese accent but he actually teaches quite well if you can understand his words. Since ISOM2500 is basic stat so actually you can go to YouTube to learn the same things (which is easier to understand personally saying).

Prof Du teaches sooooo efficiently. Every lecture, we can leave 10-30 mins earlier so it is good if you have to rush for lunch
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good grading.

Assignment 1: 51/52
Assignment 2: 60/60
Assignment 3: 60/60
Quiz 1: 20/20
Quiz 2: 18/20
Final: 37/40

Grade: A (Given that idk what im learning)

Du lilun is good since he will give you a MC practice before mid term and final so it which it is QUITE similar to the real one. Also, it is allowed to have a A4 cheat sheet. So just make sure you understand the MC practice and make good cheat sheet, then you will probably get high marks. AND all the midterms and final are purely MCs.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light. Since the assignments are done in a group so make sure you find a hok bah to carry you or go to the optional tutorial to ask for help from prof/TA who are willing to help you with the homework.

One thing quite troublesome is requiring a hard copy that you need to go to LSK to submit the assignment.

reviews.author: lala2
reviews.comment_content: Content is quite interesting as it covers various theories about business statistics. I can see how it would be useful in data analytics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching involves reading over notes, which are on a A4 slides.  There was overview of some problems during class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was OK i guess, considering how well i thought i mastered the concepts.
reviews.comment_workload:
It is especially difficult if you have not learnt probability concepts up to an advance level before.

Assignments involve answering questions from the textbook and handing it in to his pigeon box.

I did not buy the book (i was in year 1), i think if you want to get a better grade you should buy the book.

reviews.author: viviette
reviews.title: Do Not enroll for this prof
reviews.comment_content: The content in this course is boring, its like taking another calculus course and people who hate dealing with numbers should definitely opt this out.
reviews.comment_teaching: he explain everything clearly
reviews.comment_grading: Grading sucks. Even summary sheets are allowed in midterms and finals, you will realize the questions are out of your expectation and I've got a C- in this course which is an ass hole to my GPA
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is acceptable for people who have took M1 in their highschool. However, for people we dodn't, it's quite a lot of workload.

reviews.author: DINGBII
reviews.comment_content: Ipython notebook and statistics. Content includes estimation, simple linear regression, probability and so on. I do not like the idea of using python for teaching and I think it does not really relate to business statistics.

He displayed his demo coding on the screen but he did not zoom in, making me very difficult to follow.

A total of 4 group assignments, forming groups of maximum 4 people or you can complete the tasks on your own.

reviews.author: StephenCurry30
reviews.title: DO NOT, I REPEAT, DO NOT ENROLL FOR THIS PROFESSOR'S LECTURE
reviews.comment_content: I've learnt most of the things in this course before in high school as I studied ib, so at first I didn't really give a lot of attention to this course. Gradually, as the course gets going on, the content we learnt started to get interesting, and for the first time revising maths that I already knew seemed interesting to me. I'd say the only good thing about this course is its very own materials and syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: Truth be told, I didn't attend must of the lectures. You can say whatever you want about me, but I blame this on the professor. As a freshman, I enjoyed the first lesson because someone actually knows how to make a joke and not be TOO boring. BUT, after I figured the professor is just covering up the fact he couldn't teach well and is just reading out the notes, well screw this course I'm not wasting time on this. You should also know the teaching itself deserves a D grading, but the fact I got such a grade out of it pisses me off, so there goes a E.
reviews.comment_grading: I got, like, above mean for both mid terms, and one SD above mean for the final exam. Guess what I got. A FREAKING B- . Now you know how freaking bad this is. And don't misunderstand me when I say this, because I do sound like a whiny coward: this is definitely the professor's fault. I got a friend who performed worse than me, and got a freaking B+. Now where's the logic in that.
reviews.comment_workload: Each assignment contains a certain amount of questions that are unreasonably challenging. Upon reading all the notes and course materials, I still fail to complete the tasks and had to rely on other's help in one or two questions. Furthermore, there are three assignments handed out, so you can imagine how difficult it was.

reviews.author: wwwboy24
reviews.comment_content: Additional topics were taught in compare with other professors (e.g. Inference of two population means and variances).

A point to note is his notes were well written, but it was essential to jot down notes in every lesson in order to obtain solutions for the questions in his notes for revision.

Top 10% for A range.
Median grade is probably around C+.

Note that a lot of questions required us to use Minitab software, which is not a free software we could obtain. We were supposed to complete the problems using the built-in Minitab in campus barn.

reviews.author: thearrow17
reviews.comment_content: Requires understanding of programming (Python) but the actual statistics part is not very hard. Had many classmates coming out of every class not knowing what he was talking about and copying down wrong codes

reviews.comment_grading:
Final was above mean 0.65 SD

Got full marks for all assignments

But still got a B...

What is this...
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not heavy at all. As long as you know what you're doing, the 5 group assignments (accounting for 50% of the grade) will no take very long.

reviews.author: Shini
reviews.comment_content: Content was ok. First he taught a lot of basic stuff about business statistics including mean, mode, standard deviation, etc. Then he went on with more complex stuff like confidence intervals, samples.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching honestly was one of the worst. This was because he pronounces a lot of words wrongly, so its hard to understand what he is saying. He often just read off the presentation slides, so might as well stay at home and read it yourself since it saves u time and workload. He didn't really take attendance, so don't worry about that.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Work load was average, just 4 homework in total, which was easy at first, then harder when it got to the later teaching materials.

reviews.author: yjkimaa
reviews.title: Bad subject
reviews.comment_content:

I would not recommend this professor.
reviews.comment_grading:

reviews.author: aejonathan
reviews.title: Good grading course
reviews.comment_content:
In this course there are 2 midterms and 1 final.
The material for the first midterm is about basic probability and some statistics theory.
The second midterm covers about normal distribution and confidence interval.
And the final covers about linear regression and hypothesis testing.
reviews.comment_teaching: As an international student, I find it really hard to understand what he is saying. I came only to his first two lectures and it was useless for me. However, he does try his best to make sure everybody understand the material and answer to all of his students questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is really good ( just like most of ISOM 2500 professors I think ).

24% Midterm 1 ( mean : around 19/24 )
24% Midterm 2 ( mean : 14/24 )
40% Final ( mean : 23.5 / 33 )
12% Assignment ( there are 4 assignments )
reviews.comment_workload:
The exams are not cumulative and we can bring 2 sided A4 cheat sheet so we do not have to memorize any formulas. Plus, if we come to the last lecture before any of the exams, Du Lilun will tell what will be tested.

The assignment is not hard as well. Each assignment have around 5 problems and we are given around 2 weeks to finish it. We can also form a group up to 3 people to do the assignment.

Overall, I think the workload is really light.

reviews.author: EthanKhor

reviews.comment_grading: Grading is okay.

For quizzes, the questions are quite hard. I did all the practice questions before quizzes and can still get 1 out of 3 questions correct only.

reviews.author: Ghosttt
