reviews.author: Stranger
reviews.title: Good guy
reviews.comment_content: Lots of people have talked about it. So i am not going to repeat.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching suits me. If you really listen to him, then you will find out that he really makes sense. But if you are lost, then textbook will be a good reading material to catch up although i have not read it myself. But according to him, he is strictly following it. He is a very good guy. So ask him is also a good way to solve your doubt. He will try his best to answer your questions. And one thing really great about this guy is he replies to email very very fast. I usually count to three, then I got his reply as it is an instant chatting.
reviews.comment_grading: Even if you just sit there, writing nothing in the exam, you still get a pass. Of course, because all the questions are in multiple choice question form, it is just non sense if you literally choose nothing. But since everyone is taking the course, it might be a good news to you. Because some student are really bad at quantitative stuff, it is easy for you to get a good grade. But none of those stuff are truly difficult, just apply the formula even if you know nothing behind the formula. Compared to the math course provided in ust, this is really a simple course. Even you did not attend the lecture, you can still get a sense of what is going on. So good grade to me overall.
reviews.comment_workload: Nothing much to work on. Because it is just apply the formula.  I remembered there is teamwork. So if you have some reliable teammates, then the workload for you should just be zero. He will hand out some sample papers to you before the exam. For the final exam, I just spend couple of hours to review then found the exam really easy. None of his exams are difficult...

reviews.author: dhunter123
reviews.comment_content: Tough content, mainly revolved around VAR and other finance related statistic theory. Understandable if you put in the work as well as some outside research. Prior knowledge of statistics is very helpful.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Fitzgerald is incredible and goes above and beyond to help his students if they need it. You need to be proactive about asking questions or setting up meetings, but he'll go the extra mile to help you succeed.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading mainly based on quizzes and attendance, if you participate in class and put in effort you'll have nothing to worry about.
reviews.comment_workload: Besides studying, workload wasn't bad at all.

reviews.author: CarmenWong
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1 Data description
•-Recognizing the type of data
•-Using graphs to see the characteristics of data
•-Summarizing messy data into neat numbers

Topic 2 Probability
•-Probability
•-Random variable, distributions

Topic 3 Random variables
•-Discrete random variables: Bernoulli, Binomial distribution
•-Continuous random variables: Uniform, normal distribution, t-distribution

Topic 4 Estimation
•-Point estimate, Sampling distribution
•-Confidence intervals

Topic 5 Hypothesis testing
•-One sample, statistically significant?
•-Errors of statistical testing: Type I and Type II errors
•-Two independent samples significantly different?
•-Examining relationships for nominal and ordinal data

Topic 6 Simple Linear regression
•-Basic concept
•-Checking model assumption
•-Prediction and estimation

*Topic 4 & 6 are not easy to digest. Make sure you understand the concepts. If you have any questions, just ask Lucy!!
reviews.comment_teaching: She is passionate about teaching. All the classes were well-prepared and PPT was clear. In each lesson, she spent 10-15 minutes to have a quick revision of the materials of the last lesson. Her teaching was excellent because she could explain those concepts very clear. She was so patient to answer students' questions. She was awesome!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 20%
Quiz 2 20%
Exam 40%
Homework 20%

*Actually, you can treat quizzes as mid-term exams. I didn't perform well in both quizzes but I put extra effort into the exam and homework. Finally, I got B+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was acceptable. We just had 4 homework to do throughout the semester and it was not difficult at all. She was willing to answer questions regarding the homework. She was so nice!!!

reviews.author: Archie
reviews.comment_content:
Various interesting statistical concepts which can be applied to the real world easily.
However, the course starts off pretty easy with relatively easy concepts but advances fairly quickly.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lucy was a very good teacher and she knew her concepts very well. Her accent was easily understandable and she replied to your queries via mail very efficiently.
She also gave breaks during class where she played music which was quite soothing.
reviews.comment_grading:
The first exam was fairly easy but we had no time to finish it. But after feedback, the next few exams weren't too time-constrained.
I did this class online so all the exams were open book so I didn't have to memorize the very lengthy formulae.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 4 hw sets worth 100 marks but you finish it as a group so it isn't too much work.
Reviewing the concepts in class is enough to score above average in the exams.

Lucy is nice. She is willing to answer students' questions.  
Sometimes she would put us in breakout rooms to discuss the questions.

***although there is no attendance mark, you can't really skip the lesson too often. If you always skip the lesson, she MIGHT deduct points at the end of the semester on a case-by-case basis.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 20%  
Quiz 2 20%  
Exam  40%  (topic 5&6)
Homework 20% (total 4 homework; 5% each)

Basically quiz and exam are non-cumulative.
Need to show clear steps in your answers (in all homework, quiz and exam) in order to get full mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is fair. Homework consists of 10-15 questions and it is done in a group of four. (You guys can divide the work, so probably you only have to do 2-3 questions for one homework.)
In my opinion, topic 6 is the most difficult topic in this course. You have to spend extra time understanding it.

reviews.author: cyt.ust
reviews.comment_content: Basic statistical knowledge. Easier to understand if you have prior knowledge such as studying M1 in secondary school. The foundation of future courses such as ISOM2020 and ISOM2600. Need to understand the concepts clearly. Probably you need to remember the content after a winter semester, so make sure you still remember and ensure you know what has happened.
reviews.comment_teaching:
One of the best professors in my life at HKUST. Encourage students to think and ask questions. Always smile and be kind to students. Because of his standard accent and clear logic, it is very easy to follow.
Usually, he can finish the lecture 10 - 15 minutes before the "official end time", which leaves rooms for Q&A. (or let you leave the room earlier and relax)
reviews.comment_grading:
Not sure about grading.
Mid-term above mean around 1-2 SD.
The final Exam was above mean but forgot about the statistics.
All assignments above mean.
Some iPRS for attendance record only. No grading purpose is involved.
Got an A- at the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
Inchi usually releases the lecture notes 1 - 3 days before the lecture. I will go through them 1 - 2 times beforehand. I did revision right after the lecture and no extra effort is needed for me.
2 (maybe 3?) "little" group assignments, each one takes around an hour or two.
I guess ISOM 2500 is an average workload course when compared to other courses I've taken in the same semester.

She is a nice and patient professor! We can ask questions in English, Cantonese, and mandarin in the Q&A session. Also, she likes repeating some important concepts or formulas in every lesson. She distributed exercises every week and just for self-learning.

She teaches quite fast, you will definitely get lost if you miss one lesson, luckily we can rewatch the lecture videos in this semester.

reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate. You can choose your groupmates. Make sure to find 3 more friends to be your groupmate to finish the assignments. We didn't have free-riders in our group and thus reduce a lot of workloads.

The lab sessions are not compulsory and the TA mainly taught you how to do your assignment by Minitab. I saw many classmates just skip them.

reviews.author: Noah.
reviews.comment_content:
not deep and quite easy.
however, this may not help in future study
reviews.comment_teaching:
though the accent is bit challenging but he is a very nice teacher
he is willing to give help and feedback as long as you ask for help\
so it is a nice experience to have his lesson
reviews.comment_grading:
very good.
kawaguchi gave a+ very easily as i feel
and the exam content is rather easy as well
reviews.comment_workload:
very little.
i think only some spreadsheets exercise after each lecture.
but very easy and only need to do 5(? of all

reviews.author: KLler
reviews.title: Nice Prof
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1 Data description
- Just introducing different types of data

Topic 2 Probability
- Mostly high school probability stuff + Bayes' Rule

Topic 3 Random variable
- Types of random variable
- Discrete probability distribution
- Continuous Probability Distribution
- Uniform distribution, Normal distribution

Topic 4 Estimation
-  Concepts for sampling distribution
- Point estimation
- Confidence interval

Topic 5 Hypothesis Testing
- Errors of statistical testing
- Test for population mean
- Test for population proportion and independence

Topic 6 Simple Linear Regression
- Basic concepts for regression
- Linear model assumptions and how to check on it
- Statistical inference for regression parameters
- Prediction and Estimation
Personally think that topic 4 and 6 requires longer time to understand the concepts
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lucy is a nice prof. She answers students' questions very patiently and will give examples to help you understand.
She will summarize what we have learnt in the previous lesson at the beginning of each lesson to make sure you can follow up. Her teaching and the powerpoint are very clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair. As long as you do the practice quiz you will secure a good mark
Group Hw (20%, 5% for each)
HW1: 100/100 (Mean 96.6)
HW2: 94/100 (Mean 94.3)
HW3: 100/100 (Mean 94.4)
HW4: 95.5/100 (Mean 96.2)
Quiz (20% each)
Quiz1: 58/100 (Mean 54.2, SD: 12.3)
Quiz2: 91/100 (Mean 84.3, SD: 14.1)
Final (40%): 90/100 (Mean 84.5)
Letter grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload.
Only 4 hw with around 10 questions and it's working in groups. But you might need to spend some time on checking ur grpmates' answers and might meet some freerider...

reviews.author: Stephen Chow
reviews.title: Need to work hard
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1 Data description
Summarizing messy data into neat numbers

- Recognizing the type of data
- Using graphs to see the characteristics of data -  

Topic 2 Probability  
- Probability
- Random variable, distribution
- Discrete random variables: binomial distribution  
- Continuous random variables: normal distribution, t distribution

Topic 3 Estimation
- Point estimate
- Sampling distribution
- Confidence intervals

Topic 4 Hypothesis testing  
- One sample, statistically significant? Using t test
- Errors of statistical testing: Type I and Type II error - Two independent samples significantly different? Using t test
- Examining relationships for nominal and ordinal data – Chi-square test

Topic 5 Simple linear regression
- Basic concept
- Checking model assumption
- Testing beta
- Prediction and Estimation

Topic 6 Multiple linear regression basic
reviews.comment_teaching:
The prof is nice and would hold Q&A sessions before exams.

He has a strong accent.

The teaching pace varies from time to time. You are expected to do revision by yourself.

He likes using python to demonstrate some calculations so if you know python, you will be of advantage.

The TA Issac is very responsible and he has provided us with lots of well-structured notes and tutorial videos!!!!

Friendly prof, great TA
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 10%

Quiz 2  20%

Final Exam 50%

Homework 10%

Participation 10%

(Participation is taken based on answering the pollings uploaded to Canvas in each lesson. The calculation is quite lenient, ~answer >70/80% of questions, you will get a full mark for it. You can earn the points for each question as long as you have answered it. )

Based on taking the curve, quite competitive

The final exam is quite difficult and you won't have sufficient time to complete it.

The grading is not as good as thought, need the luck to get an excellent grade
reviews.comment_workload:
High

Needa do lots of self-revision.
I strongly recommend you read the textbook and you can try to attend some other profs lectures if you are interested.

Good Luck! :)

reviews.author: puiman
reviews.comment_content:
useful content
easy to learn
-probability
reviews.comment_teaching: Lucy好nice，好用心答學生問題。教書都好清晰，教完會系下堂review翻上堂既重點。PowerPoint好好，簡略精要，無乜垃圾。Email都好快复。QUIZ 之前又會有個quiz review.
reviews.comment_grading:
Group Hw (20%) (5%each)
Hw1 89 (mean 89)
Hw2 88 (mean 90)
Hw3 100 (mean 95)
Hw4 86 (mean 80)
Quiz 1 (20%) 58 (mean 56)
Quiz 2 (20%) 86 (mean 83)
Final (40%) 98 (mean 85)
Letter grade: B-
reviews.comment_workload:
four group hw
2 quiz
mid term
final

reviews.author: Bran
reviews.title: Good professor
reviews.comment_content:
Part 1 Data description, only highschool stuff
Part 2 Probability, also highschool stuff with some new things like Bayes formula
Part 3 random variable
Part 4 Estimation
Part 5 Hypothesis Testing
Part 6 Simple Linear Regression
personally I think parts 4 & 6 are the most difficult one but once u understand the concept it'll be easy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lucy is nice and flexible. I remember that my homework groups fail to submit the hw b4 deadline becuz of communication problems tho we finished it days b4, she accepted our submission without deducting marks.
Also my frd forgot to submit last page in the first quiz and she deducted half the mark.
She replied emails very fast and opened more office hour for us to revise b4 the final. She will try her best to answer students inquiries.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 20%
Quiz 2 20%
Final Exam 40%
4 Homeworks each with 5%
I get 66/100 in Quiz 1 with +0.5sd (mean 60)
100/100 in quiz 2 (mean 86, +1sd)
100/100 in final (mean 88, +1.sth sd)
Final grade A
But I hear someone who skip Quiz 1 and get 90sth in both quiz 2 and final get A+ since Quiz 1 is the most difficult one.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light, only 4 Homeworks and works in groups to complete, but I suggest that u guys need to check the answers of ur teammates.
Need spend some time understanding the concept at the final stage of this course like regression and confidence interval.

reviews.author: GabrielC
reviews.title: A Great Course, but difficult content
reviews.comment_content:
The content is good. Basically covers 4 parts: Data and Variation, Probability, Inference and Regression. Basically Core Maths and M1 in Secondary School for the first few lessons. Then things become more difficult and hard to understand when go to variance and confidence level.
Remember to study well and do not forget the contents in this course because ISOM 2600, a compulsory coding course for all business students are based on all the things in this course and the professors assume you know everything before taking ISOM 2600.
Two tutorials in total (But changed to 1 at last due to the suspension of classes in November)
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Hu is a really good Prof. with detailed explanation and lecture slides. He tried to explain all things in an easy way. But the content is still difficult, especially if you do not study M1 in secondary school. He is helpful to answer you all the questions. For local students, usually we ask the TA- Yvonne instead of Prof. Hu as we can ask her in Cantonese. The TA is also helpful and willing to answer all the questions. She is willing to answer even we ask for half an hour after the classes. The things become much clear. But during tutorials, she spoke too fast and sometimes you cannot listen clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
80% for midterms and finals
Method 1： 20% Midterm 1, 20% Midterm 2, 40% Final Exam
Method 2:  5% Midterm 1, 25% Midterm 2, 50% Final Exam
15% Assignments (Originally 3, but turn to 2)
5% Attendance
Midterm 1, Final Exam: Slightly Below Mean
Midterm 2: Slightly Higher than mean
Assignments: Full Mark
Attendance: Unknown
Final Grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: Assignment workload is light actually. Group Project with just a few questions. (Actually the questions can be done alone) But there are two midterms. Practice questions are given. All MC and 1 cheat sheet is allowed. The midterms and final is not cumulative, but you need to use the previous knowledge to answer the questions. Keep doing practice questions and your grade will not be too bad.

reviews.author: Saik
reviews.comment_content: Starts with basic statistics such as mean mode(if you are a local student, here the mode means differently, both local mode and global mode are counted as mode, it is like the local and global maxima in maths) median percentile etc. Some normal distribution(basically M1 stuff) and t-distribution, crammers rule, hypothesis test and linear regression are covered. Pretty useful contents. If you attend tutorials you are also going to learn excel stuff, but they are optional.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Du's accent is understandable but not very friendly. Overall, he teaches OK but not well. If you can speak mandarin you may ask him questions in mandarin and he explains much better than his lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good.
40% midterm*2 @20%)
40% Final
18% HWs
2% participation (everyone gets full)
My scores:
Means are approximates
MT1: 19/20 Mean 16
MT2: 19/20 Mean 16
HW1: 98/100 Mean 89
HW2: 98/100 Mean 90
HW2: 96/100 Mean (Forgot)
Final: 30/40 Mean 22.X High 37
Overall : About 86/98 (yes its 98 since the 2% parti was not counted)
Final grade: A

As long as you understand all concepts and complete the exercises given, u should have no problem with exams except that you may have some careless mistakes.
Final was conducted online, and to prevent cheating, only 80 mins (supposed to be 3 hrs) were allowed for 40 questions. The time was tight but reasonable if you are familiar with the materials. I (and a few others) did the final on iPad and there was a technical issue that figures didn't show. It wasted me a lot of time and finally I had to switch to desktop, ending up having not enough time. But given that I still get A after messing up so much, the grading was fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair. There are only 3 or 4 assignments and they are all in groups. If you have good teammates then it will be no big deal. The main workload for me was actually to go through the textbook once myself for a more detailed explanation (lecture notes are not enough).

reviews.author: cutiejeff
reviews.title: Overall ease subject
reviews.comment_content:
provided 40% of the grading through easy in class quiz, which usually are 2~5 MCs and Lancelot would sometimes even tell us the answers of 1~2 MCs, so basically free 40% grading.

The other 60% of the grading are graded through an open notes open laptop exam. Which focused mostly on the topic regression, which he spent nearly 2 months to teach.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lancelot is very humorous, and his lessons are often very chill and funny, sometimes, he would let us leave early for over half an hour because that day was too hot for teaching. So easy lesson and just basically focus on regression topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think his grading is relatively easy and he mentioned that he would give around 20% a range.

Final is relatively hard, as the questions require analysis of the case and does require us to be familiar with the functions of various statistical tests.
reviews.comment_workload: Nearly no workload for his lessons, there are no tutorials and labs for him, no midterm and no homework as well. Most people that are attentive will simply skip lessons after half of the semester. And basically 40% people just come to quiz and leave right after it.

reviews.author: hogan_w
reviews.comment_content: Basically about simple statistics. The content is easy at first, but it gets significantly harder after the first midterm. So BEWARE!
reviews.comment_teaching: KAWAGUCHI is a really passionate teacher. His accent may be difficult to comprehend at times (PAT-TERN~~). It gets much better once you get used to it.
reviews.comment_grading: People say it's similar to M1 in DSE extended maths. I did M2 but still find it manageable. Got A+ at last.
reviews.comment_workload: We only have to complete 5 out of 20 excel homework. Apart from revisions for the midterms and finals there's not much else.

reviews.author: Boeing787
reviews.comment_content:
1. The first 8~9 lectures covers basic statistical concepts, such as mean, mode, standard deviation and Venn diagrams. This is covered in secondary school mathematics and should be breeze to most students.

2. Things started to get a little more complex when random variables were introduced in the 9/10th lecture. The difficulty of the content increased significantly and you really have to go through the powerpoint slides and attend lectures to grasp the content. Topics that were covered included hypothesis testing, random variables and regression model. If you did not take any statistics course in high school, the second half of the course could be a little challenging for you and much effort must be placed in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, his command of the English language isn't good. His strong Japanese accent proved to be a source of entertainment for many during the first few lectures. You must be extremely attentive to understand what he is teaching. Apart from his spoken English, his teaching isn't too bad. He spends a lot of time explaining concepts that are harder to grasp and provides written examples on the board. It is not a good idea to skip lectures as these explanations and examples cannot be found on the powerpoint slides.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 1-20%
Midterm 2-20%
The mean for the first two midterms are quite high. Quite a few questions in the midterms can be found in the practice exam sets so attempting them would be really beneficial.

Finals- 40%
Finals was surprisingly easier than expected.

Assignments- 20%

There are 20 homework assignments, each scored out of 4 points. However, only the top 5 assignments will be chosen and graded. Although you only need to submit 5 assignments, I completed all assignments for extra practice. I found it quite useful and it aids my understanding in the concepts covered. The assignments are easy and each should be take less than an hour to complete.
reviews.comment_workload:
You don't need to revise much for the first 8~9 lectures, since the content is largely similar to secondary school mathematics. Expect to spend more time in the latter chapters.

The assignments are easy to handle and should take less than 1 hour to complete.

reviews.author: notcarrot
reviews.title: Good grade, good professor
reviews.comment_content:
Descriptive Statistics I
Descriptive Statistics II
Probability
Conditional Probability
Discrete random variable
Covariance and portfolio
Mid term 1
-------------------------------
Continuous random variable
Sampling distribution
Con dence interval
Mid term 2 (M1 stuff in dse)
-------------------------------
Hypothesis testing I
Hypothesis testing II
Simple Linear Regression
Curved patterns and transformation
Regression estimation and prediction
Regression diagnosis
Final exam
reviews.comment_teaching:
Strange accent, it is not hard to hear but you would be confused about some of his words
good powerpoint as it included all the formula and required concepts
all stuff appeared in the mid term would not appear in the final exam, which means they are independent (including mid term 1 and mid term 2)
reviews.comment_grading:
20% each for mid term (mean:16.xx)
40% for final exam (mean:23.xx)
2% for parti (excluded in this semester)
6% each for homework (>90%)
I got 91% something out of 98% and got an A finally
It is a fair grading system
reviews.comment_workload:
light workload frankly speaking
you would do 3 assignments in total in a group with maximum of three people, and the TA would answer your doubt
you could study the exams three days before and you would still could get above mean

reviews.author: ThisIsMe
reviews.comment_content: The content was fine in the beginning but as the semester went on it got harder but if you pay attention in lectures and attempt all of the practice questions, it should be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very helpful when asked a question. Based on previous reviews, I expected his accent to be difficult to understand but I didn't find it it hard to understand him. Before the mid-terms and finals he provided a set of questions, some of which were very similar to the actual questions on the exam.
reviews.comment_grading: There were three assignments for which we chose a group ourselves. The other parts included 2 mid-terms and one final exam. However, the assignments and the exams had simple questions which increased the mean a lot, making it difficult to get a good score.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was minimal as the assignments could be done by three people together so there would be around 2 questions to be done per person. Depending on how hard you want to work, you could attempt to do the set of questions provided by the professor.

reviews.author: yedward
reviews.comment_content:
Very basic statistics knowledge, covers Probability Theory, Statistical models, Z&T-test, and knowledge related to experiment-conducting.
Ain't a big deal if studied AP Statistics before, just pay attention to the details (some may be different from what you have learned) and practice regularly and you'll be good.
很基本的统计学知识，包括Probability，正态分布，假设检验，以及实验方法论等
高考的选修数学里面有涉及，国际生的AP Statistics内容则基本涵盖了这门课的课纲，所以假如是AP Sta考了四分以上，学这门课基本没有什么难度，细心+多完成Kawa布置的Excel作业就可以了。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Have to admit that he HAS accents, but I got used to it after three or four classes and able to know what he was talking 'bout.
Really responsible teacher, his slides contain EVERYTHING you need, and the videos he made about using Excel are really dope. Just spend some time imitating his videos would make you learn so much.
Sometimes may speak a little bit fast, but generally covers everything in his lecture.
All in all, the ONLY problem is his accent.
必须为川口老师正名一波。
他的口音确实很重，也很多人吐槽，但真的真的是个很负责任的好老师，讲的很细致，语速有可能偏快但重要内容会重复，而且态度真的超级超级nice5555555
还会给大家录自己操作excel的视频，简直零基础小白的福音！！！强烈安利
reviews.comment_grading:
20% for assignments
20% for midterm 1 (20 MC questions)
20% for midterm 2 (20MC questions)
40% for final exam (40MC questions)

*Exams are not hard, just pay attention to details(one mistake would kill...)
*考试真的不难，但容易阴沟翻船，千万小心
reviews.comment_workload:
Really small workload. Attendance is not required.
Every lecture has one practice assignment, which makes it about 20 assignments every term, BUT you only have to get a 4 on FIVE OF THEM to get a full mark in the assignment part.
Yet it is still recommended to try every assignment for they are really fun and intuitive.
不计考勤，作业一共20个，但只要在其中五个拿到4分 作业分就满了。 不过还是推荐每个都认真做，真的很有帮助！

reviews.author: Siumaigor
reviews.comment_content:
The content is well prepared and the course mainly focuses on the application side of statistics, so need not worry about rigorous maths proof
Syllabus:
- Data and variation.
- Time series data.
- Transform data.
- Probability and its rules.
- Tools for organizing probability.
- Probability models.
- Variance and volatility of investments.
- Association and dependence.
- Covariance and portfolio.
- Normal probability distribution.
- Sampling.
- Sampling distributions.
- Standard errors and confidence intervals.
- Statistical hypothesis testing.
- Fitting equation to data.
- The simple regression model. ( Everything learned before is preparing you to delve into this course's most important part!! Regression is used to do forecasting!)
- Inference about SRM
- Introduction to multiple regression.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Hu teaches very clearly by explaining the concepts in details. He included some experiment during the class which helped us to understand the concept better.
reviews.comment_grading:
My grade: A

Grading system:
Attendance: 5%
Assignment: 15%
Exams: 80%

2 group assignments.

Each format of midterm1,2 and final will be all multiple choices.

Method 1: midterm1*20%+midterm2*20%+final*40%
Method 2: midterm1*5%+midterm2*25%+final*50%

My score:
Attendance: 5/5
Assignments: 18/25
Midterm1: 23/23, ( mean:18.8)( coverage: data, variation, and probability)
Midterm2: 24/25, ( mean: 20.2)( main coverage: confidence intervals, hypothesis testing)
Final: 39/44, ( mean: 29, sd: 6.14)( main coverage: Regression)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively light. There are only 2 assignments and 2 in-class experiments (count as participation). It is an easy and chill course. What you have to do is just attend the lecture and finish the revision exercise before midterm and final.

reviews.author: Heliumet
reviews.title: A good test on self study skill
reviews.comment_content: The course is well designed from the use of excel to introduction of statistics. It is much more than the compulsory part of maths. Professor has all the course materials online so you can always refer to it. The statistics part is also useful to analyse reallife business examples.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Don't expect too much from him. It seems that the powerpoint used by him was not actually made by him, so sometimes he didn't really know how to explain the things in it. The bigger issue is that whether you can simultaneously convert his Japanese accent to everyday English.

Anyway, one thing is excellent here -- no attendence is taken.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is wonderfully lenient.
20% HW, take the top 5 out of 19 HW, easy to get full mark in this aspect.
20% per midterm, where there are 2. So a total of 40%. One MC, one percent. The MC is not that difficult in midterms, just a bit tricky somehow.
40% for final, also 40 MCs. More difficult than the previous but some questions you might seen from mock exam or pastpaper, so better to practice with the sources you have.

For reference, my score around +1 sd position and get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload in the course is HW. While actually each assignment can be done within 10 minutes. And you only have to do 5 of them throughout the whole term. Each assignment carries 4 marks, so not difficult to get a full mark, especially for the first few assignments, it requires very basic techniques of using excels, just copy what he did in the lesson -- a guarenteed full mark. After you done 5 full-mark HW, you can actually ignore the rest of them. Of course you can still do it as practice.

reviews.author: Stardust
reviews.title: Good Course but Needs Carefulness
reviews.comment_content: Basic prob and stat, sampling, confidence interval, hypothesis testing, simple regression. Emphasis is put on how to use the formulas (plugging the numbers in), not rigorous mathematical proofs (which is a nightmare for many people, I suppose). Students with strong prob and stat background (e.g. took HKDSE M1 or stat-related subjects in high school) generally have an advantage here. But I took M2 instead of M1, and was perfectly fine with the teaching.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof and TA explain concepts clearly and are willing to answer questions face-to-face and via emails. No attendance taking.
Tips: Don't try to skip classes unless u are a genius. Prof's notes are too simplified for understanding the course content, but is good for following his teaching in class and for revision. Studying the textbook before every lesson can help u follow the in-class teaching. Also prof will tell u what the main focus of the quizzes and finals will be (e.g. types of questions that definitely won't appear) so it's good to go to classes.
Had 2 tutorials, before assignments 1 and 2 respectively to help with Excel techniques related to data handling. Not necessary if u are already very familiar with Excel, but highly recommended if u aren't.
Prof has a bit of his own accent, but easy to follow once u get used to it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Got 9X-100 in the 3 assignments. Mean was around 90.
Quizzes (MT) 1&2 are easy and similar to the practice questions and sample quizzes given. Scored 19/20 each.
Quiz 1 mean: 16.11, SD: 3.14
Quiz 2 mean: 16.38, SD: 3.40
Final was online in this semester and had tight time constraint to minimise the chance and effect of cheating. 40 MCQs in 80 mins. Didn't have enough time to finish all. 33/40, 4 were careless mistakes and 3 were those I really didn't had enough time to think about.
Final mean: 23.86, SD: 6.59, highest: 37/40
Overall grade: A (slightly above 90%)
reviews.comment_workload:
3 assignments, each with about 7 questions. Some of them needs Excel for plotting graphs. Can work on your own, or form a group with up to 3 members.
Easy if u understand the concepts thoroughly and have done a bit of related practice questions beforehand, and have a non-freerider groupmate.

reviews.author: grindingalways
reviews.comment_content: It covers a variety of topics such as data description, probability, sampling distribution, confidence interval, hypothesis testing, simple regression model and multiple regression model. Won't be taught too in-depth overall. The lecture notes that Professor Hu is using are of GREAT quality. They are clear, easy to follow and good for self-study purpose (of course you have to listen to his explanation in class first to avoid confusion).
reviews.comment_teaching: Honestly, his English accent was not good and often stirred up confusion. HOWEVER, I adapted to his teaching style eventually and he actually is a very great lecturer. If you pay more attention in class, you will understand what he is saying. Of course, you can raise questions anytime during lecture and he will be very happy to address them. He will also reply to your email within a day (which is already quite fast amongst professors), usually within a few hours. All in all, he is an easy approaching person who you can talk to directly in Mandarin (he is a Taiwanese) if you feel more comfortable with the language.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolutely great with the 2-grading system:
1. mid term 1 20%, mid term 2 20%, final 40%, assignment 15%, attendance 5%
2. mid term 1 5%, mid term 2 25%, final 50%, assignment 15%, attendance 5%
The second system is set up to encourage students to work harder to make a huge comeback even if they have flopped the first mid term. I am the perfect example of this case. I overlooked the whole last page in the first mid term and left all the questions there blank. And the system SAVED my life. My results:
mid term 1: 19/23 (mean: 18.6)
mid term 2: 25/25 (mean: 20.8)
final: 41/44 (mean: 28, SD: 7.04)
assignments: full marks
attendance: full marks
Got an A+ in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say not high not low. 2 consecutive mid-terms can already make you consume quite a considerable amount of time for revision. There are also 2 assignments (which were supposed to be 3), where you worked as a group of 3-4 people. I got assigned to be in a group of free-riders, but usually 1 assignment only takes you 1 day to completely finish, so no big deal anyway.

reviews.author: Karlbear
reviews.title: Du Lilun is very nice! !!
reviews.comment_content: Quite interesting, the first and second part is similar to DSE M1 “probability”, but more detailed! The third part is about hypothesis testing and regression, which are more challenging but still can be solved.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sometimes I feel he just follow and read(?) the ppt, but can explain sth confusing. He is very nice and willing to answer your questions during and after the lesson, so it is quite good. TA is also nice!
reviews.comment_grading:
In the beginning, I think this course is quite competitive as the exams are all MC and the mean for two midterms are very high. One mark can let you die! But because of the recent event, the final is changed to online model and is more DIFFICULT than I think. If you try to understand the content and do the practice, you should be confident!!
Midterm 1 （20%） me: 19/20
Mean：16.3
Midterm 2（20%） me: 19/20
Mean：16.4  SD：3.4
Final（40%）me: 34 /40
Mean：23.86  SD：6.59
Assignment（18%） me: 96/100 100/100   97/100
Mean：91.5 93.5 86.9
Overall: 89.58/98( I don’t know how he calculate 2% participation)
GRADE: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 3 Assignment with 6-7 questions involving calculation and Excel, you can do it individually or in group ( I have no friends, so...sad). I think the workload before exam should be high as you should finish the Assignment and do the practice questions if you want to achieve the high grade.
Overall, not very high but you should spend some time.

reviews.comment_content: Easy to understand and first part is almost same as M1 stuff. Other parts are not difficult also. Quite interesting. M1 students will have some advantage in this course I think.
reviews.comment_teaching:

He speaks quite slowly, so it is easy to follow his teaching and he explains slowly so easy for understanding. You can understand what he taught generally by studying the powerpoint, but sometimes he will test stuff that he taught in class but not included in the powerpoint. And if you want to learn more or learn extra stuff, you can find him after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good
Cuz both midterms and final are MCs, so easy to score high mark.
Midterm 1 mean ~18/23
Midterm 2 mean ~21/25
Final mean ~28/44 (S.D. ~7)

Get an A
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy at all.
2 assignments for this semester (originally should have 3 assignments).
2 midterms 1 final all in MCs. About 25 questions for each midterm and about 45 questions for final.

Du Lilun has a strange accent in speaking English. But I don't think that its a great problem. Du Lilun is a really passionate professors in teaching. He is willing to answer students' questions after lessons. You can also arrange an appointment with him, he is very willing to meet you. He will make the lessons so funny and play some videos like Stephen Chow's movie in the lessons. Some tutorials are also arranged before the exams.

If you are someone who like asking questions about the lecture, Du Lilun will be your best choice!
reviews.comment_grading:
Bad.

reviews.author: Norayao
reviews.comment_content: The content is very useful for business student especially for people who want do to business analytics in the future. The concepts are all very basic but practical.
reviews.comment_teaching: Du, Li-lun is a passionate teacher but unfortunately his english and way of delivering content is not ideal to make students understand well. So I do recommend students to watch teaching videos online but do the practices from the professor. It helps!
reviews.comment_grading: it's business core course, you can't expect it to be good in spite of really hardworking. Note that the quizzes and final exam questions are all easy and moderate, so please do take it carefully or else you might fall to C range easily with only a few mistakes.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively low with a few assignments in group, 2 quizzes and final. Some concepts might take more time to comprehend but generally it's not that hard.

reviews.author: Alexis Yu
reviews.comment_content:
not difficult
need to focus on the process when she is analyzing those graphs and calculating numbers
pay attention to the example questions she mentioned in class, since the quiz will have very similar questions.

strongly advise to attend lectures since the lectures will not be recorded, and professor will write something on her slides for better understanding and interpretations during the lectures. She will also take attendance into account since she will hand out cards to you if you answer her questions during the lectures, and those cards will count for participation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
very nice professor ! She explained every concept with examples very clearly, and she can speak mandarin, cantonese and English all very well, so don't worry if you want to ask her questions in your mother language.
She will make special arrangements for question answering before quiz or exams, and you can also make appointments with her through email. Kris is really kind and she is always eager to help students.
reviews.comment_grading: good grade !
reviews.comment_workload: can't remember very clearly, two quizzes(non cumulative and with cheat sheets), 4 group homework, attendance around 10%(participation cards and games) and one final exam.

I would say workload is fair, with 1 midterm, 1 final and 2 mini project. No attendance taken.

Topic 1 Data description
- Recognizing the type of data
- Using graphs to see the characteristics of data
- Summarizing messy data into neat numbers

Topic 2 Probability

- Random variable, distribution

- Continuous random variables: normal distribution, t distribution

- Confidence intervals

He's a nice professor, but his teaching is very bad.... I barely understood anything, and he rushed through things very quickly. He writes the solution on the board, so it's very hard to see and understand.

He also does random attendance checks using pop quizzes, so make sure you attend... and try to understand.

He was very nice near the end and gave us m&ms for part of our understanding of a concept. He's a nice man, but not a good professor.

reviews.author: ETET
reviews.title: Curve extremely high
reviews.comment_content:
The first few chapters are quite basic, just about type of data, mean, mode, median etc. simple stuff you've probable learnt before.

The later part is more about probability and risk. It plays around the bell-shape normal distribution. Make sure you know how to read the probability tables though.

it might be a bit confusing if you just memorise the material. I would say understanding the concept is more important in this course. Understanding + 1 pass paper before test are enough to grant you almost full mark.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She gives you one card for one question you ask / answer in class. It adds up to at most 6% of total score.

After that most ppl will stop answering questions. But she quite enjoys the interaction with students, so after all, if you speak, the lesson will be more energetic and less boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Go to class~ one time she played a movie slip in class and the content of the clip appeared on the test paper.

All questions are MC though, and 1 double-sided A4 cheat-sheet is allowed. All quizzes/exam are like the pass paper / sample paper.

homework x3
quizzes x2
final exam

Curve so high that I scored >90% but still A-

reviews.author: Clamer
reviews.title: easiest statistics course in ust
reviews.comment_content:
The content is good. The syllabus surprised me since it covers the content of 3-4 math courses from probability to sampling, regression. But actually, it just talks about the skin without any proof or analysis. So business students can know these concepts but don't need to struggle with math. Good for them.

Ch1 Data and Variation: mean, sd, etc
Ch2 Probability: Independence, conditional probability, random variable, association between Two Random Variables, Normal Probability Model
Ch3 Inference: Sampling and Sampling Distributions, Standard Errors and Confidence Intervals, Statistical Hypothesis Testing
Ch4 Linear Regression: Simple Linear Regression Model, egression Diagnostics
reviews.comment_teaching: Didn't really attend the lectures but I suggest you attend since there are some blanks to fill in powerpoint. Also, some new concepts might be introduced in lecture, they will be tested in the quiz.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not yet released.

10% 3 homework
45% 2 quiz
45% 1 final

Practice quiz,  a set of multiple-choice questions, will be given to you and some questions are picked as homework. Quizzes are extremely similar to practice quiz. The exam is in the same form as the quiz.

Homework is easy, I think everyone gets full mark. Quiz and exam are also easy if you have a solid high school math background.
reviews.comment_workload:
Super Light.
Totally I just spent no more than 15 hours totally on this course. 5 hour before each quiz/exam should be ok, including doing homework and preparing quiz. And I got 1sd above in quiz and exam. Compared to math 2411or other statistics is almost 0.5 credits workload.

reviews.author: Studdas
reviews.title: ISOM 2500 Course Review
reviews.comment_content:
The content in this course is not that hard. I personally found it quite interesting as it explains how statistics are utilised in business.
The syllabus is as follows:
Topic 1- Data description
- Recognizing the type of data
- Using graphs to see the characteristics of data
- Summarizing messy data into neat numbers
Topic 2- Probability
- Probability
- Random variable, distribution
- Discrete random variables: binomial distribution
- Continuous random variables: normal distribution, t distribution
Topic 3- Estimation
- Point estimate
- Sampling distribution
- confidence intervals
Topic 4- Hypothesis testing
- One sample, statistically significant? Using t-test
- Errors of statistical testing: Type I and Type II error
- Two independent samples significantly different? Using t-test
- Examining relationships for nominal and ordinal data – Chi-square test
Topic 5- Simple Linear regression
- Basic concept
- Checking model assumption
- Testing beta
- Prediction and Estimation
reviews.comment_teaching:
1. Her teaching is above average. She reads out from the slides and tends to support them with examples.
2. There is no attendance
3. Attend the classes before the quiz and exam as she tells you what will be tested. Don't depend on your classmates to tell you that.
4. She holds office hours to answer your questions.
5. TA, Elvis is one the least helpful guy you will find. Don't depend on him for anything. He barely answers e-mails. He probably should be a student to learn the course first.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading for the course is quite fair.
There are two quizzes and a final. The tested content is non-cumulative. However, you need an understanding of the previous chapters to score high in the final. Quizzes are fairly easy and the final is easy as well. (One A4 handwritten cheatsheet is allowed.)
10% is homework and another 10% is for class participation. For participation, you need participation cards to get a full grade. If you are unable to, then games are conducted by the TA, where you can earn these points.
Your grade in the course is based on:
Quiz 1 10%
Quiz 2 20%
Final Exam 50%
Homework 10%
Performance through the Curriculum 10%
Total of 100%
Lab sessions are also there but they are not mandatory. It was tested only in the first quiz. Timings are given on canvas.
I have attached the course outline below.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is average or below average. The homework is released with adequate time to complete it. They are not that hard but maybe a bit tricky so pay attention. The homework is checked by the TA and points are cut if the answers are wrong.
Ga yau!

I recommend you to try to attend all the classes if you get him as your professor.

reviews.author: pmg
reviews.title: not recommended
reviews.comment_content: Powerpoints are unclear and many details were skipped. The steps for the questions in powerpoints were written on the whiteboard during lectures, but his handwriting is terrible and impossible to read.
reviews.comment_teaching: His accent is weird and really difficult for people to hear what he is saying. I cannot catch up with the teaching at all due to his unclear English. His classes are quite boring too. He failed to provide help when I face difficulty in completing assignments.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not very good. It is unclear.
reviews.comment_workload: Assignments are difficult and we were given inadequate time to finish them. There are random quizzes as attendance taking.

reviews.author: Wendyyy
reviews.title: James' class is very chill
reviews.comment_content:
linear patterns,
random variables,
linear regression, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His course materials have messy titles, but the final exam will be open computer, so it is good to download everything in canvas and read them in the order on canvas.

The professor is energetic and should be quite understandable. Sometimes he would end the lesson early.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A+, which was very unexpected because I thought this is a bad grade course and I have not studied statistics before. Had some trouble understanding the testing of sample statistics when I didn't pay attention in class.

Individual Class Participation and professionalism 10%
Group Homework 10%
Bi-Weekly Quizzes 40% Multiple Choice
Final Exam 40% Multiple Choice

Getting high scores in HW (by completing all the questions) and full marks in quizzes definitely help you get a better grade. Understanding the content well before taking the final exam will ensure a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Five group homeworks, grouping is done by ourselves, 3-5 people in each group. The homework is quite long, TA is responsible for grading, which is based on how much you've completed but not how correct your answers are.

Five quizzes that worth a lot but only have 5 questions in each, open computer and professor might tell us some answers.

Need to study for the final exam. Our exam is on the last exam date so I got plenty of time.

reviews.author: abpuma
reviews.comment_content:
1. Descriptive Statistics
2. Probability
3. Random Variables (Discrete Random and Continuous Random)
4. Estimation (Sampling distribution and confidence intervals)
5. Hypothesis testing
6. Simple Linear Regression

This content is quite difficult but, thankfully, the quizzes and the final are non-cumulative.

There isn't an attendance requirement but, you need to attend class to get the participation cards.

The homework is a group assignment. The groups are 4 members each and she requires min. 1 local and non-local in each group.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Because of the nature of the content, the classes can be quite boring but she does a good job at making them interesting. Her teaching is quite good and she answers students' questions very well. She also takes questions after class and responds to emails quickly.

Her slides are easy to follow and her homework sets are well-made.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 10%
Quiz 2: 20%
Final: 50%
Homework (x4): 10% (2.5% each)
Participation: 10%

For participation, cards are given out to people ask/answer questions. Each card is worth 2% (so, 5 cards = full 10%). She also hold 2 'games' in the semester  where the entire class can participate. Each game is also worth 2%. Participation is quite easy to get if you are attentive in class.

I got full in participation, slightly above mean in HW, and >1 sd from the mean for quizzes and finals. Final grade: A.
reviews.comment_workload:
To be honest: this course is one of the most difficult Business Core courses and so, you'll have to put in a good amount of effort to understand the material properly. The slides are usually enough to prepare for the exams. I got well above the mean with lesser effort than I expected.

There are 4 homework assignments throughout the semester, some of them will take more time than the others. She gives a long-enough period to complete it.

reviews.author: Orange_C

reviews.comment_content: Professor James only covers the necessities that will be tested in the exam. He will only talk about basic things in each topic so you need some time outside of class to go through the concepts and example in the book to learn more.

reviews.comment_grading: The best part of the course is grading. Final is all MC and open laptop so you can basically put anything in your computer and follow the powerpoints to do the questions. Apart from the final there are only a few quizzes which is easy and professor will kind of tell you the answer
reviews.comment_workload: Only 5 Homework per semester, and it is group work so your friends can help you. Other than that there is nothing you need to do outside of class.

reviews.author: hejabvb
reviews.comment_content:
5 Topics in Total
Topic 1 Data description
- Recognizing the type of data
- Using graphs to see the characteristics of data
- Summarizing messy data into neat numbers
Topic 2 Probability
- Probability
- Random variable, distribution
- Discrete random variables: binomial distribution
- Continuous random variables: normal distribution, t distribution
Topic 3 Estimation
- Point estimate
- Sampling distribution
- Confidence intervals
Topic 4 Hypothesis testing

- Errors of statistical testing: Type I and Type II error

reviews.author: WLWLWL
reviews.comment_content: Syllabus switched from using Python to using Microsoft Excel, the course teaches basic statistic knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor has the passion to teach and was always willing to answer questions after class or even after office hours.

However, he has terrible accent and bad pronunciation, I can barely listen to what he was speaking in class. Also, professor sometimes has no idea on what he was teaching as he was not very familiar with using Microsoft Excel.
reviews.comment_grading: Terrible. The s.d. of both midterm and final exam is very hight (about 20), students easily fall into c-range if they have average performance.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much to do. Two projects which were very easy if you got one groupmate to carry the whole group.

reviews.author: Chill Guy
reviews.comment_content: Standard
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good teaching to be honest, it might take you one week or two to master his "unique" accent, but you will turn out fine.

After all it is a Quantitative course, you simply cannot understand all materials hands-on during lecture. SO pls do a pre-reading for your class 1~2 hrs beforehand to make sure you have a basic understanding of the materials - then it'd be most effective for you to clear all your knowledge gap during lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Insight: YOU HAVE TO BE VERY CAUTIOUS!

Well, each question in the exams (2 mid-terms + 1 final) equals 1% of your total grade. Let's assume you've earned all class participation points & attendance for certain activity days (don't miss those), the situation would be:
A: 96%
A-: 95%  
-> not sure about the lower cut-off for A-, but just wanna say, you will lose your A if 5 questions were wrong in your papers, accumulatively. This class is quite competitive.

Study Guide below:
- I urge you not to give a shxt to the so-called "competitive crowd"; rather, focus on your own pursuit of perfection. Make sure you really understand the concepts and materials in-depth, so you won't be trapped in exams - try to score full marks for the first two exams (should not be difficult given you really mastered the concepts, but you should really be cautious to EVERY question - they equal 1%, remember).
reviews.comment_workload:
- Understanding the concepts takes time. But it could hardly go wrong once you've understood them. Pay more time on pre-study before lecture.
- Go browse Khan Academy if you don't really FULLY understand certain concepts (do so, a little understanding gap would mean a risk in losing marks in finals)

To sum up, unlike ACCT / ECON, which required a lot of readings - this course focuses more on conceptual understanding, the lecture notes along are already ENOUGH (btw credits given to Prof for his efforts in making the notes concise and comprehensive).

reviews.author: UST Duke Lam
reviews.title: Good Professor, Fair Grade
reviews.comment_content:
An introductory statistics course which fits into the ISOM department. Basically DSE M1 (or IB Maths HL topic 7 (option) - probability and statistics) or equivalent.

Course Structure:

Part 1: Data and Variation
Variance, correlation, standard deviation......
This part is a recap of what you've learnt in secondary school. You will understand this if you could enter HKUST.

Part 2: Probability
Basic probability, joint, and conditional probability, random variables, covariance, normal quantile plot.....
An extension of part 1, but still quite easy and at this part of the course you can still chill and skip some lessons.

Part 3: Inference
sampling, confidence interval, hypothesis testing.....
This part requires some deeper understanding about statistics. If you have not studied M1 in secondary school, attend all lectures and ask the professor when you don't understand. Part 3 is the most important part, as part 4 is built on the basics of part 3.

Part 4: Linear Regression
residual plot, prediction interval, variation, time series....
This part requires some revision and full focus in lectures. If you skip lectures, you might get lost in the content. This part new to most students as it is not in the DSE M1 AND IB Maths HL syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very nice as he will patiently answer all questions after class. He also jokes around sometimes and this makes him a very friendly and fun professor. He even took a photo with me after the final lesson I'm very touched! He recognizes me outside the lesson. Very friendly professor and very easy to approach.

Despite many complaints about his accent, it is easy to get used to after a few lectures. It is not a problem at all after 3-4 lectures.

Interactive teaching as he encourages in-class participation and there are 2 in-class games, which is pretty fun. Rumors say the games are a part of attendance but that was never made clear by neither the professor nor the TA.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 10%
Quizzes 45% (quiz 1 22% + quiz 2 23%)
Final exam 35%
Participation 10% (6% for getting parti cards from answering questions in class + 4% for not undermining class environment)

Grading is fair. However the mean is quite high as part 1-3 in the syllabus is relatively easy. Here are some stats of the exams provided by the TA:
Quiz 1 (Out of 23 marks):
Mean: 20.80   SD: 2.21
Quiz 2 (Out of 22 marks):
Mean: 18.56   SD: 2.32
Final exam (Out of 35 marks):
Mean: 28.74   SD: 3.627

As you can observe in the stats, the mean dropped significantly in the finals. Part 4 is quite challenging and requires more revision. Therefore part 4 should be the spotlight of your revision, and it somehow decides if you will get an A, B or C.

Personally, I got 89.x% (missed 0.x% in homework D:) and got a B. The grade cutoff of A range is 95%. The grade is only fair under a curved grading system.
reviews.comment_workload:
SUPER LIGHT WORKLOAD. There are only 3 assignments throughout the whole course, which takes under an hour to finish each of them (even if you don't know how to do the homework it won't take over 3 hours). The length of each assignment is quite short. It is about showing steps and reasoning in finding the answers of the MCs in the practice quizzes/final.

There are practice quizzes/final before each exam. But those are not compulsory to do so it doesn't count as high workload. Each practice quiz/final is exactly as long as an exam paper, so it doesn't take long to finish one also.

Personally, I think the biggest workload in the course is copying cheat sheets before each exam. Cheat sheet is allowed, so everyone will try their best to copy everything in the syllabus down. Some even copy the whole practice quiz/final down on the cheet sheet LOL! (including yours truly).

Overall light workload.

reviews.author: tstststs
reviews.comment_content: Overall, the content is not too difficult. As long as you pay attention to class, it should be easy to understand every concept covered in exams. Beware of everything the professor said in class, for some out of syllabus content he mentioned appears on the exam.  Also, the course requires you to earn your attendance score by raising your hand to answer or ask questions. You will need to do this 6 times to max your score.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's accent is hard to understand at first, but you'll get used to it. He is a super nice guy and will answer your question patiently after class.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grading. Didn't past 1 sd in both second quiz and final. Still manage to get an A. Mean is high though, so it's pretty easy to screw up your grade by making just a few mistake.
reviews.comment_workload: Extremely low. 3 assignments in total. You will need to hand in a hard copy to LSK.

reviews.author: SmallShortGuy

reviews.comment_teaching: Li Yingying is very passionate in teaching.  Her English is the best among all mainland(?) professors I have ever seen.  Her tone will never make you asleep.  She explains things very well and in a simple way.  Her lessons are worth attending.  Also, you need to pay attention to her class in order to fill in the blanks in the ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean is rather high (maybe becoz the concepts are quite simple?).  You have to be extremely careful in exams.  Application of knowledge is required instead of memorization.  
Participation(no attendance but there are cards for you to raise or answer to questions in class) 10%
Assignment 10% (mock exams which are highly related to actual questions, study them then you can do well in exams)
Midterm(quiz)1 23%
Midterm(quiz)2 22%
Final 35%

All MC questions.  

For me:
Midterm1 23/23
Midterm2 21/22
Final 32/35
All 6 cards got.
Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: Just ensure that all your concepts are cleared before going to the next lesson.  You need not to revise much if you really pay 100% attention to her.  The workload is very light for me.  The question types in exams is almost the same with those in assignments.  Maybe that's why the mean is so high.  The 'Games' in class are real games.  No group project needed.

reviews.author: Season
reviews.title: 2018/19 Fall Review
reviews.comment_content: The content was basically well organized and rational. Required students with good rational thinking and good cognitive skill. Abundant knowledge in the course and study in the early stage was highly recommended.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecturer tried his best to teach us with different examples but not the textbooks. GOOD!
reviews.comment_grading: Three quizzes in total and all of them are MC. The SD was basically narrow in the range of high marks. Mean was very high!!!!

reviews.author: thegpagod
reviews.title: Good professor but unsatisfactory grading due to high mean
reviews.comment_content:
A simple introduction course to business statistics.
Part 1: Data and Variation
Variance, correlation, standard deviation......
Very easy. Just simple data handling which most people learned in their high school already.
Part 2: Probability
Basic probability, joint and conditional probability, random variables, covariance, normal quantile plot.....
More difficult than part 1 but still easy to handle, quite easy to understand.
Part 3: Inference
sampling, confidence interval, hypothesis testing.....
This is more difficult than previous parts which you really have to pay attention in class.
Part 4: Linear Regression
residual plot, prediction interval, variation, time series....
This is the most difficult part of the course which made the mean of final exam much lower than the previous quizzes, really have to revise and do revision well for good grades.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is very nice and friendly which he is passionate in teaching and willing to answer students' questions. The atmosphere of his class is active which he always encourage us to think and answer questions.

Attending to class is necessary too as some questions appeared in exams are taught in lessons but not included in notes.

It is really fun and enjoyable to attend his lessons:)
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 10%
Quizzes 45% (quiz 1 22% + quiz 2 23%)
Final exam 35%
Participation 10% (6% for getting parti cards from answering questions in class + 4% for not undermining class environment)

Honestly speaking, not good at all as the mean of exams are usually very very high.
Quiz 1 (23 marks):
Mean 20.8          SD 2.21
Quiz 2 (22 marks):
Mean: 18.56       SD: 2.32
Final exam (35 marks):
Mean: 28.74 .     SD: 3.627

I got 90% in total but a B so not really good grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
Super light workload. You only need to finish 3 assignments before exams.
Quiz and exam are all in multiple choice questions format, cheat sheet is allowed (basically you can copy everything on notes to that).

Just revise all the notes and finish the practise quiz given many times and you can get a satisfactory grade.

reviews.comment_workload: really light. only three hw before the two midterms and final which are consists only a few practice questions .

reviews.author: lc09
reviews.title: Good grade but poor teaching
reviews.comment_content:
【Important】Disregard all the comments in 2017-18 as he changed the whole syllabus!


1. Introduction of basic statistics
Calculation of mean and variance. Not difficult

2. Probability
Basically all about things taught in secondary school. Not difficult

3. Random variable
Things in M1, may be difficult to understand, but not difficult to get through it.

4. Normal distribution and Central Limit Theory
Things start to get complicated here, but don't be afraid by the homework question. Not that difficult if you refer to other lecturer's slides:)

5. Type 1 Error and Type 2 Error
Difficult to understand if you only listen to professor and read the notes. Ask the tutor and you would know that it's not difficult to understand

6. Regression
Very complicated and difficult as you would need to understand all the concepts above plus some calculation.


Nothing about R-Program. He used Excel this year instead. There are some Excel tutorials, but reading the tutorial notes is already enough to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
At least he understand what he was teaching, but that's all

Poor Japanese accent (although it's already quite good among Japanese) and you can't understand what he is talking. Also lots of typo in the lecture notes (not written by him).

The tutor cannot teach well either in tutorial session, but you would find him very useful if you approach him individually.
reviews.comment_grading:
My score:
Asking questions: 5/5
Homework 1: 99/100 [Mean 93]
Homework 2: 90/100 [Mean 89]
Homework 3: 87/100 [Mean 93]
Quiz 1: 19/20 [Mean: 16.7]
Quiz 2: 19/20 [Mean: 17.0]
Final exam: 18/40 [Mean: 16.4]

Overall: A (very good grade indeed)


Asking questions in class: 5%
Ask 5 questions and type questions + his answer in discussion board

3 Homework: 30%
All long questions. You would find his homework very difficult. However the grading is very lenient. Those questions would not appear in quizzes but may appear in final exam.

2 Quizzes: 40%
All MC questions which are very easy. Make sure to revise a little bit as **NO CHEAT SHEET IS ALLOWED**. The mean is terribly high.

Final exam: 40%
Professor discovered that quizzes are too easy and questions become very complicated. Also he is the only one professor which **DON'T ALLOW CHEAT SHEET** and **HAS LONG QUESTION** in final exam. Make sure you know what is happening in homework.
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework requires quite a long time to finish (especially you need to use Excel).

Also, he doesn't allow cheat sheet so you need extra revision compare with other lecturers in ISOM2500.

reviews.author: mei you qian
reviews.title: Bye CGA
reviews.comment_content:
This is the first semester he switched from python to microsoft excel (finally). The course itself is based on a textbook and before the lesson begins, he assigns some pre-reading. But the order of teaching is unscrambled and if you have an e-book, you'll scroll a lot to find the chapter. (I'm not joking)
He makes powerpoints on his own including different animations in an attempt to explain the statistical concepts but frankly speaking, even if you paid attention in the lesson, you forget what the animations were about quite easily.
You will do a lot of in-class exercises using excel but at least in terms of excel, it's quite straightforward.
From section 3.3 onwards, the level of difficulty suddenly jumps and concepts are really hard to comprehend. (loads of formulas and etc.)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Unless you have someone else to explain the concepts to you, it's really hard to follow. His explanation is really vague and even if you ask questions later - although it seems like he tries his best to answer to your questions - it's not much different. If you speak in Mandarin though, it seems like you can get better answers for your questions.
He often tries to interact with students by asking questions but if your session is full of quiet and shy people, it could be real uncomfortable to stay in the lecture.
In terms of Excel, he often shows his lack of understanding on how to use Excel.
In a nutshell, I think it's more or less a self taught subject and don't expect much from both TA and the professor himself.
reviews.comment_grading:
A. Participation (15%): In-class surveys using canvas App. This is more or less an attendance grade since he does it every class.  
B. Two projects (20% ): Again, you need a person who knows statistics well. It could be real pain if none of your group mate knows how to work on it. Projects are not easy at all either.
C. Midterm(30%): In-class midterm. Relatively easier but average is obviously mad high (12/14) since it's UST.
D. Final(35%): Noncumulative (thank god) BUT the level of difficulty jumps by 10000 feet from the midterm and even the prof is aware of this... Mean and median are roughly 50%. Some questions were badly sentenced that they were difficult to understand.

And the grading is very harsh as well. If you get over 80%, you can get a B. If you have any component that is below the mean, you can easily fall to a C-range.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload doesn't seem to be much apart from Project II because of its difficulty. However, if you are a keen reader and would love to do all the assigned pre-readings before the lecture, the workload will get a lot heavier because sometimes, he assigns one whole chapter as a pre-reading material.

reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor was amazing! He has a very good English accent, and he teaches in an interesting way. He doesn't just teach statistics, but he actually relates the content and theoretical concepts to business applications when he links the value at risk to stocks.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is really good. The final exam was open book, and as long as you are above mean in the exams with most of your assignments with a good score, you will atleast achieve a B+.

Most of my assignments were close to full marks, and the final was 21/23. The mean was 17 and s.d was 3.5. I got an A- overall.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not much. Each assignment usually takes 1 hour to finish. There are some assignments where you have to use excel. But if you're familiar with excel spreadsheet and data plotting, it should be fine.

reviews.author: Joeywong
reviews.title: ISOM 2500
reviews.comment_content: The contents are quite easy to understand in either numerical and statistical problems.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a nice professor, and her teaching is quite easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Her grading is not bad. There is quite a lot of talented students and I think the mean is very heavy tail and very much left skilled. I think overall isnt bad and strongly recommend her.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine to me comparing to other professors as I personally think she is nice and she will ensure we really do understand her class and teaching materials.

reviews.author: InvincibleIvan
reviews.comment_teaching:
The powerpoint is very clear and with enough examples for you to understand each concept. The examples are close to the daily life so it is easy to understand. The professor also teach well, she will repeat the important content for several times and these will be the most likely to be examined.
Class participation, answer questions and you will receive a paper which you need to write you id no. and give back to professor after class. Each represent 1 mark.
reviews.comment_grading: There are two quizzes and one final, all mc questions. One double sided A4 cheat sheet is allowed so the quizzes and exam are quite easy. As long as you revise the powerpoint and copy some important equation to the cheat sheet, you will know how to do the questions. The grade is quite good but the mean for every exam is quite high.
reviews.comment_workload:
Group homework
Lab session ( not a must)
Class participation

reviews.author: SBM_FM
reviews.comment_content:
Covers the following areas:

1. Descriptive Statistics
2. Probability
3. Random Variables (Discrete Random and Continuous Random)
4. Estimation (Sampling distribution and confidence intervals)
5. Hypothesis testing
6. Simple Linear Regression
reviews.comment_teaching: It was really easy to follow what she says and her ppt were also well detailed. So even if you miss a class and just see the ppt you won't be lost.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 10%
Final 50%
Assignment 10%
Quizzes 30%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is okay.  2 Quiz, 1 Final, 4 Homework Assignments. Groups of 4will be formed for the assignments. If there is no free rider, workload would be fine. Attend classes to get the 10% of the participation by collecting the participation card.

reviews.author: yongyong
reviews.comment_content: basic concepts of statistics and some applications in business. Not much math background and calculation is needed
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. is enthusiastic to teaching and answering questions
But it might be a bit difficult to understand his lecture notes if skipping lessons
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 10% (x3)
Quiz 45% (x2)
Final 35%
Participation 10%
All the quizzes n exams are mc also mock/practice papers are provided
Those questions in real and practice papers ate extremely similar
Easy to get high score but remember the sd is unbielievably high too
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 3 assignments which not more than 10 questions for each
And answering or asking questions in lessons to get participation mark for 6 times

reviews.author: Benji
reviews.title: Python
reviews.comment_content: Content-wise, it is not that hard to understand. The most difficult part is to memorise all the codes. Be sure to attend all the lessons if possible, because it may be hard to understand just by watching the videos. Some concepts may be disclosed in real-time, and he comes to help in every break. You may find it quite hard to follow-up.
reviews.comment_teaching: In terms of presentation, his pronunciation may be one of the main obstacles in the lessons. He is a nice guy, and guarantees not to fail or give bad grades to anyone. He may not be giving you satisfactory answers when you ask him questions. Overall, he is a friendly professor, its just his pronunciation.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is trivial. The marking scheme may somewhat be confusing. As most of us may not be familiar with coding, it may be hard to understand how he grades the assignments and also the finals. The final exam is something to pay more attention to.

As there is actually a base mark in the midterm, the scores do not really vary much. So it is very difficult to get an A, only if you are in the top position of the class. It is very easy to get just an average rating.
reviews.comment_workload:
All you have to do is the assignments. There are four in total, and the first two are quite easy to finish. The level gets harder and harder each time. In addition, the assignments may be quite tricky. There may sometimes be no fixed answers.

There is a way to get 100% in the assignments. He will sometimes hold some 'in class competition', in which he tests on how quick we understand what he is talking about.

reviews.author: gaius6948
reviews.title: Good Gradessssssssssssss
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches all the basic concepts of statistics and some applications in business.

Although it is about statistics, this course is not math focused, it is about understanding concepts of statistics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is very clear, as long as you pay attention in class, you will do fine in all the quizzes and final. You have to attend the class because the powerpoint provided is not enough to digest the knowledge being taught, sit in the class and take notes will ensure you a fair result.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendence 10%
Final 50%
Assignment 10%
Quizzes 30%
Get every quizzes and final above mean for at least 1 SD and got A+ in the end, grades are generally VERY GOOD!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
2 Quizzes
1 Final
A few group assignments (very easy if you pay attention to instructions)

reviews.author: CYAN.TANG

quite good
she is nice, even when you answer the question wrongly during the class she also accepts it.
she follows the power point and teaches in a detailed way.

good grading
the quiz and the exam is ok, doing revision and paying attention on class are important
reviews.comment_workload:
there are four group works. but some of the them you can find the answer on the internet and check.
answering the questions during the class is for the attendance.
