reviews.author: lolllllllllll
reviews.comment_content: Its a course that teach you to read code and write them out to solve problems. Do not register the course that taught python since not just myself, but probably 90% of the class dis not know what is going on and don't know what we have learnt.
reviews.comment_teaching: Can skip lessons coz it will release lecture video, I  suggest you to turn on 2x speed coz the professor talks way tooooo slow.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading system is not transparent. Some got higher marks in assignments and exams but end up getting a lower overall grade.
reviews.comment_workload: 4 assignments, 1 mid term, 1 final, pretty low workload since you can work on your assignment with your friends.

reviews.author: sychuiaa
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite practical for business use.The course syllabus consist of descriptive statistics,probability,random variable,estimation,hypothesis testing and simple linear regression.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good.Strongly suggest to attend the lecture class.She can express some abstract concept very well.Also, you can ask her question after class or in the q&a session before exam.You may accidentally get some bonus tips for your exams
reviews.comment_grading: Quite fair.Mean is about C+/B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite fair.2 quizes and 1 final exam with two-sided A4 cheat sheet allowed.4 homeworks which you need to finish in groups of 4.4 labs with content related to exam syllabus.

reviews.author: little potatoo
reviews.comment_content: He is the only professor that uses python to teach this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a nice professor. He offers office hour for you to ask him questions in his office.

Replies emails quite fast
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading system:
Assignments: 50%
Mid-term: 15%
Final: 35%

I got all 100% for four assignment, midterm above mean like half sd. However I did so poor on final exam (like below 1sd, which makes my final grade B-. His grading is not so bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Absolutely NO WORKLOAD.

There is only 4 assignments in this course, and accounts for 50% of the course grade. 2-3 people in a group. You just need some good groupmates to carry you through these four assignments.

reviews.author: little potatoss
reviews.comment_content:
Topics about statistics:
eg, Probability, Normal distribution, Sampling, Value at Risk, Confidence Intervals, Hypothesis Testing, Regression models etc.

The content is easy at the beginning, but becoming more difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor tried to make the concept simple and explain them in a simple way. There are some class activities sometimes.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 5 quizzes, and 4 out of 5 will be counted on your final grade. As they are all MCs and are open-book, it's easy to get high marks.

The exam is more difficult, the grading is quite fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
5 MCs, which is open-book;
4 group assignment;
An open-book exam,
which the workload is quite light

reviews.author: hungrypotato
reviews.comment_content:
Covers the following areas:

1. Descriptive Statistics
2. Probability
3. Random Variables (Discrete Random and Continuous Random)
4. Estimation (Sampling distribution and confidence intervals)
5. Hypothesis testing
6. Simple Linear Regression

The content is actually quite useful from a business pov, although I think it's really boring. The first few topics are easier but from estimation, HT and SLR, the level of difficulty shot up exponentially lol

Anyway, I heard other ISOM2500 classes had to learn multiple linear regression and get it tested during finals. So PAN's class is already quite nice for only requiring simple linear regression only.

There are 4 lab sessions. The TA will teach you how to use data analysing softwares. (p.s. some lab ppt content appeared in quiz 1)
reviews.comment_teaching:
PAN is one of the best teachers in HKUST. She is extremely nice and kind, and usually a lot of students ask her questions after class. She answers all questions one by one patiently. She even organised extra Q&A sessions (4 in total) before finals.

Her powerpoints are probably one of the best and clearest ISOM2500 ppts, and her examples are very good too. Her teaching is clear and she likes using analogies to make things simpler and easier to understand. When she notices students have difficulties following, she repeats the topic the next week.

Although there is 10% for class participation, PAN lets her students get these 10% by answering questions in class (you get a card that you submit by the end of class). She says this is because she understands some students are shy and she wants the class participation marks to be fair for both outgoing and shy students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Includes the following:
Homework (group project): 10%
Quizzes: 30%
Final: 50%
Class Participation: 10%

Most people score pretty good for homework.

Quizzes are quite difficult. Not to mention finals. All quizzes and finals are MCs.

The good thing about PAN is sometimes you get cards even though you answer incorrectly (you need to explain how you got your answer though), or even when you ask a question (has to be meaningful though!)

There are also two games throughout the year to get 2% per game. So you can answer only 6 questions + attend 2 games to get full mark for participation.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is tough as there are 4 lab sessions and 4 group works (homework).

Lab is not quite tough as it is optional and is usually at night, so it won't clash with your course timetable most of the time.

The tough part is the group work, as the difficulty increases drastically per assignment, and if your group mates don't study or pay attention in class, you're doomed lol

But most people manage to submit homework in time and get a satisfactory score.

reviews.author: Jplao
reviews.title: Interesting Professor
reviews.comment_content: All of the exam's content was more or less explored in class. Slides and HW practice are sufficient preparation. Attendance isn't necessarily important, as long as you don't show up midway through class.
reviews.comment_teaching: He can sometimes get off-track or run on a tangent about a related but not necessarily important topic, but he's able to keep the class interesting enough.
reviews.comment_grading: Quizzes leading up to the final exam are easy but everyone typically scores full marks. Final exam was more difficult but the curve was spread out more equally.
reviews.comment_workload: Quizzes are generally easy. Homework is difficult(and long). Exam is hard(review for this one most of all.

reviews.author: liang101106
reviews.comment_content:
Categorial/Numerical Variables;
Binomial/Poisson;
Random Variables;
Hybrid Investments, Value-at-Risk;
Normal Distributions, Confidence Intervals; *
Hypothesis Testing; *
Regression models. *

Seemed to be easy at the beginning because things like discrete/continuous distributions are mostly taught in DSE M1 maths.
The course became so much more difficult when some more advanced concepts are introduced in the Normal distribution topics. Topics with * are chapters I found confused and had to spend so much time to understand.

Not an easy course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Lancelot is nice and humorous. He used only Excel to teach.

In my opinion, he explained the concept not very clearly during the lecture. However, he is easy to approach after class or through email. He used many real-life examples and cases to help us, which I found pretty useful.

Overall a good and passionate professor, but need more self-studying and thinking to clear up the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Individual Class Participation and professionalism    10%
Group Homework 10%
Bi-Weekly Quizzes 40%-Multiple Choice
Final Exam 40%-Multiple Choice

5 quizzes, extremely easy. The mean is close to the full mark.
3 group assignments, the TA will specify some questions to be done in the textbook. Marks for this part is not released. We were allowed to form groups by ourselves (5-6 people per group).
The final exam was very challenging, open book and open laptop. There were 10+ MCs and 7 mini-cases. The cases were all about regression models, the most difficult topic in this course.

Spend a lot of time to understand the concepts, and do not think you can find the answer immediately in the exam by looking at the slides and the textbooks.

I got all full marks in the quizzes, and the final exam mark was not released. Got an A.

I am pretty sure that everyone got similar marks on quizzes and homeworks. The final exam is the only way to differentiate you from the others.
reviews.comment_workload:
Pretty heavy course, not because of its quantity but difficulty.

Getting all credits in quizzes is mandatory, and just try your best to do well in the final exam.

reviews.author: 就黎升仙
reviews.comment_content: This course is about business statistic. At the beginning, you learn what you have learnt in secondary school like probability. And you will learn deeper about the z scores, t test...
reviews.comment_teaching: Just like other lectures, she will let you answer her questions and you can ask her questions about the notes and doubts. You can have discussion with your friends first before answering her questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lecture Participation 10%
Assignments 10%
Mid-terms 30%
Final 50%

Lecture participation can be earned by answering 10 questions.
Assignments are very easy and you can get full mark easily.
All mid-terms and final are MC questions, so sometimes you might think they are difficult if you don't know how to do because four answers may be similar.
if you can get nearly full mark in final and full mark in lecture participation, you can get A-range! Of course, you still need to work hard on the mid-terms.

I guess mean is B.
I got B+ My final is above mean and mid-terms is very close to mean but my lecture participation and assignment are full mark.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. There are only 4 group assignments and she will tell you before 1 week.

reviews.author: ustnerdno.99
reviews.comment_content:
You can treat it as a M1 course in secondary school but with the extensive use of python, a computer program. It has 3 chapters. It is extremely hard for starters to catch up in the first chapter which is about the introduction of  python. The second and third chapter is mainly about probability and building model respectively.

The professor will put lecture video on canvas, so you don't need to worry if you miss a class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I can feel the passion of professor and he cares for the students very much. He will stop every time he teaches a new things and asks students whether they need help. However, he has a strong mandarin accent that makes his teaching difficult to hear.

I would say the TA is completely useless. He sets up a telegram group in the first assignment, claiming that too many students ask him questions via email, opening a telegram saves him a lot of time and benefits all students with similar questions. Yet, he rarely responses the questions except the first few days.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is based on the following:
Assignments: 50%
Mid-term: 15%
Final: 35%

The grading is very good. Most students score high marks on assignments. Don't expect you an outperform others in assignments. There are sample papers for midterm and final and you can refer to your notes. I get a total of 397 out of 400 in 4 assignments. 6 points above mean in midterm and 4 points below mean in final. Still, I get B.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not high. A total of 4 assignments. You can work within a group of 3. 3-4 questions in each assignment. You have about a week to turn it in.

reviews.author: Polaris
reviews.title: NICE PROFESSOR
reviews.comment_content:
He will skip some chapters:

Categorical and Numerical Data: mean, mode, median, variance, s.d., boxplot

Random Variables and Financial Stat: volatility, probability, gross return, hybrid investment

Binomial Probability(skipped), Normal Probability and Sampling variation: value at risk, z-score, quality control

Confidence Interval and Hypothesis Testing: statistical significance, standard error, t-stat

Regressions: CAPM Model, beta estimation, dummy variables, multiple regressions)
reviews.comment_teaching:
The atmosphere is relaxing and he is a funny person
James put much more emphasis on letting you know the applications and the understanding of concepts. He often ends his lesson earlier, therefore you can enjoy your tea time or lunch earlier :)
Better attend every lesson since he may mention the content of those quizzes.
For the TA, LOK, nothin' but terrible and irresponsible. "You should find professor James." Useless. He didn't give a fk to students, so find James directly if you hv got problems.
reviews.comment_grading:
% distribution:
Participation: 10%
Group Assignments (3 of them): 10%
Quizzes (5 of them, MC): 40%
Final Exam (32 Qs, MC): 40%

No midterm exam for James' class
Open-book quizzes and final exam
Choose best 4 quizzes out of 5

Stat:
Quiz 1:  7/8 (mean = 7.6, min = 5, max = 8)
Quiz 2:  5/5 (mean = 4.6, min = 3, max = 5)
Quiz 3:  5/5 (mean = 4.5, min = 3, max = 5)
Quiz 4:  5/5 (mean = 4.6, min = 3, max = 5)
Quiz 5:  4/4 (mean = 3.6, min = 1, max = 4)
Assignments : N/A
Final : N/A
GRADE: A

I'm sorry but the TA didn't release any score of assignments and the final exam.
Make sure you get all the credits in quizzes and pay 100% hard work on the final exam. As exam only consists of multiple choice questions and it is terribly difficult, one correct answer could matter a lot.
reviews.comment_workload:
Group assignments: you better find some responsible teammates coz it is not wise for you to do the whole thing, there is a lot to do.

Quizzes: relatively easy, just use about 15mins to revise is definitely okay.

Final exam: yes better understand all the concepts and applications, not just equations, you hardly use them.

Participation: no attendance required but he said if he finds sb walk out the classroom during class without reasonable explanations, that person will be penalized via credits deduction.

reviews.author: ip
reviews.comment_content:
Describing numerical data
Association between categorical variables
Random variables
Association between random variables
Probability Models for counts
Normal probability model- value at risk
Sampling variation and quality
Confidence intervals
Statistical tests
Linear regression
Simple regression model
Application of regression (case study):
1. CAPM model, beta
2. dummy variables, slope dummy variables
3. prediction intervals vs confidence intervals
etc
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is very relaxing, friendly and approachable. He is clear in terms of teaching only if he wanna teach. Yes, he skips lecture ppts and skips chapters. He always says he is not here to teach you everything. You have to read and practise by yourself at home. For people who are smart, then this course is for you as you can get what he meant easily without having explained step by step (he skips chapters, rmb). For people like me, I feel difficult to catch up with his pace and I have to self study every chapter beforehand in order to understand his lecture. Also, the case studies mentioned in the content was not in the required textbook. It is in an optional reading called Klibanoff, Sandroni, Moselle and Saraniti, Managerial Statistics: A case basedapproach, Thomoson, 2006. Attached Harvard Business School Cases.
Although it is called "optional", there are roughly 20qs out of 30qs about these cases tested in final exam, so you know now if this is optional ;)
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading.
best 4 quizzes out of 5 quizzes
final exam
participation
group homework

no midterm. no presentation.

full marks in quizzes final exam marks, hw unknown.

fair grading
(everyone gets full marks in quizzes so final exams matter a lot)
reviews.comment_workload:
light if you have prior knowledge or you love and are skilled at statistics including regression.

heavy if you are new on this topic cos you have to self study by going on youtube/google to understand the content esp after the confidence intervals chapter.

group homework: heavy if you have freeriders in the group. you are allowed to choose your own mates.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.title: Good professor but board content
reviews.comment_content:
Useful content as you will use these knowledge in the future.

Topic 1 Data description
1.1 Recognizing the type of data
1.2 Using graphs to see the characteristics of data
1.3 Summarizing messy data into neat numbers

Topic 2 Probability
2.1 Probability
2.2 Random variable, distribution
2.3 Discrete random variables: binomial distribution
2.4 Continuous random variables: normal distribution, t distribution

Topic 3 Estimation
3.1 Point estimate
3.2 Sampling distribution
3.3 Confidence intervals

Topic 4 Hypothesis testing
4.1 One sample, statistically significant? Using t-test
4.2 Errors of statistical testing: Type I and Type II error
4.3 Two independent samples significantly different? Using t-test
4.4 Examining relationships for nominal and ordinal data 4.5 Chi-square test

Topic 5 Simple Linear regression
5.1 Basic concept
5.2 Checking model assumption
5.3 Testing beta
5.4 Prediction and Estimation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture section: Kris is very nice and she can speak in Cantonese, Mandarin and English. So, language is not a barrier and you can understand her words quite easily. She is willing to answer your questions and will explain the answers very clearly.

Lab section: Tutorial sections will be arranged to help learn Minitab software, Excel add-ins and practice the exercise. TA is responsible for the Lab section, but he is a bit weird and always look angry. (I don't know why). He is super talkative, yet he will teach you the stuff you don't understand in the lecture if you go to his office and find him. But, he may sidetrack and talk a lot of bullshit. In general, he is a good TA with high working efficiency.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exam constitutes a pretty heavy proportion of the whole course. Although all the quizzes and exam are not cumulative, the knowledge and skills are cumulative.

Grading Components:
10% Quiz 1: 80/100 (Mean: 80/100)
20% Quiz 2: 72/100 (Mean: 65/100)
50% Final Exam: 77.5/100 (Mean: 67.44, SD: 16.05)
10% Homework: 324/343
10% Class Participation: 10/10

Final Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: I would say the workload is moderate. You have to finish 4 HWs in total and the questions are super difficult, but the HW is a group work so that you may rely on your members. Of course, you have to make sure your members are good at math and trustworthy. The workload of the HW is not directly proportional to the percentage of the HW constitutes. Heavy workload but only 2.5% grade per HW.

reviews.author: Anny
reviews.comment_content: The content was easy to understand and straight to the point.
reviews.comment_teaching: She was an amazing teacher. It was really easy to follow what she says and her ppt were also well detailed. So even if you miss a class and just see the ppt you won't be lost.
reviews.comment_grading: If you have done some stats in high school it will easier. The grading is competitive as the means are really high.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is okay.  2 Quiz, 1 Final, 4 Homework Assignments. Also, attend classes to get the 10% of the participation by collecting the participation card.

reviews.author: hyyyy
reviews.comment_content: useful and well organized basic statistic concepts
reviews.comment_teaching:
1. Kris is really kind and helpful. She speaks clearly(a little Hong Kong accent) and content is well organized.
Participation cards are given out on every answer or question you made during the class. Give an wrong answer and you can still get it.
2. Gbus students are here to raise the curve............
3. TA Jackie is kind of grumpy
reviews.comment_workload: average. 2 quizzes and 4 assignments during the term, hw4 was released and due the last week of semester which was really inhumane.

reviews.author: thyc0309_
reviews.comment_content:
1. Descriptive statistics
2. Basic probability
3. Discrete and continuous random variables
4. Sampling distribution and confidence intervals
5. Hypothesis testing
6. Simple linear regression
reviews.comment_teaching:
She explains the concepts quite clearly, but not really to an extremely good standard. Her pace of teaching is a bit slower than UST average I think.

Btw do attend the lectures although attendance is not counted. They really help you in understanding the content. But for the lab sessions, you don't need to attend them tbh, as I skipped all of them and still handled my assignments rather well.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Class participation (answer 1 question per lecture to get a parti card and hand it back to Kris at the end, and there are also two games throughout the semester which you can get 2 parti points just by playing it, so enjoy!)
10% Group assignments (4 in total, the first two are easy but the 3rd and 4th are quite difficult, and some questions require the use of some Excel functions or even Minitab, rmb to learn them yourself)
10% Quiz 1
20% Quiz 2
50% Final exam

My marks:
Assignment 1: 74/76
Assignment 2: 89/93
Assignment 3: 63/74
Assignment 4: 100/100 (for this one I think just by submitting on time can already get full marks)
Quiz 1: 88/100 (mean: 75)
Quiz 2: 60/100 (mean: 64.8)
Final exam: 77.5/100 (mean: 67)
Participation: 9/10

Final grade: B
WTF!? I expected a B+......
Anyway, it means that the course is extremely competitive
reviews.comment_workload: Generally not heavy. You can actually start doing the assignments just two or three days before the hand-in date. For the quizzes and final exam, just have adequate revision and everything will be fine.

reviews.author: bt
reviews.title: Not really that good a teacher
reviews.comment_content:
Content is not really complicated. Basics of business statistics.
He has got lecture slides that are easy to understand. But he has not assigned a textbook so there wasn't much practice material for you to familiarize with the content.
He did release some practice mc before the midterm but that's not really enough for you to fully prepare.

Part I. Introduction
Course Organization
- Course outline
- Data and Variation (Ch2 - Ch6)
• Types of data, §2.1,2.2,2.4
• Describing categorical data, §3.1-3.4
• Association between categorical variables, §5.1-5.2
• Describing numerical data, §4.1-4.4
• Association between numerical variables, §6.1-6.3, 6.5
Part II. Probability
- Probability Model (Ch7 - Ch9)
• Basic concepts of probability, §7.1-7.2
• Independence, conditional probability, §7.3, 8.1-8.3 • Radom variable, mean and variance §9.1-9.4
- Association between Two Random Variables (Ch10)
• Portfolios, joint probability, §10.1-10.2
• Dependence between random variables, §10.3
• Mean and variance of weighted variables, covariance, §10.4, 10.6 • Game I
—– Quiz I —– - Normal Probability Model (Ch12)
• Normal random variable and normal Model, §12.1-12.2 • Normal quantile plot, §12.3-12.4
Part III. Inference
- Sampling and Sampling Distributions (Ch13 - Ch14)
• Concepts of population, sample and sampling, §13.1-13.2 • Game II
• Sampling distribution, §14.1
- Standard Errors and Confidence Intervals (Ch15) • Confidence interval for μ, §15.1-15.4
• Determine the sample size, §15.5 - Statistical Hypothesis Testing (Ch16)
• Concepts, §16.1
• One sample z- and t- tests, §16.2 - 16.3
—– Quiz II —– Part IV. Linear Regression
- Simple Linear Regression Model (Ch19 - Ch21)
• Linear pattern of data, residual plot, §19.1-19.3,19.5,
• Nonlinear pattern of data and transformation, §20.1-20.4 • The model and conditions, §21.1-21.2
• Inference in regression, §21.3
• Prediction interval, §21.4
BUSINESS STATISTICS (ISOM 2500) (L3), FALL 2017 3
- Regression Diagnostics (Ch22)
• Detecting differences in variation, §22.1 • Outlier and influential points, §22.2
• Dependent errors and time series, §22.3
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturer really needs to improve his spoken English. It is pretty hard to understand his words even when you are paying attention.
He has lecture slides printed out every single lesson so this is an upside.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not really much to comment, the grading scheme is acceptable. The effort and the payout are quite correlated.

Exams are generally conceptually focused, e.g. the distribution of a certain variable, the interpretation of confidence interval, etc., rather than mathematical manipulation. U're pretty much unlikely asked to perform the tedious calculation in the exams.
reviews.comment_workload:
He had a few HW for a group of three. The questions could be more than you would expect, so do it earlier. It is also great if you can find sources for yourself.
Then a midterm and a final, pretty basic

reviews.author: Nicole MA
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite light and if you have gone through mainland high school, it is not very difficult. Mostly concerns statistics. There are no assignments, projects, but attendance is required, and he might do some small games to take attendance.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Zheng is very nice and he is always willing to answer questions after class. There are many interactions in class and he often encourages students to ask whenever they are confused. Although sometimes it makes the course quite boring for repeating the same concept, it might get everyone to understand the materials.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair, which means the only way to get a good grade is by harsh competing and winning over the majority of students taking this course with you. I got a total of 94 and A in the end. The questions in the exams are all MC questions, 17 and 18 questions for each quiz, taking up a total of 25 points for the final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty light, considering it a fundamental course for SBM students, and those who are willing to devote some time to understand the concept can have a fair grade. Just attend the lectures and practice before quiz and final, and you should be fine.

reviews.author: IreneHong
reviews.comment_content: 这个教授的上课内容和其他人有些不同，除了一般的统计学知识外还会教Python编程的内容，前一个月基本都是Python入门，对于初学者来说有点难度，同时他还会利用股票数据讲解一些金融学的概念，因此这门课的内容是十分丰富的，如果不想在学习统计学的同时学其他的东西，你可能不适合选他的课。
reviews.comment_teaching: 老师非常有耐心，可以随时在课上和和课后问他问题。只不过有问题的人非常多，所以常常排不上队hh 有时他会在课上做groupwork，最先回答的小组就可以作业或考试满分，个人其实不太喜欢这种投机取巧的行为，但有些小组会比较开心，你也可以把握这个机会。尽量不要缺席，因为每节课的内容都很重要，错过一节也许就不太好跟上进度。
reviews.comment_grading: Grading还算好
reviews.comment_workload: 隔几周有一次assignment，可以组队做也可以个人做，除此之外就是两次考试，总的来说不算累。

reviews.author: YlY
reviews.comment_content: It's about statistics which M1 students may have benefits on this. All the lecture content is in powerpoint.
reviews.comment_teaching: He will print out the powerpoint lecture notes for us, which I think it is good for us to drop notes. His pronunciation is not so good, but you will figure out what he is saying after a period of time. You can choose to ask him questions in mandarin after class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good as long as you hand-in the assignments on time and do revision for the exams.
reviews.comment_workload:
Mid-term and final exam are MC questions.
You can bring cheat sheet in exam.

Assignments are done in a group.

reviews.author: Jeeby
reviews.comment_content:
just some easy and useless business statistics knowledge
just like DSE M1 but M1 one students don't have any advance at all, coz the course is so easy  and its actually a test of careless or not.
reviews.comment_teaching: the pronunciation of the professor is difficult to understand
reviews.comment_grading:
if your mark raised by one your grade will also raised by one
91%->B
92%->B+
93%->A-
94%->A
all mc questions
attendance 5%

reviews.comment_workload:
no workload
only tow simple quizzes and one final exam
no reading material
no project

reviews.author: Vivian_coco
reviews.comment_content: 强勢promo一波，這門課真的是極好的。内容很實用，學的時候才發現有些東西原來是這樣，感覺到了統計的神奇。上課内容很充實。
reviews.comment_teaching: 教授真的是非常可愛，脾氣也非常好，特別耐心，每次下課以後都會有一堆人問問題。上課的時候會發小卡片記錄回答問題或者提出問題的次數，要達到六次。所以上課的氛圍非常活躍，沒有打瞌睡的情況。老師講的也很用心，問題回答的也很詳細。總之就是很贊。
reviews.comment_grading: 給龜也是挺好的。平時的quiz幾乎和sample題型差不多，衹要好好聽講和認真做sample就ok了。
reviews.comment_workload: workload不大，有兩次quiz和final，quiz前要做sample復習，final前也要做sample復習，其他幾乎就沒有什麽workload了。而且每次考試，無論是quiz還是final，都會有一節復習課，復習之前講的和sample的題目。quiz和final之前也會明確考試範圍。

Probability

sampling distribution
confidence interval
NEW STUFFS

reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Du is passionate on teaching, he included course review in ppt to help us summarize what we have learnt
He  understood students' difficulties, like you could freely choose which section you would like to attend and not required 100% attendance .
He kept repeating so key concepts each lessons which could help you understand those materials more.
He sometimes made jokes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term and final are important
Do those past paper and understand each question
Some questions may appear again (exactly the same)
Getting full marks in all assignments are NORMAL, finding groupmates who could communicate with TA and other groups are important.
Grade: B
Assignments : almost full
Midterm: below mean for once and above mean for once
Final: above mean little bit
reviews.comment_workload:
Medium
Few Assignments
Quiz is just checking attendance, super easy, if not, just ask someone nearby.
As professor said, Marks are not important, you signatures on the quiz are  more important haha

reviews.author: peggy2588

reviews.comment_content:
easy content
very easy to understand.
al the concepts are simple

bad english

reviews.author: pulllll
reviews.comment_content: Normal things are covered no special things are included
reviews.comment_teaching: Average not boring but not too interesting, I think James is already better than most of the professor in HKUST
reviews.comment_grading: All you need to do is attend all quizes in regular lecture which is only a 5 MC and it is open book and computer, with a final score lower more than 2 SD I still got a C-.
reviews.comment_workload: I thing the amount of workload is acceptable, they can done in groups and the amount or assignment is adequate. Is is safe to say that there is not much assignment.

reviews.author: Christeey
reviews.title: its okay, workload very little
reviews.comment_content: its actually quite easy, some are a bit difficult especially the later lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: u must attend all the lessons so u will know about the lecture notes.. his notes are too simple to understand whats going on..
reviews.comment_grading:
2 midterms: 20% each (20 MC)
1 exam: 40% (40 MC)
Midterms and exam are easy, so most people can get high marks.
1st midterm mean: 16.9/20
2nd midterm mean: 16.3/20
Exam: 35.1/40
Grading for three assignments are very high, very easy to get high marks. it has to be done by a group of 3. each assignment has around 15 questions( some with subquestions)
Assignment 1 mean: 45.5/52
Assignment 2 mean: 57.8/60
Assignment 3 mean: 59.2/60
I think most of the groups can get full marks, so if u want a B, u must get a good score here.
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is very light. there is only 3 assignments, 2 midterms( all MC) and exam (all MC).
u must attend all the lessons so u can get some participation marks (5%) because he randomly gives out in class exercises 5 times which records ur attendance (and of course he will not tell u which lessons will have in class exercise).

reviews.author: leolai1999
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content:
-Practical knowledge in business field
-Basic statistics
-Those who studied M1 in HKDSE will get advantages
-Topics covered: Confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, probability, covariance etc
reviews.comment_teaching:
-Professor Du is nice ,funny and patient
-Notes are well written
-One disadvantage is you may not able to understand his accent
-Tutorials are useful
-need to take attendance
reviews.comment_grading:
-VERY GOOD GRADING
-will get B range if you complete all the exercise he gave for revision
-Cheatsheet is allowed
reviews.comment_workload:
-varies among classes
-around 3 assignments which are heavily weighted
-no midterm but quiz, and 1 final

reviews.author: 李晴
reviews.title: Japanese English......
reviews.comment_content:
Causality
Prediction
Regression
Probability
Uncertainty
Hypothesis test

Use R programming language to do all the data processing, it will be a bit hard if you don't have any programming experience.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Japanese accent when the professor is speaking English made his words really hard to understand......
I think he does not explain the theories well, many classmates have lots of questions during and after class. Instead, he focused a lot on the syntax of R language, which is relatively unimportant because we can actually search it online by ourselves.
reviews.comment_grading:
6 assignments (total 70%)
1 Final (30%)

The assignments are quite hard and took me plenty of time, but if you bought the textbook you can probably just copy the answers...... However, the mean is about 8~9 (out of 10) every time.
The final exam contains 5 T/F questions, one calculation problem, one proof question a set of comprehensive problems.
It is not that hard if you understand everything in the slides.

I got an average of 9.5 on assignments, and I know how to do all the final questions.
Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
It took me about 3~5 hours to complete each assignment. (maybe it is because I seldom go to class)
2 days to read over and understand all the slides before final exam.

reviews.author: SixThreeOne
reviews.comment_content: Practical, gives a solid foundation of business statistics with a decent depth. Those who do not enjoy programming like R probably prefer this lecturer because he emphasizes a lot on interpretation rather than actual programming, as he only provides introductory JMP lab session which is also optional.
reviews.comment_teaching: Passionate and willing to go great length in helping out weaker students, albeit his unique accent.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not much to comment other than probably very competitive.
Tips:
1) Try your best to gain all 6 participation mark and remember to submit hard copy homework to get 20%.
2) Fill in all the blanks and draw some diagrams in the lecture slide. The quizzes and exam is based on the lecture slides and nothing else. (Basically, write down everything he has put up on the whiteboard, as well as lecture slides discussion)
reviews.comment_workload:
Really light workload.
1 homework is given before the 2 midterms and 1 finals, and it complements well as a practice for the test itself. The homework only requires to explain the reasoning to obtain the given answer for some specified questions.

reviews.author: fl19o
reviews.comment_content:
Business statistics.
different plots to demonstrate the data like box plot, scatter plot etc.
confidence interval.
the central theorem.
reviews.comment_teaching:
heavy English accent...
He will use many examples in class to illustrate the concepts but not very good at explaining complex concepts clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Midterm 40%: two quizzes testing Part I (20%) and Part II (20%) respectively.
2. Final Exam 40%: covers Part III & IV, which will also be multiple choice format.
3. Assignments 15%: three sets of homework assignments.
4. Participation 5%: take 5 random attendance by doing simple quiz

as long as you do the work and review well, grading is good
reviews.comment_workload: quite small. little homework and if you skip the classes it's also enough if you read the textbook and ppts and review before exams

reviews.author: joycelun
reviews.comment_content: If you didn't studied M1 in DSE, you may think this is difficult to understand. You need to review/ watch youtube video to learn them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
accent is strong
main point of ppt is open cloze, you need to attend the lesson to know the ans
reviews.comment_grading:
students are too talented. the mean is very high.

participation mark for students who ask question or answer question in the lessons
reviews.comment_workload:
only 3-4 homework (before quizzes and final)
homework is from the question of practice quizzes/final

quizzes/final are MCs, no LQ

quizzes/final is similar to the practice one that the prof give us

some lessons have experiment to do to take your attendance.

reviews.author: UST FAT BOY
reviews.title: Very good lecturer
reviews.comment_content: If you have studied DSE M1 before, you have already known 70% of this course. Although the new knowledge is quite abstract, it is still possible to get good grade if you follow the instruction tightly.
reviews.comment_teaching: The powerpoint is very organised and inspiring. Zheng is a nice and patient teacher and he is able to teach in a logical manner. He always welcome questions after class, during office hour or even via email. One reminder: DO NOT MISS ANY SINGLE LECTURE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_grading: For everything, I got full marks and my grade is A+.  Btw, he required you to answer or raise questions for at least 6 times in order to get full mark in class participation.
reviews.comment_workload: Just two homeworks which required you to solve 5 MCQs. Nearly no workload.

reviews.author: Orangeee
reviews.comment_content:
Some materials are similar to the syllabus in DSE M1, which includes normal distribution and confidence interval. After the mid-term, the content became more calculation-based and difficult to understand.

His mid-terms and final have more intuition type questions, like asking you some concepts or examples he taught in class.  

Topic:
1.Data and Variation
2.Probability Model
3.Association between two random variables
4.Normal probability model
5.Sampling and sampling distributions
6.Standard Errors and Confidence Intervals
7.Statistics Hypothesis Testing
8.Simple Linear Regression Model
9.Regression Diagnostics
reviews.comment_teaching:
Due to his accent, sometimes it's difficult to understand what he is saying(at the beginning),albeit  you will get used to it.

He does not allow students to leave the classroom during lecture. He will stop you and ask you the reason.

His ppt that is clear and you need to attend the lecture to fill in the blanks on ppt. Stay focused during lecture. If you are found playing phones, he will come to you and ask you questions.

Teaching is interesting. He uses lots of examples and experiments.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: 10% (3 assignments)
Quizzes: 45% ( 2 quizzes)
Final Exam: 35%
Participation: 10% (4 cards for not undermining the classes, 6 cards, 1 pt each, , card will be given for answering or asking questions)
Cheatsheet is allowed for both midterms and final exam

Grading is generous. Though I just got mean for every test, I still get a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light.
Three assignments throughout the semester. He will pick some of the questions from the practice paper and ask you to show calculation steps or reasons-that's how assignment comes from.
Two mc mid terms and one mc finals.

reviews.author: yclee
reviews.title: Good for someone who doesn't like calculation :)
reviews.comment_content:
Before the mid-term, the materials were similar to those being taught in DSE M1, which mainly includes normal distribution and confidence interval.  After the mid-term, the content became more calculation-based and difficult to understand.

For his mid-terms and final, compare to the other professors, there are more intuition type questions, like asking you some concepts or stuff he taught in class.  So if you don't like calculation, I think he would be a good choice for you! (BTW all the questions are in MCs) :)
reviews.comment_teaching: Although his accent was quite difficult to understand at the beginning,  his teaching was quite interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 Mid-term: 45%
Final: 35%
Participation: 10% (4 marks at the beginning, answer/ask 1Q/mark)
Assignments: 10% (Ask to explain some MCs which he would provide the answer XD)

Me:
Overall: 97/100
Got an A+ at last ><
reviews.comment_workload: Actually except the 2 MC mid-terms, there are only 3 assignment in which we need to explain to some MC questions in his practice mid-term/final.  Normally one questions weights for 0.5% in total grade.  Usually 3-4 questions would be chosen so I think the workload is quite low.

reviews.author: luminous
reviews.title: good introductory course
reviews.comment_content: good introductory course about business statistics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Zheng really teaches well. He encourages participation in class and is always willing to answer questions raised by students in class. The teaching speed is moderate in my opinion. And he tries to explain things really clear with typical examples and data. He use jmp in class but we're not required to use it. By the way, jmp is really useful in data analysis.
reviews.comment_grading:
I have to say the competition is a bit fierce in this course. I heard that 9x% may end up with B but I am not sure in which class.

In professor Zheng's class. There are two quizzes( take up 45% in total)  and one final exam(35%)
10% for 3 assignments throughout the semester
10% for participation: 6% for answering questions or raising questions; 4% for helping maintain good study environment

Mine:
assignments: 10/10( forgot mean but approximately 9.2)
quiz 1 23/23(mean 20)
quiz 2 21/22(mean 18)
final 32/35(mean 29 approximately maybe I make it wrong)
participation: unknown. I got full marks in the question part but unsure about the other 4% part.
Got A at last
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light. Just three assignments throughout the semester. But each pre-requests finishing a practice paper(which is really helpful for the quizzes and final) .Professor Zheng will pick some of the questions from the practice paper and ask you to show calculation steps or reasons-that's how assignment comes from. Overall, it's quite light.

reviews.author: Hin Chan
reviews.title: R programming
reviews.comment_content: Frankly speaking, I don't think it is an ISOM course... we learnt lots of R programming code rather than the statistical knowledge, the focus was misplaced.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is new to HKUST so he doesn't know much about the teaching style in Hong Kong, but he has tried very hard and he always 'instant replies' to our emails. However, his accent is quite...
reviews.comment_grading:
No comment on the grading as the final score was not released, but the score distribution is so weird.
70% for 7 assignments (programming)
30% final
And usually, most of the students would get full mark for all assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is acceptable as only 1 programming assignment for 1 week, no mid-terms and only 1 final. For the assignment, you can discuss them with your friends, so it should be okay.

reviews.author: Code Forgetter
reviews.title: Not a best choice. 建議避開
reviews.comment_content: Each lecture is about 1-2 cases, then based on the taught principles or models, R programming will be shown.  Not easy to begin with if you don`t have knowledge about coding. But if you want to learn R, which still has its place in the field of data analysis(yet will be gradually substituted by Python), you can try.
reviews.comment_teaching: The accent is one barrier. But the instructor is nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
70%  assignment;    2 weeks 1 assignment, 6 in total.
It`s about operating R, writing code to analyze one case.

30% final
similar to the mock test, most questions are about the basic principles and models in the ppt, one question about understanding R (but still asking about the models).
So the final is totally different from assignments.

No attendance. So you can learn by yourself. The PPT is enough.

I got  58.5/60 in my assignment. Final result not released.  And I got A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Since I have no previous knowledge about coding, I would say the workload is above moderate.
I spent 5 hours on average on my assignment, about 18 hours preparing for my final (reciting the PPT).

reviews.author: kakahahaha
reviews.title: 鬥小心既course
reviews.comment_content:
business statistics.
1. normal distribution
2. t-test
3. probability
4. hypothesis test
5. regression
reviews.comment_teaching: Despite his strange English accent, he was a responsible teacher, he will answer your questions whenever u asked him publicly or privately.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 assignments; 5%each
2 mid terms 20% each
1 final 40%
5% attendence; (5 random quiz)

I got A grade with ~94.5% total score.
Have friends got ~91.5% total score but got B+.
Mid terms and final are all MC questions and very easy, so, you must be very careful in mid terms and final
and try best in assignments and make sure get 5%attendence to ensure an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
quite light, just 3 assignments, 3 ppl one group.
Just revise the lecture notes and do the practices paper b4 mid-term and the final is ok.
make sure you know every concept, if u cant understand wt dulilun said, then watched Youtube la, easy concepts.

reviews.author: Veronnica
reviews.title: Nice nice professor
reviews.comment_content: Expect the accent of Mr Du, he taught really well. The latter content is more difficult. The content is totally different according to different professor. For example, I know that a Japanese instruct rue taught C language.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mr Du is very responsible. He is willing to answer any questions regarding the courses for us and he is always very patient.
reviews.comment_grading:
This course is relatively easy for beginners but kind of hard to get satisfactory GPA as there are so many qualified students and they are all able to get high marks. Sometimes even one score counts if you really want to get A level or above
There are three assignments, each takes 5%, and two quizzes , each takes 20%. The residual part are attendance and final exam.
Mr Du check attendance by having games and quizzes. The game is really creative and once we use MM beans for the game. The quizzes in the lecture, on the other hand, is very easy, there are only two MC questions in the quiz and there are totally four attendance checking. As long as you have take two of they, you can complete the attendance part.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is kind of light as we only have three sets of homework and we can finish it as a group. It's also very friendly that we can bring a cheat sheet to the exams. The largest bonus is that we only have to learn one part of the content for a period and then we can leave them behind. That is, there is no content overlap for each of the quiz and exam, which makes it much easier for review.

reviews.author: ducky
reviews.comment_content:
Basic statistics topics, mainly probability, confidence interval hypothesis testing and regression etc.
Some topics covered M1, so it benefits those who studied M1 before.
The content is useful for business students.
Calculations involved. (not difficult if you have studied for exams)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Du's accent is hard to understand. It takes time to understand. I get used to it after a month. It is better for students to ask questions using Mandarin after lessons. However, some concepts are not well-explained. So it also takes time for students to self-study after lessons or before the exams. Notes will be distributed in lessons and also uploaded to canvas.
He is a nice teacher, who is willing to answer students' questions after lessons or through emails. Most importantly, he will purposely finish lessons 10-20 minutes earlier for students to ask questions. But for those who don't have questions to ask, it is good to have lunch earlier. In fact, the content of this course can be learnt through Youtube videos. So, skip lessons is perfectly ok. But barely in mind that there will be randomly attendance taking (totally 5 times-including 2 games played in classes).
The best thing of Prof. Du is that there will be practice question given to study exams. The practice questions are very similar to the real exams. So, by doing and fully understand the practice questions, it is enough to survive in exams. Detailed solutions will be uploaded to canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is ok. Midterms and final exams are not difficult so the mean is high. Students who just got the mean can get a B grade.
All questions in midterm and final are MC. It is great and significantly reduce the workload. There is a significant proportion of questions involved concepts, make sure you fully understand the concepts behind during study.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. There are only three assignments required. All assignments are group work. So get a good groupmate is very important. Some questions are from the textbook and can be easily found on the website. The mean of the assignments are very high (some are even full mark).

reviews.author: cwyyy
reviews.comment_content:
Some materials about confidence interval and probability before midterm. It would be great if you have studied M1 in secondary school before.
Hypothesis testing and Regression are covered after the midterm, which is a little bit confusing to me. Yet, you can always check out videos on YouTube to help your understanding. The course is well-organized and easy to follow.
There are 3 in-class quizzes in Professor Du's lesson. All consists of only 1 MC. Very simple. And there are 2 games included in the lesson. Make sure you take them because it's for taking attendance!
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Du attempts to explain the concept very clearly. Yet, his accent is pretty hard to understand. Need to get used to his funny English. Even some locals asked him questions in Mandarin. He is nice and patient to answer your question after lesson. He even has review with the whole class one lesson before the midterm and final and holds tutorial if you have any questions regarding the exercises he sent you.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think it's pretty good. You still get a B grade even if you just got the mean.
The mean is pretty high. (ref below)
Midterm 1: 17/20

reviews.comment_grading:
10% - Participation
10% - 3 Group Homework Assignments
40% - 5 Bi-weekly MC Quizzes, Best 4.
40% - Final Exam

For participation, just sit near the front and raise your hand and stuff. Even if you don't raise your hand every class, as long as you consistently sit at the front, he'll probably recognize you.

For the homework, buy the book! The answers are in the back of the book, you should easily get at least 90 marks on the homework.

For the quizzes, it is open LAPTOP, so download all the PDFs and just find the right example and apply it to the question in the quiz.

For the final, it is also open LAPTOP. You should almost definitely download all the PDFs and get any other materials you need to be offline.

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Competitive course
reviews.comment_content:
A very applied and practical course which doesn't really focus on the theoretical aspect. Doesn't require rigorous mathematical manipulation. Business students should find it useful.

(Note: Content differs from professor to professor.)

1️⃣ Descriptive Statistics
     🔷 Tabular and Graphical Methods
     🔷 Numerical Method
     🔷 Association between Variables
2️⃣ Probability and Random Variables
     🔷 Probability
     🔷 Discrete Random Variables
     🔷 Continuous Random Variables
3️⃣ Estimation
     🔷 Sampling Distribution
     🔷 Central Limit Theorem
     🔷 Confidence Interval
4️⃣ Hypothesis Testing
     🔷 Z-test and t-test for Population Mean
     🔷 Z-test for Population Proportion
     🔷 Chi-square Test for Independence
5️⃣ Simple Linear Regression
     🔷 Least Squares Estimation
     🔷 Residual Analysis
     🔷 Coefficient of Determination
     🔷 Hypothesis Testing for Significance
     🔷 Prediction Estimates
     🔷 Analysis of Variance (ANOVA)

The course may start off very easy but as it progresses, the level of difficulty increases exponentially. Thus, don't undertake this course too lightly simply because of the seemingly easy beginning.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kris is a very enthusiastic professor. She explains the concepts in details, and she encourages active participation in class by giving us chance to raise or answer questions. One thing I really like is that she does not mind "wrong answers" in class, which certainly helps us avoid making the same kind of mistake again in the exams.

I highly encourage u to attend all the lectures to have a better understanding of the course materials.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's a very competitive course overall cuz they're always some very capable students getting really high marks in the exams. A few careless mistakes can KILL. So if u aim at an A-range then u've to work VERY hard, be SUPER careful and make sure u get full marks in participation. I got a minor slip in quiz 2 and ended up in an A.

Exams are generally conceptually focused, e.g. the distribution of a certain variable, the interpretation of confidence interval, etc., rather than mathematical manipulation. U're pretty much unlikely asked to perform tedious calculation in the exams.

My result:
✏️ Quiz 1: 96/100 (Mean = 76.8)
✏️ Quiz 2: 84/100 (Mean = 71.5)
✏️ Final Exam: 97.5/100 (Mean = 81)
✏️ Assignments: 95.48%
💬 Participation: 10/10
Total: 94.55%

💯 Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
There are a total of 4 group assignments accounting for 10% of the total grade and u're allowed to form a group with at most 4 students to finish the assignments. The assignments are pretty hard and most of them require the use of MiniTab (it's still okay to use Excel, but the procedure might become crazily tedious and complicated). The most frustrating thing is probably to check all the groupmates' work afterward cuz there are always some groupmates making careless mistakes in dealing with the numbers. DON'T be a deadline fighter - please set the internal deadline well before the submission deadline, or u're pretty much finished.

There's also another 10% for participation. To earn participation mark, you can either raise a question or answer her question in her lectures, and she'll give u a card that gives u 1% participation in each lecture. A total of 10 cards will give u full mark in participation. If u're a little bit shy, then u can participate in the 2 randomly assigned class games which account for 2% each. As soon as u attend the lecture that day u'll be able to participate. If u attend both games, then u only need a total of 6 cards to get full marks for participation.
