assignment 1: 115/115
assignment 2: 88/100
assignment 3: 115/115

attendance 3/4

final grade: B-

The grade is fair
reviews.comment_workload:
Three assignments with around 20 questions in each assignment.
Students could pair up to the assignments.
Therefore, the workload was light

reviews.author: gordonwky
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite good, often ask questions so that students can understand. But the pace is quite fast.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 10%
Quizzes 40%
Final 40%
Performance 10%

If you actively answer the questions in class, you will get one participation card every lesson. Also, it is strongly advised not to skip lessons as the professor may conduct experiments in 2 random lessons. Participation in experiment allows you to get extra participation scores.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low, there are only 4 group assignments, 2 quizzes and 1 final exam. We can bring one paper of cheat sheet to the quizzes and final exam, plus all quizzes and final exams are all MC questions. The answer of the assignment can be easily found online, so the workload is not a problem.

reviews.author: m1216david
reviews.comment_content: Most of the content is covered in M1 statistics, so if you studied M1 before basically reading the notes is sufficient.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite interesting and fun. If you pay attention, you can easily pick up what the content
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term and final are all MC, so the mean and sd is quite high. An A4 cheat sheet is provided in both the mid term and final, so you don't have to memorize any equation. Just write them all the facts and the equation that is covered in the notes is fine.
No attendance is taken and you have to take a few participation cards by ask or answer question in lecture.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 4 group assignment with a few questions. After separating the work you only have to do 1-2 questions.

reviews.author: billiejai
reviews.comment_content: Games are the only part of content with fun.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite interesting but too fast.
reviews.comment_grading: Actually the number of classes I attended should be less than 10 in the whole semester, I did not really read back the notes and book. Yet, my professor allowed us to have open book as well as open emotes midterm and final, so all you need to do is to learn everything new during the exam by yourself, if you only want to get b range. daily quiz is simple but the professor seems no longer teaching.
reviews.comment_workload: Some group assignments are required but quite easy to finish. Quiz and games are required to attend throughout the semester.

reviews.author: MarcoCTY
reviews.comment_content:
Content before first mid term is quite elementary and boring (bar charts, pie charts, mean, box plots median etc); expect mean to be very high for first midterm.

Content after first mid term gets more a lot more interesting and a little harder; (standard distributions, t distributions, confidence intervals for populations and samples and linear regression). Look up for study material online (easy to find, just google). Mean tends to drop at 2nd mid term and final.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is alright in lecture (not the best in my opinion but that's just me). However he is very willing to help after class if you want him to explain more in depth or ask any specific questions. Very enthusiastic and willing to explain when you book an appointment.
reviews.comment_grading: Got below mean on 1st midterm and 2nd midterm but above mean on final and still got B, so great grading i guess? All MC though so be careful...
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly group problem sets. Good for practice and revision and not too heavy.

reviews.author: 剑胆梅心
reviews.title: Perfect instructor
reviews.comment_content: This course teaches several most basic statistic models. They will help you to get the primary realization of the application of statistic in business world. But it won't mention too much about the reason behind the principle. It just care about whether you understand how to use it.
reviews.comment_teaching: The theories are not very easy to be mastered. Actually, it will be tough if you expect to study by yourself. But Dr.Pan is quite nice. She will repeat and explain them once and once again until you catch them. So it is crucial for your success to attend every class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grade is pretty nice. If you get a final grade higher than 95%, you will attain A plus.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload isn't much heavy. But you'd better review and  make your own notes in time after every lecture.

reviews.author: ALKH
reviews.comment_content:
Quite easy at first, mainly some basic maths concept but totally different after the midterm. It takes much more time to understand the content after than before.
Instructor focused on the logic behind instead of calculation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very difficult to follow. His pronunciation and the distorted meaning in the materials make revision much harder to finish.
reviews.comment_grading: Not much difference with the others.
reviews.comment_workload: Five assignments in total, not much reading materials. Assignments are handed in individually. Contents are entirely different from midterm questions, so not much reference in those assignments.

reviews.author: nonickname
reviews.comment_content: Before the first midterm, the contents are all very easy. You can learn it by yourself easily. But after the second midterm, it feels like you choose the hell mode.
reviews.comment_teaching: He can remember everyone after the first class (if  you attend).He try to let every student gets involved to his teaching. You can stop him anywhere if you have questions, but if you sneak off, he will ask you questions immediately.
reviews.comment_grading: He is one of the most famous grading killer in ISOM. You sometimes only can get an A even if you are the first one in the total ranking (I don't know if he gave a A+ before). Also small A/B range.
reviews.comment_workload: Only three assignments in group with plenty of time after class. The first two were very easy, just need to follow the steps he taught in class.The third one is a little bit hard but not so challenging, which take about two hours after class.

reviews.author: Gerald W. Liu
reviews.title: Enjoy Python, Enjoy Statistics
reviews.comment_content: Prof. WAN uses Python to teach statistics, making the course fascinating for those who love programming. I think it can even serve as an introductory course for programming if you dig deeper. Python is a very popular tool for data analytics these days, so it should be very useful. The assignments and exams are completely open-book and relatively easy. If you're interested in programming, never hesitate to take this course!
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. WAN has a typical mainland Chinese accent, but it won't be a problem once you get used to it. He also makes a video for every lecture, so you don't need to attend. By the way, he is a very interesting man with a sense of humor.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is generally very good. There are 4 group assignments making up 50% in total. The Midterm and Final exam account for 20% and 30% respectively.
However, you need to be extremely careful, because most assignments and exams are too easy, which means everyone gets good scores. Even a small mistake can be a disaster.
The final exam is much more difficult than the previous tests, so you need to struggle for a good result. As it's completely open-book, a nicely prepared cheat sheet can help a lot.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. All four assignments are group assignments and very easy, you can do them in turns. The Midterm is also incredibly easy. Though I did not spend a single minute preparing for the Midterm (because I was busy with LANG 1002), I still got 99 out of 100. Only the Final requires some preparation, but I think it's natural for any course.

reviews.author: lance03001
reviews.comment_content: I think the content is relatively easy as it includes total 5 topics and 2 of them are just basic probability concepts. The remaining 3 are relatively advanced concepts on regression models which are difficult to understand during the lesson and you have to study for few times after lessons to make sure yourself know what is doing as these 3 topics are highly related.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is average , but you need to take lectures as the online lecture notes are not completed version. the lecturer will upload the complete version of lecture notes after few classes
reviews.comment_grading: There are totally 2 midterms,  one final exam, 10 participation card and 4 group assignments. I think the mean is pretty high as I exceed mean in two mid-terms and higher than a half SD in final, got 7 out of 10 participation cards, finished group assignments in relatively well performance.I think the mean is pretty high as I got 83% overall and my grade is B.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively heavy I think. There are totally 4 group assignments and each assignment includes about 8 questions related to the topic. Once you miss the lesson or the topic and then you won't know how to finish the assignment if you don't revise the lecture notes. It forces you to study so I think this is still good for your study.

reviews.author: Loc
reviews.comment_content: Her notes are quite clear and useful for the assignments. The quizes and exams are related with the notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pretty interesting and provides students a lot of time to ask Qs. Having some games for the participation part and giving some prizes (usually chocolate) after the games and at the last class.
reviews.comment_grading: Basically dependent on the quizes and the exams, while it is a little hard to have the full participation mark.
reviews.comment_workload: Kris PAN will give you enough time to complete the assignents. The solutions of the assignments always can be found in the notes.

reviews.author: leonarduskevin
reviews.comment_content: The lectures are easy up to the second midterm. Between the second midterm to the final, it gets harder and harder.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His teaching is fine, but you still need to revise some parts on your own; especially if you have never studied statistics before.
He hands out participation cards which would be beneficial for your marks.
reviews.comment_grading:
As long as you come to his lectures, you will surely score well in his tests.
There are 2 mid terms and the final exam is non-cumulative.
reviews.comment_workload: There are just 3 graded homeworks throughout the course of the semester.

reviews.author: cch
reviews.title: good professor
reviews.comment_content:
The course includes:
descriptive Statistics
probability
random variable
confidence interval
hypothesis testing
simple linear regression
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecture notes are very clear.
She is able to answer most of the question after the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading includes:
four group assignments (10%)
two quizzes (40%)
participation (10%)
Final exam (40%)

There are only MC in the quizzes and the final exam.
If you ask or answer her a question during the lecture, she will give you a card. Each card contains 1 point. If you get 10 cards, you will get full marks in participation marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not too much.
Only four group assignments in the whole semester.
It is quite easy.

reviews.author: zcachuang
reviews.title: a course to know about coding
reviews.comment_content: At first, Mr Wan's course is a little bit weird for me because he is the only professor who uses python to teach ISOM 2500. However, when you finish this course, you will find it really useful and unique. For the first month, he will teach you some basic functions of ipython notebook and for the rest of the course, you will use python to learn and solve business statistical problems. What is most interesting about this course is that Mr Wan hardly sticks to his plan, for he always leaves behind :)
reviews.comment_teaching: Mr Wan will get the notes ready before each class and he will do in person demonstration in class, so it's not to hard to catch up with what he teaches. Also, he is a really nice guy, he will patiently reply to your email and answer your questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading: Not that good. The grading includes four group assignments, mid-term and final. You may get a really low grade for a trivial mistake in the assignment. If you are familiar enough with python and the business concepts, you will get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too much if you really understand what is taught in class and do in-time review.

reviews.author: 贤三
reviews.title: Basic Statistic
reviews.comment_content:
This class covers statistic concepts, calculations, as well as minitab skills.
PAN offers detailed slides and answers, which can be good material for review before quizzes and the final exam.
Minitab skills will be taught in extra lab sessions and tested in the quizzes. It's better to know how to use the software.
reviews.comment_teaching:
PAN is sweet and breezy. The classes are interesting.
PAN can speak cantonese and putonghua, and she will give out chocolates for games.

PAN will ask students to ask or answer questions in class to get cards for the participation grade. And it's better not to miss the games.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 10% of Final (4 of them)
Quizzes  40% of Final (2 of them, 20% each)
Participation 10% of Final
Final Exam 40% of Final

No attendance will be taken but PAN requires students to get cards for participation grades.

Around 20% A range.
In my class top 5 got A+ and top 10 got A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Personally I don't feel the assignments are very resonable.
Because 4 group assignment with average 5-8 big questions in each have a strict requirement for teamwork. However this is only 10% in the final grade so a few students will not take it very seriously.
Maybe the workload is a little heavy for 10%.

reviews.author: hi:)
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite simple comparing with other professors' teaching materials. Many of them involve calculation. Therefore, repetitive calculations could get a better result.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is nice and the learning environment is quite good.
reviews.comment_grading: Students have to get an extremely high score (>90%) in order to achieve A-range. As the course content is quite straight forward, it is a common phenomenon that students can get high scores. A minor mistake may lower the grading (around 1%).
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a bit heavy. There would be a few assignments, quizzes, in-class participation and final exam.

reviews.author: meiting
reviews.comment_content:
教既野其實唔難,難係在於你要係教過既無數條式之中搵條正確既計出黎。
第一次MT考下你點計D中學野:graph再加少許conditional probit
第二次MT 係Normal distribution, Poisson distribution, binomial dist, 果堆既inferential statistics  
最後就係final, hypothesis testing 同埋 regression line.
有諗住考埋multiple regression 既但唔夠時間教就冇考到。2次MT同FINAL都係MC 形式, Mt 30條,FIANL 40條
reviews.comment_teaching: 每次教完一條新既式都有練習, 佢會DEMO比我地睇, 所以都幾易明,然後走堂真係自己蝕底。但上堂唔好傾計,一定比佢DIU, 佢D 英文都幾難聽,要D時間習慣下
reviews.comment_grading:
因為教D野簡單,勁多人高分
冇記錯個%好似係咁:
12% assignments
40% final
24% 1st mt
24% 2nd mt
然後76-80%都係B-
reviews.comment_workload: 有3份assignment, 一次15-20題左右, 1group 人做既, 每group最多3個人, 冇乜workload, 但有陣時要用Software 做,所以可以上tutor學下點用, 但唔上都得既,個software 唔難用。

reviews.author: ROK_Geoffrey
reviews.comment_content:
Basic statistical concepts, leading to inferential statistics and regression at last.
Basics of Minitab software is also covered by the lecturer, presumably to follow late trend of using computer to do needed calculations. Nevertheless, you are not required to know much about it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fairly passionate about the subject.
Always eager to answer questions from students.
Cares a lot about overall mood of the classroom, hates distracters.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading of Mr.CHEN is notorious for not giving out good grades.
3 Assignments (that you may form a group up to 3) : 12%
2 Midterms : 48%
1 Final exam : 40%
Reflecting overall grading plan, I assumed myself to be at top 25~30% of the class and got B+.
I would say it was not that bad, considering all the stories about his ruthlessness.
reviews.comment_workload:
Unless you tend to procrastinate a lot, you will not be overwhelmed by workload of the lecture.
Just be prepared for the exams using slides (and hopefully questions on the textbook), as they contain some tricky questions.

My complain is that I had to purchase a costly textbook just because I need it to do my assignment.

reviews.author: emily870717
reviews.title: ISOM 2500
reviews.comment_content:
Content is standardized.
Business core course and content was not really hard, quite similar to high school mathematics course actually.
reviews.comment_teaching: If you can understand the accent and slightly fractured English, it will be alright. Sometimes the professor doesnt explain the concept very well, but being able to compute and understanding it yourself with notes and practices will be fine.
reviews.comment_grading: Full marks on both midterms, above one sd in finals, A grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 group assignments, self assigned group.
WOrkload is not really high and just understand the concepts well and do know how to compute for the examinations.

reviews.author: IpNing
reviews.comment_content:
Data analysis using python (programming).
Those who have studied python will find it very easy to follow and get high mark becasue it teaches a lot of basic python code.
It also teach probability, estimation, distribution and regression, it may be easier for who have studied M1 to handle.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is not clear enough because the professor just key in some code and only explain a little, it is difficult to understand the content.
reviews.comment_grading: quite good because professor is trying his best to give good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 group assignments.
1 mid-term and 1 final.

reviews.author: LW
reviews.title: basic statistics, interesting teaching approach
reviews.comment_content:
Covers basic statistics

Limited syllabus (cover way fewer topics than other professors) that students without any stats background can easily fit into the course

Uses python as teaching and exam tools, it adds extra requirement on students who are not familiar with coding




Personal Comment:
It is interesting to use python as the teaching medium as python is the tool used frequently in real-life business data analysis.
Wan Xuhu is the only professor who takes this approach, all other professors stick with the conventional ways, pen, paper and calculator (cheatsheets as well).

If you have limited knowledge on coding, try to learn it or find a friend who is capable to "hard carry" you. Otherwise, you should not choose this lecture.

Do NOT rely on Prof himself or TA for coding problems as it is just very inconsistent.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Despite he is a nice guy, there are trolls everywhere
He makes mistakes constantly and is unable to correct them
(Multiple mistakes are found in his solutions on practice exams)

Students can totally skip ALL the lectures but remember to check out ALL lecture notes to know the topics required then learn them yourself

Make good use of online resources like Wikipedia, Khan Academy, etc.

Do NOT try to ask him questions on coding, just Google them yourself or ask your friends
He shows little understanding on coding concepts and barely gives explanations of his codes clearly

In short, he writes bad codes
(any UST CS students may perform better than him in coding)
reviews.comment_grading:
50% group assignments (in groups of 1-4)
20% midterm
30% final

Grades are scaled within lectures ONLY (as he is in-charge of 2 lectures in Fall 2016)

Both exams are completely OPEN-EVERYTHING (including network, but ofc you should not try to communicate with your friends, this is counted as cheating)

Easy A-range for students without great stats background but adequate understanding on coding (knowledge on statistics is still required, but not that intensive relative to other professors)

Average performance went horribly wrong in the final for some unknown reasons, given 60% of the exam questions are exactly the same (even decimals are not changed) as Final Fall 2015

Midterm: mean=86/91, SD=10.5/9.5
Final Exam: mean=52-53, SD=23

On rough estimation, mean of overall mark should be around 81-84%
Though I got great results at the end, overall grading is a bit tight, 88.X% leads to B (high) / B+ (low), so I cannot give an A to grading

A+ (overall 94.9%, 100% on all assignments)
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely low workload if you have either good understanding on coding or good group mates

Assignments can be finished in minutes, single-handedly
You can totally "free-ride" your group mates without causing any troubles to them

Do spend time to understand basic concepts of coding (for students without any experience) and learn to read error messages and fix the problem on your own

reviews.author: klaw
reviews.comment_content: Content is relevant to real life circumstances and course teaches you how to apply basic statistics to daily life. Also teaches how to use the Minitab software (statistics software which is more useful than Excel) for real data acquired from daily life problems.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is very clear as he uses a lot of examples that helps you understand the material more. Good pronunciation and also provides detailed lecture notes. You would only need to learn from his lecture notes as it is already very clear. Teacher is very friendly and remembers student's names.
reviews.comment_grading: Not bad considering his exams are similar to the problem examples he did in class so its not very hard and the mean is not that high as well. For the first midterm, the mean is 46/60 and it drops to 44/60 on the second midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: Gives 3 problem sets throughout the entire course and the problem gets harder as we get closer to the end of the semester. But its a group assignment so you can divide the workload. No other assignments except the problem set.

reviews.author: twuansharon
reviews.comment_content: The first few chapters are really easy especially for mainland students because the content is included in their high school classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very clear. Pan won't go too fast. She'll explain everything in detail. And she's also trying to be funny and interesting. She's from mainland so she can speak Chinese and Cantonese and English pretty well.
reviews.comment_grading: very fair
reviews.comment_workload: OK. Four assignment with a four people group, two quizes that allow cheat sheet and one final. The assignment is not difficult. There are three lab sessions you can attend voluntarily. But they are really helpful for your assignment. Two quizzes are all Mutiple Choice questions.

reviews.author: Jasson
reviews.comment_content: Content is sufficient, but doesn't follow a certain book. I believe the book and supplementary information is needed to do well on the quizzes. There are 3 quizzes, 3 assignments and 5% of the grade belongs to participation in class. 3 assignments are easy because they are the practice quizzes given before the actual quizzes (just answer and show work for a few questions assigned).
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very passionate about teaching, and is very nice as he takes the time to get all his students involved. But it's quite hard to understand him in class. At times his explanations are clear, but other times his explanations can be unclear.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading of assignments are very generous. Can't say much about the grading of quizzes, as there is only one correct answer for MC.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not too heavy. All assignments he gives are a few questions from the practice quizzes he gives out before each quiz.

reviews.author: Avocado
reviews.title: Very useful course.
reviews.comment_content: Relatively simple content related to business statistics - focuses on general statistical methods, probability, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, etc. The content is well summarised on the lecture slides, however it's not complete so it's wise to go to class because she mentions a lot of extra information in class that isn't on the slides.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kris is a really clear teacher, and she's very patient when answering questions. Although she might have a slight accent, it's pretty easy to understand her so it should be no problem trying to follow her in class. She's also really nice if you approach her before/after class with questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is pretty fair, but a warning - the mean is pretty high!

There are 2 quizzes and a final exam (all are non-cumulative, but you do need some of the previous content in later topics - e.g. confidence intervals in hypothesis testing etc). The quizzes have 25 questions, and you are allowed a double-sided handwritten cheat sheet. The mean is pretty high, so try to be 1 SD above mean.

There are also 4 homework assignments which you complete in a group. The questions are pretty decent but a bit tricky, however do review these questions because the exam questions are a bit similar.

Kris also gives out participations cards, and there are also 2 games during the semester which count for participation credit.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much workload, depending on how much time you're willing to invest in the course.

reviews.author: Laf
reviews.comment_content: Mostly about basic statistic concepts and a little bit minitab knowledge. Questions in exams are quite straightforward, but are required to fully understand the concepts. It's not difficult to follow if you pay attention in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kris explains every details about the concepts in class well. Her slides are well-written with adequate examples to show you how to do the calculations. But you still need to take some notes. You can ask her questions in Cantonese, Mandarin, or English. Overall she is a nice lecturer.
reviews.comment_grading:
Questions in exams are relatively easy to other lecturers. Calculations are too easy. Questions that asking about concepts sometimes may be difficult. You need to fully understand every terminology.
So getting an A-range is quite competitive. The mean is high. Since there are participation cards that are worth of 10%, it's important to get full marks in participation if you want an A-range grade. You can probably get an A/A+ when the total grade =>95%.
But if you just aim for an average grade, it would be easy.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very low. You just need to do 4 group assignments throughout the whole semester. There are 2 midterms and 1 final but non-cumulative.

reviews.author: cho
reviews.comment_content:
Content is fair
PPT is a bit hard to follow because there are only little words for explanation
He did some excel demonstrations in class
reviews.comment_teaching:
He usually follows the PPT and reads aloud
English is hard to understand
Explanation not clear enough
But he is nice and willing to answer students' enquiries
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is okay
He may adjust grades that are at the margin e.g. C+ to B- if you actively participate in class
reviews.comment_workload:
There is not much workload for the time being
Only 3 assignments, 2 midterm and 1 final

reviews.author: kaki
reviews.title: very good grade course
reviews.comment_content: This course is prepared for students who haven't leared chem before. Since you have to pick up the whole content which supposed to be taught in high school so the course will not go through all the topic one by one. But it is easily to catch up if you attend the lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: the instcutor always do lots of experiment during the lecture and made it more interesting and easiler to understand, good teaching sytle
reviews.comment_grading: very good grade, but surely you have to pay some efforts.
reviews.comment_workload: Just one individual or group project( up to u) and one final exam.

reviews.author: psycolin
reviews.comment_content: Non-cumulative for mid-terms and final, both in MC. Most contents relate to maths. Professor left most of the lecture notes blank, you have to attend the lectures if you do not want to miss the key points.
reviews.comment_teaching: It took me a bit time to understand and get used to professor's accent, yet he is a passionate in teaching and willing to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean of the course is quite high.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light, only need to submit 3 assignments but he had come across those question. You have to get four participation cards so as to gain all the participation credits.

reviews.author: klaudius
reviews.title: Good Prof
reviews.comment_content: Great and organized content, he has 4 main topics , each divided to 2/3 sub-contents. Content is easy to understand and required basic math knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teacher, discipline and does not like people who play with their mobile devices during the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
He does not give A+ on any circumstances, the mean is quite high.
There are homeworks, 2 midterms,  and 1 final (non-cumulative). He allows 1 cheatsheet for every exam. Just make sure you write every formula in your cheatsheet and you will do just fine.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 3 homeworks in total from the books.

reviews.author: da zi
reviews.comment_content: Content is comparably easy and does not require to memorise the content as it allows to use cheat sheet. All exams are non-cumulative.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching, with detail explanations. If you pay enough attention during the classes, you may understand easily. Jot notes during the classes. Also, try to be more active during classes, answer or ask her questions will both help, as she requires students to get 10 participation cards. Instead, you may participate in the games, which there are 2 games in total, with 6 more participation cards to gain the 10% participation.
reviews.comment_grading: Not so good, as the content is comparably easier, people who are good at calculation will get higher grades easily. High mean with small SD.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload, with 5 assignments only.
Yet, it has 2 mid-terms and 1 final exam. Though all the tests are non-cumulative, so the content you need to revise is not that much.

reviews.author: ommemax
reviews.comment_content: There was plentiful content on how to get equipped for using statistics in business situations with examples such as linear regression.
reviews.comment_teaching: James had a very relaxed style of teaching and frequently included anecdotes of himself as memory devices or giving us pointers on what will be appearing on quizzes etc.
reviews.comment_grading:
There were 5 or 6 group assignments and they had a very strict grading , but the quizzes and the final exam are all MC questions and although very hard are solvable provided you attend all lessons as similar problems will be discussed during class.
(p.s. I do not have the exact data but a B can be easily attained without much effort)
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload. The materials are not hard to follow if you attends the lecture. Because of the introductory nature of the course, it is very easy to catch up even if you miss some lectures in a row.

reviews.author: Nadia
reviews.comment_content: content before midterm is relatively easier but those after is way more difficult and challenging, sometimes you need to try finding a solution yourself that is not taught in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: it's hard to understand everything during lectures, it would be better if this course can have tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading: it's ok, you need to do very well, almost full marks for every midterms and final in order r to get a range.
reviews.comment_workload: this course does not have much workload, you just need to hand in homework after each topic

reviews.author: They call me Mo
reviews.comment_content: Overlaps with HKDSE M1 so the guys who studied statistics before have a great advantage. First half of the course is basically just revision for the M1 guys. Second half of the course starts to get difficult. But by doing the exercise in the book, the assignments plus a few pastpapers, there should be no big problem with tests and exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tries his best to explain concepts in class.

A bit of Chinese accent but explaination is still clear.

Funny Guy.

Very willing to answer questions after class.
Even more willing to answer questions by appointment.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading solely based on assignment, tests and exams, very subjective.

Participation sometimes recorded for tie-breaking purposes.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 Group Assignments.

Questions are moderately challenging.
(Most of the questions will be used in the exams so you won't regret putting your time in it)

1 Mid-term (cheat-sheet allowed)

1 Final (cheat-sheet allowed)

reviews.author: Anson Kan
reviews.comment_content: it is said to be the easiest content among other instructors in isom2500. All stuffs are taught via powerpoint, no other teaching materials are needed, twice gaming section per semester. It should not be difficult for those who have studied M1 in secondary school. Maths knowledge is required (specially in form of concepts) but those maths question in exam can be solved by equation its proved even you do not understand the concept of it at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pretty straight forward teaching following the flow of the powerpoint with some funny (not that much actually) examples. Really nice to those having questions to ask. So feel free to ask more questions and most of the time she can explain it better than what she talked during the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: Tests are in mc only, students usually get a high mean score which maybe a drawback, but overall recommended for those who aims for high grade. Providing a score system that requiring students to answer questions during the lesson, which is actually a chance for students to score high grade since some of them usually wont even attempt once.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is acceptable, maybe group assignments every one to two weeks and thats all. The assignments from the first half semester is pretty easy to do but those after the mid-term test can be challenging, the mean score of the assignments are usually high, which should beware of.

reviews.author: wahahapurewater
reviews.comment_content: Well,Quite boring tbh. Especially to those who hate maths.
reviews.comment_teaching: His accent is quite.... strange. Lectures are not interesting. Attendance is quite low (according to my observation). Self studying textbook and his powerpoint slides does work.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good. Mean=B- or even B
Du lilun gives good grades. He even offers tips and revisions before midterm n finals.
reviews.comment_workload: Your daily workload is to simply fulfil 3-4 homework (with 6-7 questions each) together with your group mates. Midterm n finals are all in the form of MC. Handwork does pay off in this course.

reviews.author: jtyk
reviews.comment_content: This course is about statistic and some of the content is already learnt in the secondary school. But there are also some new and more complicated knowledge about statistic.
reviews.comment_teaching: The content is well-explained. The professor will do some of the example with you step-by-step. He is open to questions and is also an interesting person which make the lecture less boring.
reviews.comment_grading: 48% of the grade come from two midterms and another 40% come from one final which are all mc. No attendance is needed to be taken. There is no participation mark. The other 12% is from the 3 problem sets.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. Only three problem sets are needed to be done during the whole semester. You can form a group of two to three to hand in the problem sets together or you can finish them by yourself. Forming a group can help to reduce your workload.

reviews.author: Edkward
reviews.comment_content: prof. Pan is a great teacher. Her lectures are punctual, clear and not so difficult. Shes willing to answer students' questions after lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching pace is just about right, wont be so fast even for students with medium math bg. Its better to preview the lecture notes before lesson cause u need to ans some of the questions in the lecture note to obtain the card.
reviews.comment_grading: There are 2 quizzes and 1 final. All of them are MCs only and you may find them not so difficult if you pay attention on class and do the exercises assigned by TA. Students also need to answer questions to get the card (instead of taking attendance)  which weigh 10% of the overall marks.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not so heavy, just 4 groupworks throughout the whole course. Normally, students will be given around 1 week to finish the groupworks which are difficult indeed even if you pay attention on lecture.

reviews.author: htliab
reviews.title: quite good
reviews.comment_content: probability, use minitab, estimate sample mean, analysis from the graphs,etc....
reviews.comment_teaching:
clear and structured ppt.
she is nice and welcome to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
easy to get satisfied grading.
but hard to get A grade unless you get a full mark in any one quiz.
many students can get a result that is above mean since questions are strict forward.
so better not to skip any lesson since she will explain many details that are not shown on ppt.
reviews.comment_workload:
group project + quiz + class participation
group project will be easy if you have cooperating and responsible group mates.
4 group assignments. sometimes the questions are really long and clumsy.

reviews.author: cheng shu ting
reviews.title: good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus is simple and not too much.
Easy to follow and easy to catch up.Exam Questions follow the past paper he gave us .The format is simple as long as you have studied hard for the homework he gave
reviews.comment_teaching: He is very nice and willing to assist us when we don't understand.He offered question time before final exam .
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite good because i got B for 81%,it requires a little bit to reach B+ ,which made me very angry because i had out a lot of effort in the examination
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not much and easy to answer the questions

reviews.comment_content: Basic business statistics
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor James has more of laisse faire style of teaching. He does not really care as long as you do your job. He provides power point lecture notes, but you may need a text book for further explanation.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think he has quite fair grading (at least for me).
Quizzes and assignment in this class are pretty easy so you should get almost full mark - or else it is really easy to get two or more sd below.
He likes to test you on application of the theory - so just memorising the equation won't help you much. You should understand the content.
reviews.comment_workload: Even though there are 3 quizzes and 3 assignments, these are pretty trivial, so I would say workload is low.

reviews.author: Violet
reviews.comment_content: This course teaches the basic statistics. The first half of the course is pretty simple if you have learnt some statistics in high school, the second half becomes a bit tough when it goes to hypothesis testing and regression, but the assignments are good practicing materials.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kris is very cute and friendly, she's willing to talk to students and very patient if you ask her questions. One thing I don't quite like is the card, you have to ask or answer questions in class to get the cards, which counts for at least 6% of final grade.
reviews.comment_grading: Attendance, 2 quizzes(midterms), 4 assignments and 1 final. Compared to other professors Kris gives very good grades as far as I know. I got full attendance, above mean for 3 assignments but slightly below mean for the other, 25/25 and 24/25 for the quizzes and 38/40 for final, got A+ in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: As there are 4 group assignments throughout the semester, the workload is not light, but as I have wrote these assignments are great materials for revision. My group-mates are kind-of free-riders so I completed much of the assignments by myself, which helped me with the exams a lot.

reviews.author: hyctam
reviews.title: Poor Grading
reviews.comment_content: The PPTs only contain the most basic concepts without detailed explanation.
reviews.comment_teaching: She doesn't even know how to speak proper English. So be prepared to study it yourself if you are the sort of person who despises mainland professors with poor English.
reviews.comment_grading: This is absolutely the poorest part of the course because some of the students have actually studied advanced statistics in high school but for some reasons they dropped it so even though there is a mechanism to separate students who have and have not studied advanced statistics before, you will still face very stiff competition for good grades.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much except the weekly assignments.

reviews.author: Nick
reviews.title: Good grade, medium level of workload
reviews.comment_content:
Notes are good with all the concepts.
Organised and clearly explained.Can understand even you skipped lessons. The content u learnt are useful for future studies especially if u want to major in finance,
reviews.comment_teaching: Good and clear. Need to answer questions to get cards for parti mark. She is willing to answer your questions and will explain it very clearly. TA is helpful too and responsible.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good. MT and Final above mean 1 SD and get all parti cards and handed in all hw = A-
reviews.comment_workload: Medium. Some quiz and mt and final and parti cards and hw done in grouo

reviews.author: Janny
reviews.title: Relax and good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly about probabily and normal distraibution. Good for those who study M1 before in secondary school.
A bit difficult, especially for linear regression.
Main topics include: provavility, confidence interval, hypothesis testing and linear regression. The latter topics are more difficult,prepare for it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Accent is really a huge problem. Eventhough I am a Hongkonger, I can barely understand what he said at first.
Traditional Chinese accent. If you miss some content due to his accent, you can always ask him after class. He is in a good maner and willing to explain untill you understand (I once ask him questions for about half an hour, and he is still very patient.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two midterms and one final plus 4 homework
Usually above mean less than one sd and finally got A-
At first there was no attendence's mark. However, since too few people attend his class due to his poor accent, he decided to include that in ramdom lessions. Thus, it is better to attend lessons but do your own stuffs.
reviews.comment_workload: Two midterms and one final plus 4 homework. The homework are quite troublesome and it is a groupwork ( at most 3 people)[That means freerider problem] Midterm problems are quite tricky but final is straght-forward and easier. Remember to study the textbook and finish the true and false session in textbook becuase it can help you to understand the concepts. The most important point is that some questions in final exam are directly copied or just changed a little bit form the true and false session. So please finish all the questions in that session.

reviews.author: Genn Bucker
reviews.comment_content:
All content were gone through much more deeply than other sessions. All materials were come from Postgraduate courses.
Covered CAPM and multiple non-linear regression which are not supposed to be covered.

Final exam were 30 MCs but really difficult.
**IF YOU DONT LIKE MATH/STAT, DONT CHOOSE James. You will die hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: Funny and interesting class, you will never fell asleep.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grade. All quizes and exams were open book and open laptop, you need to understand all the concepts in order to pass the exam and score high marks.

Got full mark in all the quizes and above mean in final, got me a B+.
Not really good but fair enough though.
reviews.comment_workload:
You can simply skip all the classes, no attendance is needed.
Just several group assignments. Of coz, you can do it individually, but workload would be harder.
Hope not to have free-riders in your group :)

reviews.author: Roddie
reviews.title: Business Statistics but quite triky
reviews.comment_content:
Probability, obviously that is something that you've learnt in your high school, so this one is easy.
Confidence interval, something new, but not as difficult as you think, read the material given for two days and you can understand it, at least how to solve the calculation questions in the midterm.
Hypothesis testing and Linear Regression......
insanely difficult!!!!!!!! It takes me about 3 days to have a little understanding on it!!! But when you read do more exercises and read the slides more often, you can ace it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dulilun's accent is.... completely not understandable..... He accent is too serious that I can barely understand, and I need to spend so many time in understanding his accent. So...I skipped the classes quite often, since even if I go, I will not pay attention, so I would rather skip the class to have a day-off lol.
(At the syllabus, there is no attendance, but Mr.Du thought that there are so many people skip his class, so he decided to take attendance, you might have a chance to upgrade from B+ to A- if you have full attendance, btw, it means you are the greatest among all the B+, which means you slightly a little bit less than A-, can have a chance for upgrading)
reviews.comment_grading:
23/24 mean 19

19/24 mean 14(I exclude the mark addition, Du thought that the grade of this midterm is so bad that he decided to add 4 point to each of us, which is completely useless..)

30/33 mean 23

some assignments both above mean

got A
reviews.comment_workload:
Four assignments one final and two midterms, quite a lot of things to do in fact. But I think there is no need for you to read the textbook, but practicing the questions would be useful.

A tip: REMEMBER TO UNDERSTAND THE CONCEPT!!! As a math-related courses, I used to think that there will be only calculation problems, but I was wrong.... So many tricky concept problems.

Mini quizzes are consisted of all MC questions ( 8 - 10 mcq) , easy to screw up.
reviews.comment_grading:

       quiz 3: 8/8  mean: 6.3/8
All assignmetns above mean
Final : 20/30  mean:17

In the end I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fine. 4 assignments through out the course, 3 mini quizzes, and 1 final exam.

reviews.author: Phoenix
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1 Data description
Topic 2 Probability
Topic 3 Estimation
Topic 4 Hypothesis testing
Topic 5 Simple Linear regression

The first few topics are very easy for you to understand, it is very similar to statistics that you learn in high school, but you should pay attention in the last topic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor are very nice, her teaching is not boring. There are 2 in-class experiment, both of them has lots of fun.
She is really willing to give you some assistance if you encounter difficulty in learning.
You have to answer her questions to get participation cards, 6 cards and 2 labs are enough for you to get full mark.
reviews.comment_grading:
• Quizzes 40% (2 quizzes)
• Final 40%
• Homework 10% (4 assignments)
• Performance through the Curriculum 10% (Class participation)

Both 2 Mid-term have 25 MC questions, Final 40 questions.
Generally, the grade is good
reviews.comment_workload:
Group assignments are quite difficult and the workload is little bit heavy, Many friends of mine don't certain the answers.
For Lab, there are 2 labs, no participation mark, and the notes are uploaded on canvas, quite easy for you to follow, so you can attend them or not

reviews.author: Victoria
reviews.comment_content:
Stats course, which covers descriptive statistics, probability, inferential statistics, linear regressions, stuff like that.

This term he didn't cover multiple regression because he didn't have enough time.
reviews.comment_teaching: He's a good teacher, all in all. I think he likes teaching very much and he responds to your questions well. However, he doesn't allow mobile phones--believe me he gets pretty mad if you're found to be playing with your phone, and he expects the class to be quiet.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Assignments (total of 12%)
2 Mid-terms (total of 48%)
Non-cumulative final exam (40%)

He doesn't give A+, which is pretty sad. But the grading is quite fair, I guess. This term's mean is relatively lower than last term's, so it's not that difficult to get an A and the curve is pretty normal(?)
reviews.comment_workload: Only the 3 assignments, which you can work on with 2 other persons at max. The exams are all non-cumulative, and as long as you pay attention in class (and you get an A4 duplex cheat sheet anyway) you'll be fine in the exams.

reviews.author: Michael Wong
reviews.title: Good fundamental course for statistics
reviews.comment_content: T-Test, Z-Test, and linear regression are extremely helpful and are the essentials of statistics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear and concise explanation did help classmate to understand the course.
reviews.comment_grading: Midterm and Final exams are all in MC-format, pretty good for students who can't memorise course contents words by words but able to understand the concepts behind. The grade is not bad if you can strive +1 sd in every midterm and final exams, students with prior knowledge about z-test, t-test and confidence interval will have an advantage.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is relatively less than other business core courses, as it only requires 2-3 midterm exams, and 1 final exams. Those are in MC-format, very little to memorise if you could understand the concepts behind the calculations.

reviews.author: wwpy
reviews.title: Scored 93/100 and still didn't get an A range!!!
reviews.comment_content: All professors have a similar syllabus, but Prof. Kris Pan's sessions are easier than the other professors', as she tends to skip all the parts she finds "too difficult for year 1 students", while other professors may still cover those parts. Concepts such as standard deviation, variance, confidence interval and sample mean are highly favourable to students who have studied M1 in secondary school. Hypothesis testing about critical values and p-values is something new, but not difficult to understand as long as you practise more with the exercises in class and the homework questions. The most difficult topic, linear regression, was not assessed much in the final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not much comment about the teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Simply to say, it is extremely easy to get a B+, but if you want to get A range, it is not easy at all.

Most of the students get a B+ in Kris Pan's session as her quizzes and exams are extremely easy with only straight-forward multiple choice questions. A one page, double-sided cheat sheet is allowed, so as long as you copy all the important information from the ppts on to the cheatsheet, you can easily score above 80%. However, since the scores of students are packed together, any careless mistake may cause you to follow below the mean, so make sure you do not get more than 3 questions wrong in any of the papers if you want to get at least a B+.

The differentiating point between B+ and A range is during the final, where there are 3-5 questions you cannot directly find the answer or required concept from the ppts. In this case, it depends on whether you have been paying attention in class and have jogged down some points that the professor has mentioned but did not appear in the slides.

I only got a B+ in the end and my total score for the whole course was 93/100. To get an A range you probably need to get 95/100, which means you need to get almost everything correct.
reviews.comment_workload: Aside from 2 midterm quizzes and a final, there are group homework sets every 2/3 weeks. The homework is not difficult, but be sure to proofread and check the answers for your group mates as well. Many times students divide the questions among the group and only focus on their own question, so there may be some errors as a result.

reviews.title: ISOM
reviews.comment_content: Basic but useful statistics
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof PAN always wears smile on her face, encouraging us to participate in the class discussions and be active.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes 40% (75 minutes each). There will be 2 quizzes: testing Part I (20%, cover all contents before Estimation), Part II (20%, Estimation).
Final Exam 40% (120 minutes, covers hypothesis testing and linear regression).
Homework assignment 10%. There will be 4 Group HW.
10% = Participate 2 games (4%) + get 1 or more cards in 6 out of 22 lectures (6%). Or 10% = get 1 or more cards in 10 out of 22 lectures

Quizzes and Final are all MCs.
a piece of A4 double-sided cheatsheet is allowed.
Not difficult but you may need to be careful.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much but you need to spend some time reviewing the notes.
You have to answer more questions in class in order to get good grade.

reviews.author: Ling
reviews.comment_content: 90% of the content is similar of DSE M1
reviews.comment_teaching:
Better listen to her lecture carefully since some of the content will be appeared in exams directly.
Professor's explanation is clear
reviews.comment_grading:
Require class participation (which is asking question and collect cards in lecture).
Midterms and exam are all in MC format. If I remeber correctly, students are allowed to bring their own cheat sheet, which is generally imply that the difficulty of the exams are comparatively high.
Group based HW which is easy.
reviews.comment_workload:
Okay workload.
Exams is a little bit too much.

reviews.author: nsrkguhk
reviews.comment_content: very interesting. i like it very much!! i love it! i highly recommend this class! reg it la!
reviews.comment_teaching: good but i do not remember his name. he is quite handsome with short hair and glasses.
reviews.comment_grading: great i have 78% on quiz 1; 98% on quiz 2 and 87% on final exam. I have very good parti in class and the prof likes me. I got an A finally.
reviews.comment_workload: less. no homework or classwork. 0 workload basically. you do not have to go to the class since it is useless and it count nothing. so dont go!h

reviews.author: Samo
reviews.comment_content:
Essentially, the course is divided into four aspects ranging from simple descriptive statistics, to probability & distributions, regressions, and hypothesis testing.

Content is generally easy to follow, and in the case that you don't, the professor is very willing to repeat things in class and/or respond to your queries via email.

You may find like you aren't getting enough practice questions, so feel free to approach him, and he will suggest some for you to do.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great professor, with a real love for statistics. Engages the class often, and will go through every line of text in his notes during the lectures. Feel free to ask questions at any point during the lecture if it seems confusing to you.

He is very structured in his teaching, punctual, responsive via email, and has a zero-tolerance attitude for anyone disturbing his teaching. Don't be surprised when he goes completely mute and stares at one person, because they're in trouble! Don't use your phone in class, and don't talk loudly, and you'll be fine. Don't be surprised to find out that he knows your name, even though you've never spoken in class.

Hands down, one of the most passionate profs I've had classes with.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading for this course is very objective - exams (midterm and final) are MCQ based, and problem sets have fixed answers.

The means for all exams tend to be quite high, such that sometimes the max a person can get is 0.7 to 0.8SD above mean. That being said, it's easy to mess up, because everything is MCQ based. He will allow you to use a cheatsheet during all exams.

2 Midterms, 24% each
3 Problem sets, 4% each
1 Final, 40%

No official attendance, but it seems like he takes it mentally. Friend of mine received the same scores as me for almost all assessments, and finished a subgrade below.

Don't worry about where you stand during the course. He is a statistics professor, and will provide you every single statistic you can think of for the midterms (I remember him uploading a 12 page document full of midterm related statistics).
reviews.comment_workload: A problem set a month, a midterm every month and a half. Nothing excess about the workload of this course, but keep in mind, that to do well, you would ideally want to do some practice problems in your free time, so that you ensure you're actually retaining the knowledge from his classes.

reviews.author: Ian
reviews.comment_content: Not too hard, although the theories are not completely taught. There are still minor places left out for higher-level course, and might cause slight ambiguities at times.
reviews.comment_teaching: Never register an early class with Prof. Du. He would repeat key points during lectures, but his accent and tone make it difficult to stay focused, especially in morning classes. Apart from that, he is kind and willing to help. If you raise any questions during lessons, you would always get an answer. I do remember him answering a question raised in the previous lesson, and made his points clear. Just try not to fall asleep, and do some self-studying.
reviews.comment_grading: Average. Prof. Du kinda makes sure no one gets a D grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is minimum. Homework is not difficult; exams are all MCs.

reviews.author: qwlee0526
reviews.comment_content: Standard syllabus just like other instructor. Mainly about statistics like binomial distribution, normal distribution, linear regression etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: very easy to follow but the accent may make it difficult to hear sometime. Although u may find a bit difficult to follow , he usually repeat the important parts and make it clear in mathematical presentation.
reviews.comment_grading:
very good grading.
12% assignment is basically given to you because you can find the answers in the textbook.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very few workload.
No attendance required.
5 assignments but you can finish each of them in one page.
12% Assignment
48% Midterm(x2)
40% Final

reviews.author: onejerry
reviews.title: Good teacher and good grade!
reviews.comment_content:
The teacher taught us some basic statistical information using Python2.7. So when we are obtaining knowledge on ISOM2500, we are studying  some programming skills at the same time.
Therefore, the class allows us to use computers to learn ISOM2500, which is the first time. However, the ISOM part occupies a small portion than the other lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teacher is very famous and skillful. He is also a very kind man. We treat him as our friend. The professor will even have coffee with you after class to chat with you and answer your questions.
The teaching assistant is negligible.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 Assignments, each occupies 15% (using computers to hand in)
1 Final, 40% (also using computers, open-internet test)
Remember:
NO QUIZ
NO MIDTERM
(if the professor is in a good mood)
reviews.comment_workload: All the workload is only 4 assignments. If you work hard and review your lecture contents often, you can get a good grade. Don't be afraid of the programming part because the professor only requires you to use the ready-made code to do ISOM. All you have to do is to understand what these codes are telling you and why they are here.

reviews.author: Lexi
reviews.comment_content: For professor Pan, I think her content is really detailed and well-structured. And you can ask anything about this course after class and she will answer it patiently.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think she really know how to teach and know whether students can understand it easily or not.        And she always  repeats the points she will test in the exam so if you don't fall asleep in class or skip classes, you will get a good grade.
reviews.comment_grading: I think she always tries her best to give you good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: I think workload is not very big because you finish it in a group of 4 people and the deadline usually is not very tight.

reviews.author: fish
reviews.comment_content:
Teach useful business statistics.
Have basic M1 knowledge will handle this course easily.

reviews.author: Daniel
reviews.title: Good Grade
reviews.comment_content: this course covers useful fundamental knowledge of information system, it includes the use of python that will definitely benefit your future career. Python is a powerful tool that is commonly used among the business field to possess business statistics. And 70% of the syllabus of the course covers the application of Python.
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor is humorous and conscientious. The TA are helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: 30% A range, 60% B range.
reviews.comment_workload: Several group projects discussing the problems of Python, the questions are quite easy and actually can be finished individually. No midterm. The questions in the final exam are similar as those in homework, some simple calculation is needed.

reviews.author: HYH

reviews.comment_content:
basic introductory course.
useful content (most of the content is highly relevant to business world)
difficulty appropriate for business student

all mc

reviews.author: Jamess
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1 Data description
Topic 2 Probability
Topic 3 Estimation
Topic 4 Hypothesis testing
Topic 5 Simple Linear regression

(Topic 6 Multiple Linear regression was not taught at last)

The course offers a general introduction into statistics, which mainly focuses on the application of basic statistical tools.

The first two topics are easy to grasp, while topic 3 - 5 are interconnected. Topic 5 especially involve knowledge from all previous topics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kris teaches interactively. She would engage with the entire class through her gestures and often ask questions to students.

She would use some simple illustrations/examples to open the topic of each lesson so to introduce/recap on some materials.

Sometimes she would speak a little fast so it might be hard to follow, or some areas on the PPT would be confusing/  unexplained, leaving you dumbfounded. Regardless, she welcome students to ask for clarifications freely. You can also ask her after class.

One minor point is that she really hate people talking in her class. She would get annoyed by that quite quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
• Quizzes 40% (in my case, 2 quizzes)
• Final 40%
• Homework 10%
• Performance through the Curriculum 10% (Class participation)

All quizzes and the final exam are examined by MCs. Beware of the tricky questions :p

Homework assignments were group-based.
There were 4 homework assignments. Some questions were difficult to grasp, especially approaching the end of the semester the difficulty bumped up quite significantly. Make sure you allocate time in completing them.

Class participation is fun actually. Just fire questions / answer questions during the class to earn participation points.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for the course is okay. Just don't skip too many classes and you will be fine.

上堂唔好玩電話 會叫你個名出黎

計印象分
reviews.comment_workload: 三份Assignment要整統計圖同計數

reviews.author: Anson Lo
reviews.comment_content:
1. Basic Statistic
2. Probability
3. Discrete/Continuous Random Variables
4. Sampling Distribution
5. Confidence Interval
6. Hypothesis Testing
7. Simple Linear Regression

For Midterm and Examination, it is fine if you only revise powerpoint. The powerpoint is usually guided by an case example with some questions. There are several questions for Midterms and Final which is the past paper questions.

The professor often modify the notes that have been posted on CANVAS to self-correct the mistakes made in the powerpoint. There are extension powerpoint covers those interesting statistic that will not be tested, e.g. "Financial Time Series"
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor tried his best to make complicated stuffs easier. Moreover, he is willing and patient to answer you questions. You can make an appointment with him through an email, and he would spent over an hour to talk and teach.

However, his English is a bit hard to listen with some Mainland accent. But after several lessons, you can identify what he is trying to say.
reviews.comment_grading:
The professor has tried to avoid giving D or F.
Grading is relative fair and a little bit higher.
If you put more effort and attend his lesson, it is easy to score B+ or above.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are a total of 5 Homework which you are required to finished in groups of 3.
Other than that, there are 2 Midterms and 1 Final Exam. All are MC Questions and non-cumulative.

reviews.author: i
reviews.comment_content: No need to read textbook, just read through his powerpoint is enough. Powerpoint is clear and easy to understand
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof. try hard to explain difficult concept in a simple way and will constantly do review, but his English is a bit hard to listen and need improvement.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grade。 you will get a good grade if u put enough effort in this lecture.
reviews.comment_workload:
only have 5 homework to be handed in, no in class quiz
Two mid terms plus a final (the prof usually reveal what will be tested in the lesson before mid terms and final ) Content to be tested are not cumulative so there won't be a lot to revise

reviews.author: Dywen
reviews.comment_content:
First few topics covers some basic mathematics concept reintroduced in statistics terms, which is quite easy, while things take a turn on the later topics, and there will be a lot of concepts and formulae to be remembered to deal with different questions.

Most of the teaching will be done in sub-topics, and comprehensive questions are given at the end of topic to check your progress.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Notes are very clear and straight forward, professor will cover extra techniques and demonstration in lectures.

Some of the derivation of equations or concepts are omitted, and you may find it frustrating.

But notes will be locked until respective topics ready to be taught in class. Not self-study friendly.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is subpar but your effort will be rewarded.

Above mean by 0.5~1 SD by each assessments and got full mark in respective problems set earned me a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 Problem Sets covering corresponding topics taught and Non-cumulative assessments (2 Midterms and 1 Final).

WILL require a copy of e-book and designated software for you to do the homework and is quite troublesome to handle sometimes.

reviews.author: JK
reviews.comment_content: the content is kinda different i guess from the other lecturers cause he was using python to teach statistics. it was really difficult for someone like me who has no background of the programming language nor good at stats. but undeniably, it is useful in real world applications. certainly more interesting than the usual statistic classes!
reviews.comment_teaching: we are the first batch he uses python to teach stats so it is actually kinda confusing initially, but sooner or later you'll get used to his teaching method. also, he actually put in lots of efforts to make sure we understand the content, by arranging weekend tutorials and an online platform where we can ask questions.
reviews.comment_grading: certainly not a grade killer, consider that i do not understand the content thoroughly but still got a B+, it was actually kinda good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: 4 projects in total, done in group, and that's all. but you do have to put in effort to understand the python language.

reviews.author: anthonyeric
reviews.title: Pan, Baoqian (Kris)
reviews.comment_content: Kris's lecture content is packed but informative. U will be able to understand the concepts and calculation method of statistical questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kris is a very passionate professor. She is willing to answer you the questions again and again. She motivates student by giving them participation mark if students ask or answer question.
reviews.comment_grading: 2 midterm, 1 exam, 4 homework and participation. The midterm and exam are in MC format. Therefore, understanding of concepts becomes the most important factor. Finally got a very good grade and rmb dun skip her lecture coz they are incremental.
reviews.comment_workload: It was fair. I would say fair enough as a 3 credit course.

reviews.author: RU HEN
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is relatively simple and light.
reviews.comment_teaching: There should be no difficulty understanding the content if you attend each lecture. The lecture notes are not very helpful if you don't attend the lectures because there are a lot of things that are done in the class that are missing in the notes.
reviews.comment_grading: Because the mean of this course is generally very high, it is quite difficult to get an A/A+ however getting a B/B+/A- is definitely attainable.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of the course is quite light. There are just 3 homework assignments for which we are given ample time.

reviews.author: RachelLou
reviews.comment_content:
Consisting of basic knowledge of Business statistic, from descriptive statistics to simple linear regression.
The course content was systematic and the contents in slides were all clearly organized and timely updated.
Corresponding exercises were updated regularly, it was not compulsory but benefited understanding.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The pace of teaching was pretty fast when talking about some simple concept, but the professor would slow down the pace and lay enough emphasis on the key points or the difficult parts.
The instructor encouraged asking questions in class.
We had two games in class this semester and it was fun.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was pretty good compared to other lectures since we didn't have extremely high means in exams.
The attendance and participation contributed 10% of the grade, 6% of which was earned by cards. (Answering or asking questions in class once, you can get a card.)
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was acceptable since neither exercise nor tutorial classes are compulsory.
But there were 4 group homework and if you have  teammates that often get free rides, the workload can be quite heavy.

reviews.author: Galen
reviews.comment_content:
Content for the first few weeks was alright, but it went downhill from there.

Probability Model, Sampling, Hypothesis Testing, Linear Regression Model and Multiple Regression.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Xinghua is a very nice professor, he's straight to the point and tries to eliminate a lot of redundant material from the course.

Highly recommend him if you are aiming for an A+
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 10%
Two Quizzes (ALL MC with cheat sheet) 40%
Final Exam (ALL MC with cheat sheets) 40%
Participation 10%

The grading is favourable for those who practice on past papers. The final exam was a straight forward but overall it was a pretty good experience.
reviews.comment_workload: It was very challenging and I had to put a lot of work into getting a good grade in this course

reviews.author: TCheung
reviews.comment_content: Probability Model, Sampling, Hypothesis Testing, Linear Regression Model and Multiple Regression.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor (Nickname: Tiger) is a Mainland professor. Maybe a bit boring to some people. But very easy to get the participation marks.
reviews.comment_grading:
Four Group Assignment 10%
Two Quizzes (ALL MC with cheat sheet) 40%
Final Exam (ALL MC with cheat sheets) 40%
Participation 10%

The grading is very good. The final exam was a bit difficult, but still a number of students can get over 90% marks.

My overall marks was 92% and this is already enough to get A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Four group assignments only. Very light workload.

reviews.author: qq
reviews.comment_content: The content is not that difficult at the beginning (which is why people start to slack off after the first two midterms). The first midterm is more like common sense, but the second midterm and the final requires more studying.  DO NOT SLACK OFF. It only becomes more difficult as time goes on.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Funny guy. Although his accent may be difficult to understand at times. However he is quite good at teaching and I enjoyed attending his lessons.

He is really strict about people using phones/computers in class, he actually does check if you are looking at your PPT slides or if you are just playing on your computer. He will ask you questions if he thinks you are not listening properly. He doesn't like people leaving class early, and trust me, he will ask you why you are leaving class in front of everyone. Try to get on his good side by answering questions and looking like you care.
reviews.comment_grading: He is quite generous with grading, I got mean/slightly above mean for all exams and ended up with a B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not large. It is really important you attend all his lessons. In the midterms/finals there are questions which are not exactly related to ISOM but more to specific examples he showed in lessons. Also, in order to get answers to PPT slides you must go to class to listen to him.

There are only two midterms and one final which are all non-cumulative. Occasionally there is homework, but it is really easy to do.

chp1:Basic descriptive statistics
chp2:Probability

chp4:Regression

reviews.author: A.T.9
reviews.title: Lucy(Must choose)
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1 Data description
• - Recognizing the type of data
• - Using graphs to see the characteristics of data
• - Summarizing messy data into neat numbers
Topic 2 Probability
• - Probability
• - Random variable, distributions
Topic 3 Random variables
• - Discrete random variables: Bernoulli, Binomial distribution
• - Continuous random variables: Uniform, normal distribution, t-distribution
Topic 4 Estimation
• - Point estimate, Sampling distribution
• - Confidence intervals
Topic 5 Hypothesis testing
• - One sample, statistically significant?
• - Errors of statistical testing: Type I and Type II errors
• - Two independent samples significantly different?
• - Examining relationships for nominal and ordinal data
Topic 6 Simple Linear regression
• - Basic concept
• - Checking model assumption
• - Prediction and estimation
reviews.comment_teaching: Lucy's ppts are very clear and some students from other lectures are also using it.She is so willing to answer students' question that she always arrives the classroom 40minutes before quizzes just to answer our questions.She also provides some candies and chocolates for her students in classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1  20%
Quiz 2 20%
Final Exam 40%
Homework 16%
Participation 4%
All the Quizzes and exam are mcqs which is fantastic for me.I manage to get high mark even I still do not completely digest the last topic(the hardest one).Quizzes are important due to its considerable weighting.Try your best to obtain high marks in both quizzes and they are very easy and straight-forward.Kind Lucy will also tell you how the mcqs will look like in exam and quizzes.Unlike DSE, there are no trap options in Lucy's quizzes and exam. So u pick the right one or guess one(u will never be trapped).Participation mark is graded by your attendance while lucy gives you more than 5 opportunities to be absent.Homework could be difficult esp for topic 6 so work hard with your teammates.

My grade:A+

FINAL EXAM 49/49

FYI, M1 DSE students are not as advantageous as some may claim.Lucy will finish the things M1 students have learnt in 2-3 lectures.

only do revision two days before quizzes and exam.

Actually the workload is light because you only need to hand in Group assignments, finish 3 quizzes and final exam.
It is okay to watch online tutorial if you want to skip lecture. Things are easy, but this course is about MATHs, so doing past papers is inevitable in order to get good grades. Add oil!

reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is fine, just with a bit of accent. But overall you should be  able to understand what he's saying.

reviews.author: wzefei

reviews.comment_content: Interesting topics are covered. Also, the professor offers big-picture explanations. His PPT is also very helpful and if you study it carefully, you don't need other materials for exams.

reviews.author: Ashta
reviews.title: Great if you focus well
reviews.comment_content:
In this course, you will learn about the basics of statistics.

These are the main topics:
Association/Dependence, Random Variables, Covariance, Normal Distribution, Sampling Distribution, Confidence Interval, Hypothesis Testing, Simple Linear Regression

The contents become more detailed later on, so make sure you understand the contents taught on the first half before you do not understand them later on.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Jason is really passionate about his teaching. He uses a lot of examples in his slides, so even if you do not understand the theory at first, you will after you go through the examples with him.

The slides he gives is very detailed and organized, it really helped me a lot to understand.

If you have any questions, make sure you ask him. He will try his best to answer your question. He is a very kind and a fun person to talk to.
reviews.comment_grading:
His grading is reasonable.

The quizzes are not that difficult. Try to do the examples in his slides on your own, it will help.

The final exam is quite challenging, but if you understand the contents that you have learned, you will be able to solve most of them.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not that much. You have to do only a few assignments (I think 2 or 3...) and they are not difficult. Especially, they are done in groups, so you will not be stressed with them.

There are 2 quizzes and 1 final. The 2 quizzes are like 2 midterms. All of the questions were in MCQ. I think the amount of the exams/quizzes are same for other lectures, too. Each of them have their own range of topics to study, so the final is not cumulative.
