reviews.comment_content: Fair grade but quite a workload. Requires basic mathematical concepts, cheat sheet allowed as well with calculator. Scope of knowledge includes intervals, statistical significance, null hypothesis, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice teacher. Logical, patient and very welcome to questions. Also provide supplementary materials for after-class exercise. Replied emails speedily.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grade. If you get 90/100 for each assignment, +1SD in mi/final exams, probably you would ace a B+/A- to be your final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Group project (assignment) around 4. Quite a workload since each question has sub-questions and quite many questions.

Especially the way he combined key concepts with vivid examples and demonstrations of the whole modeling/ calculating/ analyzing process. The bold/ colored letters and the lecture takeaway part is concise and clear, which is really useful for my notes and review!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade for this course is quite competitive TBO, most of your grade depends on the three exams you take (midterm I & II & final). For this term, all three exams are in multiple-choice format and allow cheat sheet. As for detail, the assessment will follow MAX[mid1*20%+mid2*20%+final*40%, mid1*5%+mid2*25%+final*50%] + Assignment 15% + Attendance 5%.
Though the questions are quite hard and the time is quite limited, the sample questions, as well as the answers prof provided, are really helpful.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not that big actually.
But it's a bit tense before the exams since you have to do the practice questions (about 50 multiple-choice each time) and you have to prepare the cheat sheet (one A4 blank paper, 2-sided allowed).
As for assignments, it's basically some application of the concepts you learned in the courses by using Excel. There will be 2 tutorials in total to help you to know some basic Excel functions. All three are group-based assignments and a questionnaire is conducted to exclude free-rider.
It's not mandatory to read the book but it's helpful for me personally.

Also, her explanations and ppt are literally perfect. They are not only concise but also rich in meaning and depth. When I studied for quizzes and finals, I only reviewed her slides.

The two quizzes were extremely easy, and about half of the students got a full mark. However, the final exam (50 questions in total) was a little bit confusing and very conceptual.

reviews.author: UST Astronaut
reviews.title: I miss Python...
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very interesting and easy to understand.  It is definitely one of the best business foundation courses that what a UNIVERSITY-level course should be.  The reason why some people think that the content is complicated and hard might probably be that they compare this course to secondary school stuff.

Two huge problems of this course are no Python and too few mathematical formulae, concepts and proofs.  These are the critical elements of what a statistical course should be.  Without these, students can only learn from the tip of an iceberg.

Description Statistics and Central Tendency, Normal Distribution, PDF CDF, Population and Sample, Central Limit Theorem, Confidence Interval, Hypothesis Testing, Linear Regression Model, ...  Simply the basics
reviews.comment_teaching:
He used to teach Python but this is the first semester that he changed to teach Excel.  In fact, Python is much more useful than Excel, and therefore should be a programming language that everyone should learn.  I strongly recommend and encourage Prof. Wan to teach Python again.

Also, it can be seen that he put a lot of effort into making his powerpoints great.  The concepts are explained very clearly, even though mostly graphics.  The animations help us understand as well.  The powerpoints include all the brief yet important key points necessary for exams.  Although the explanations are not in the powerpoint, they are taught in the lectures, so make sure not to skip lessons.  To be honest, no further resources such as e-books or online learning platform videos are needed unless students skip classes very often.
reviews.comment_grading:
A. Participation (15%): In-class surveys using Canvas App will be given to get instant feedback from students.  Meanwhile, students feedback will be counted as participation.  No actual attendance is counted since email notification will be given.  Also, no correct answer is needed, simply type something to get a full mark, credited on submission.

B. Two projects (20%): Students are allowed to work individually or in groups (group size ≤ 4).  Just start doing the night before the deadline.  Everyone gets almost full marks.

C. Midterm (30%): In-class midterm.  14 MCQs.  One A4 two-sided cheat sheet allowed.  Again, everyone gets almost full marks, so it's all about carefulness.

D. Final (35%): In principle, the final will test contents discussed after the midterm, except some basic statistical concepts.  41 MCQs.  One A4 two-sided cheat sheet allowed.  Even easier than the midterm, but some questions are a bit tricky.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost no workload, just two mini-projects, two exams, and some participation.  A simple cheat sheet and a basic understanding of statistics will do.

reviews.author: Meowww
reviews.comment_content:
This semester is the first semester Prof Wan said that he would not teach python in this course. He changed his teachings from python to excel. Maybe it's his first time dealing so much with excel, some of his teachings are incorrect and you may need to search online or ask students who are good at computer and mathematics for clarification.
However, the skills are actually quite practial as it is very easy and useful using excel to analyse big data.
reviews.comment_teaching:
You gotta have a good classmate for carrying you because he really couldn't explain the concepts clearly. Sometimes he is very impatient that he was so mean to my classmate once when asking him questions.
Also, don't expect anything from the TA. She couldn't explain the mistakes during paper checking.
You're on your own, unless you got a very good classmate helping you out.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation: 15%
Project 1: 10%
Project 2: 10%
Mid term: 30%
Final: 35%

Participation (mean 14.5 / mine 15):
Just chill. Just remember to complete new canvas assignments each lesson, even typing some random things will guarantee you a full participation mark.
He will not take attendance so just remember to check your canvas after each lesson even if you don't show up.

Project 1 (full 65 / mean 60.6 / mine 65):
This project is about fat tail and underestimation of risk. If you understand the teaching materials and know how to use the excel functions, it can be completed within hours.
There's a bonus mark for the groups made on the good reports demonstration, which are the best projects. But I don't know if Prof Wan counted that in our total grade.

Project 2 (full 65 / mean 60.4 / mine 59):
This project is about comparative statistics and inference in different markets. This project we didn't perform quite well is because we didn't put much time in doing it and we submitted it late. Again there's bonus marks for the best groups but don't know if he counted that.

Mid term (full 30 / mean 25.1 / mine 30):
The mid term has only 15 MCQs, and it definitely based on your deep understanding about the meanings and usage of excel functions. Memorize the excel functions cause the exam may ask you to choose among 4 options of excel functions presentations.
Cheat sheet of 1 A4 double sided is allowed so remember to squeeze everything in the cheat sheet.
(Tip: It is very easy to cheat in the mid term so remember to choose your seat wisely. There is no seating plan arrangement so...)

Final exam (full 41 / mean 22.9 / mine 22):
The exam has 41 MCQs and a cheat sheet of 2 A4 papers double sided (4 pages) is allowed. It will not cumulative so just understand the concepts after the mid term.
It is so hard to understand so make sure you get prepared.

Final grade: A-
My classmate got same marks as me cause he is in the same groups with me for the 2 projects. We got the same marks in participation, mid term and final.
But I got A-, he got B+ so I don't know what the hell.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low though. Just chill with the participation. Projects I would recommend you find people who understand what he teaches in order to secure your marks. For mid term and final, you need to put as much as you can on the cheat sheets and also, understand every concept after each lesson. Or else you will find it hard to catch up before exams.

reviews.author: aarolk
reviews.title: Choose the section wisely
reviews.comment_content:
-Part I: Exploratory Data Analysis
 Data
 Central Tendency
 Variation of Data

-Part II: Variables

reviews.comment_teaching:
He used to teach this course with Python but this semester he switched it to Excel. He explained things in a very unclear way, so do his powerpoints. The powerpoints are not useful in revision at all, the content is so messy and unorganized, better learn the things by simply searching some good channels online when studying.

The course should have a good content for business and non-business students, yet to be honest I didn't learn a lot from this professor. Please decide which section to enroll CAREFULLY so that you have less hatred or annoyance to a course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation (15%)
Two projects (20%)
Midterm(30%)
Final(35%)

Participation from in-class exercise and is credited by submission
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair, just two mini-projects that don't take long time to finish. Midterm is pretty easy if you revise.

reviews.author: Dorothy Wong
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
No programming needed.
You should do well easily if good at mathematics.
Concepts are really easy to understand.
Some already learnt in HKDSE mathematics core part.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Relatively good professor compared to other lectures.
No programming is needed and professor teaches really clearly
Very nice and willing to teach students.
reviews.comment_grading:
A
Midterm 1 higher 2SD
Midterm 2 higher 0.7 SD
Final higher 1 SD
reviews.comment_workload:
Small workload
You need to attend class for games and question cards.
Games and question cards counts for participation mark.
Group homework is required too, same set of homework every year though.

reviews.author: Peter yim
reviews.title: Easy fundamental courses
reviews.comment_content: Quite nice content, included many daily cases in course, overall this course is easy and should not be a hard topic
reviews.comment_teaching: James is a fun professor and provide us some thoughtful insight as well, reg him if you really want to learn
reviews.comment_grading: As the topic is ordinary and easy, everyone should have achieve a high score, so it is not really easy to get a A+ , but you can achieve A range if you done all the work
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light, quiz is too easy to study beforehand, just submit Assigment regularly should be fine

reviews.author: cycathylam
reviews.comment_content:
1. Descriptive Statistics
2. Probability
3. Random Variables
4. Estimation (Sampling distribution and confidence intervals)
5. Hypothesis testing
6. Simple Linear Regression
reviews.comment_teaching: She is nice and willing to answer your questions. But sometimes she may get lost and dunno what she is talking about also. So I think her teaching is not good enough. And her tone is quite boring also.
reviews.comment_grading: I get 83% in total and get B at last. The mean of mid term ,final and assignments are quite high. So you must understand all the content and do all the exercises given to attain good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Little workload. Only 4 group hw . Attendence will be given if you answer questions in class.

reviews.author: Parco Tsang
reviews.comment_content: First, you need to learn different types of data, graph, parameters. Then, you need to learn random variable with different types of distribution model. Finally, you need to learn some confidence interval, hypothesis testing and simple linear regression (although other instructors may teach multiple regression).
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor's explaination on the concepts are clear and can be followed easily. She also provides ppt with clear and detailed guidelines.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good. My overall score is 93% and I can get A+ eventually although there are about 10 people getting similiar score in her course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is reasonable. There are 4 HWs, 2 quizes which will last for 70 minutes and there are 25 MCQs in each quiz and a final exam which will last for 2 hrs and there are 40 MCQs.

reviews.author: Chuaa
reviews.comment_content:
The content is very rich
It is useful is the future business field
It requires you using mini tab
Lab session will help you in completing the hw
The content is actually quite practical and the profession will highlight the content for exam propose
So even it is quite a lot, it is not a problem for exam as long as you study
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite interactive as it requires class participation
10% score comes from answering her questions or asking question, some students are really aggressive so you gonna pay attention all the time in order to get a chance to answer a question.
Some times you ought to have some “creative” answer in order to get a participation card.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good. Good in the sense that the cutting is good but then the curve is pretty high, the mean is not that high but the median is so high that you may be higher than the mean but lower than the median and turn out you will get a C+.
reviews.comment_workload:
I will say the workload is pretty heavy
First of all there is free grouping so you have to find your group mate in the first two weeks. If you failed to do so,30% mark will be deducted for this.
And then there are 4 group homework and 2 quizzes and a final exam. All are mcs and allow cheat sheet.

reviews.author: Michellekiukiu
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite useful as he taught about practical coding in which you can really download data from the internet and analyze them. Anyways, it would be really hard to catch up if you don't know much about coding and you miss the first few lessons. Video lectures were only uploaded at later stages after 2 months of lectures. If you felt lost at the beginning, better ask your friends and attend the lessons to ask questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite nice, but his pronunciation might not be very accurate and his accent makes it hard to understand. Still, he is a good professor who is willing to answer your questions. For me, I almost skipped all lectures and attend a few only. I didn't even watch all the videos. Anyways he did try to explain step-by-step and clearly. You should definitely try first
reviews.comment_grading: I didn't attend lectures and watch videos. Fair to have a bad grade. If you have paid efforts, it shouldn't be hard for you to get an average score
reviews.comment_workload: Assignments count for 50% of the grade, you can do it with your group (at most 3 people), so don't miss it. Remember to try your best to do it, don't freeride. Otherwise you will have no idea about what is going on.

reviews.author: cyanlam
reviews.comment_content:
Brief introduction to business statistics

Objective of the course is to equip you with basic concepts and methods of statistics  so that they can handle uncertainty intelligently in business environment.
These concepts/methods include descriptive statistics, probability, statistical inference, and linear regression.

The course adopts the following approaches to meet the objectives :
Hand-on experiences on data collection and analysis through in-class experiments
Connection to real life and business practice through thecontent of lectures
Emphasize concepts understanding  & results interpretation over procedure execution & computation throughmethods of assessment
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Hu taught the concept of business statistics very clearly and made it easy to understand (maybe due to the fact that he is the chair professor of ISOM lol).
He always wanted to make sure we are on the right track and he tried hard to interact with the class by having real life examples, experiments, and a mini role playing with extra scores provided to the volunteered student actors.
If you have any questions, you can also ask him after class.

As long as you attend all the classes and tried not to sleep in class, you will understand what he is teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading system is fair.

I attended all the classes, however I didn't study seriously (just start studying the day before exam)
I got above mean in all assignments, midterms, and final.
Total Grade 83.43%, B+

Sample papers were provided.
As long as you completed all the sample papers and reviewed at the powerpoint the day before, it would be fine.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 attendance checking
3 Assignments
2 Midterms
1 Final

Attendance 5%
Assignments 15%
Midterm 40%
Final 40%
Total 100%

reviews.author: Isaac4321
reviews.comment_content: Basically, it is a lecture about python. If you are very familiar with coding and computer languages, this course would be easy to you. Of course, it includes basic statistic. But they are not that difficult if you do all the assignments and revise every now and then.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is ok. I miss most of the lectures as there are lecture videos. The professor is really nice that he stops every now and then during lectures to check our process. There are in-class exercises to make sure we can catch up. Overall, the professor is reliable.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading system:
Assignments: 50%
Mid-term: 15%
Final: 35%  

There is a mid term, 1 final and 4 assignments. Generally speaking, the mid term is pretty easy and there is a base mark. You can take the mid term unprepared and still get a seventy sth. The professor is very lenient. The assignments are not difficult and you can always copy from your peers. The difficulty of the final is appropriate. If you revise, you can get good grades.

I get An A for this course. Didn't' do particularly well on assignments. But i guess the final and mid term make up for it.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty low honestly. You can skip all classes. Just remember to hand in assignments on time and you're ok. Do a little bit of revision before mid term and final then you are good. A piece of cake.

reviews.author: wowwowow
reviews.title: Teaching style is a bit weird
reviews.comment_content: Completely different from others' lecturers, it involves programming mostly. A lot of concepts and calculations would not be tested, unlike other sessions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not a fan of this professor as he speaks in a low voice and the instructions are definitely not clear. So, in other words, it wouldn't help to attend the lectures anyway.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good. There are 4 assignments, a mid-term and a final examination. The mean score of the 4 assignments are insanely high. For one of the 4 assignments, I score 98/100 but I am STILL BELOW MEAN. Open-book Mid-term and final examination are actually quite good, they are not so challenging compared to the assignments.
However, mostly importantly, the 4 assignments weigh more than the two examinations.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload if you have great groupmates. I didn't attend the first few lectures and end up doing all the assignments on my own. Still, I find them quite easy to do.

reviews.author: tommyyim168
reviews.title: Super Good Grade for someone who dont want to study
reviews.comment_content:
I cant tell much about it about because I seldom go to the lectures.
But it requires students to utilize some maths formulas.
reviews.comment_teaching: A funny teacher but his accent is quite hard to listen.
reviews.comment_grading: It is definitely a good grade course. I did not attend at least 90%of the lectures. I only go  to those lectures which held tests (btw all tests and exams are just mc). I did not do any revision literally. I can still get  a C+ !!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload: Just hand in some homework in the books with teamwork. There are answers behind the book.

reviews.author: 必屎學渣
reviews.comment_content: It's about python rather than studying statistic. Therefore you will learn something about the basic programming of python. If you are familiar with programming you will be fine with this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: His pronunciation is not very accurate therefore you may not be able to understand what is he talking about easily. Fortunately, he started to upload lecture videos after the first few weeks so you can watch the video again after class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading of this course is quite good. There were 5 assignments, 1 midterm test and a final exam. The assignments took up 50% and he will give you a pretty good score if you have submitted the assignments. He promised that if you submitted all the assignments you can at least get a C range. For the midterm test and the final exam, they are open book test and you are allowed to google. Therefore it was quite easy to get a high score.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair as the assignments are group assignment so you don't have to do all of them on your own. Most importantly he doesn't mind if you just copy the assignment from other groups.

reviews.author: KentLung
reviews.title: Hard to get A+
reviews.comment_content:
Basic statistics knowledge. Completely the same with IB Math.
Very easy to be honest, that is why most of the students get a very high mark in the exam.

"Part I. Introduction
Course Organization
- Course outline
- Data and Variation (Ch2 - Ch6)
• Types of data, §2.1,2.2,2.4
• Describing categorical data, §3.1-3.4
• Association between categorical variables, §5.1-5.2
• Describing numerical data, §4.1-4.4
• Association between numerical variables, §6.1-6.3, 6.5
Part II. Probability
- Probability Model (Ch7 - Ch9)
• Basic concepts of probability, §7.1-7.2
• Independence, conditional probability, §7.3, 8.1-8.3 • Radom variable, mean and variance §9.1-9.4
- Association between Two Random Variables (Ch10)
• Portfolios, joint probability, §10.1-10.2
• Dependence between random variables, §10.3
• Mean and variance of weighted variables, covariance, §10.4, 10.6 • Game I
—– Quiz I —– - Normal Probability Model (Ch12)
• Normal random variable and normal Model, §12.1-12.2 • Normal quantile plot, §12.3-12.4
Part III. Inference
- Sampling and Sampling Distributions (Ch13 - Ch14)
• Concepts of population, sample and sampling, §13.1-13.2 • Game II
• Sampling distribution, §14.1
- Standard Errors and Confidence Intervals (Ch15) • Confidence interval for μ, §15.1-15.4
• Determine the sample size, §15.5 - Statistical Hypothesis Testing (Ch16)
• Concepts, §16.1
• One sample z- and t- tests, §16.2 - 16.3
—– Quiz II —– Part IV. Linear Regression
- Simple Linear Regression Model (Ch19 - Ch21)
• Linear pattern of data, residual plot, §19.1-19.3,19.5,
• Nonlinear pattern of data and transformation, §20.1-20.4 • The model and conditions, §21.1-21.2
• Inference in regression, §21.3
• Prediction interval, §21.4
BUSINESS STATISTICS (ISOM 2500) (L3), FALL 2017 3
- Regression Diagnostics (Ch22)
• Detecting differences in variation, §22.1 • Outlier and influential points, §22.2
• Dependent errors and time series, §22.3"
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mainland professor, the pronunciation is so difficult to understand.
However, he is very patient to your individual question and prone to help the student with difficulty. So I think is acceptable.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not good.
If your expectation is only A range, then this is your course.
HOWEVER, since the SD is very small, one mistake in the exam can drag you down so much.

91%->B
92%->B+
93%->A-
94%->A
all mc questions
attendance 5%
homework 15%
two quiz each 20%(one mark one %)
one final exam 40%

(Dont know the range for A+, I got 97.6% but only an A)
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload, to be honest.
Only need to take a few hours before the exam. Pay attention to review those tricky questions.

reviews.author: Jonathan:-)
reviews.title: Very useful course for business students
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1 Data description
Topic 2 Probability
2a/b. Basic Probability
(Quiz 1)

2c. Discrete random variables: binomial distribution
2d. Continuous random variables: normal distribution, t distribution
Topic 3 Estimation
3a. Point estimate and Sampling distribution
3b. Confidence intervals
(Quiz 2)

Topic 4 Hypothesis testing
Topic 5 Simple Linear regression
(Final exam)

The content overall is very useful for business students. A lot of examples and applications are provided in the notes. The heavy proof on MATH is NOT emphasized.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her explanation is clear and vivid. And she is a very kind and always willing to answer students' questions. Feel free to ask her in Cantonese after class.

I would recommend you to go to her lectures since some of the important ideas were only taught in the lecture but not written in the notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz1 10%
(mean 80, sd 13, high 100)
Quiz2 20%
(mean 67, sd 15, high 100)
Final 50%
(mean 76, sd 16, high 97.5)
Assignments 10%
4 assignments in total
Participation 10%
Overall ~97.7% A+
Getting around 90% is enough for an A.
Kris said that she would give us maximum A range(20%) and B range(40%).
reviews.comment_workload:
Kind of light insofar as there are no free-riders in your group.
Revision shouldn't take you too long if you pay full attention to the lectures.

reviews.author: chlkaren
reviews.title: Good instructor, fair grading
reviews.comment_content:
1. Descriptive statistics
2. Probability and random variables
3. Estimation
4. Hypothesis testing
5. Simple linear regression

Some topics are included in DSE M1 course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kris explains the concepts clearly, she will include some ideas during lectures which are not on the ppt. So if you attend her lectures, the quizzes and final exam will be fine.
She is also friendly and willing to answer students questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading but difficult to obtain A range.
Quiz 1: 88/100 (mean: 80)
Quiz 2: 88/100 (mean: 67; sd: 15)
Final Exam: 75/100 (mean: 67: sd:16 -- L1+L2)
HW1: 66/76 (mean:70)
HW2: 82/93 (mean: 84)
HW3: 60/74 (mean: 62)
HW4: 100/100 (mean: 93.9)
Participation: 9/10

Final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy but you need to spare time to try the assignments as they are quite difficult, especially the last HW.

reviews.author: jdub___
reviews.title: The most useful course I've taken so far in UST
reviews.comment_content:
the first two topics were just intro to business stats and DSE
(or beginner) level statistics and probability, but be prepared as its gonna get much harder as the course progresses and your concepts and knowledge have to be really really clear.
Overall i think the knowledge taught is quite useful for business applications.

Topic 1 - Intro
Topic 2a- Statistical graphs
Topic 2b - Measurements of tendency and dispersion
Topic 2c - Probability
Topic 2d - Probability rules
(these two topics are like really easy)

(the following topics are where it starts to get hard)
Topic 3a - Discrete random variables
Topic 3b - Continuous random variables
Topic 3c - Sampling distribution
Topic 4a - Estimation (Confidence intervals)
Topic 4b - Hypothesis testing (basics)
Topic 4c - Hypothesis testing for population mean
Topic 4d - Hypothesis testing for population proportion
Topic 5a - Simple linear regression (basics)
Topic 5b - Simple linear regression (regression model assumptions)
Topic 5c - Simple linear regression (w/ Hypothesis testing)
reviews.comment_teaching: Kris Pan is a really nice professor; she will always try to help us understand what she teaches, and is always willing to answer our questions. She often asks us questions as well, and whenever we answer it wrongly she stresses that its fine to answer it wrongly, cuz we won't get it wrong again next time. She can speak Cantonese, English and Mandarin, so being a local student I can ask her questions freely in my mother tongue.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance and Participation - 10% (6% by obtaining participation cards (max 2 per lesson), 4% by participating in 2 in-class games (as an attendance check))

Quizzes - 20% (2 this semester)

Assignments- 20% (4 this semester)

Final - 50% (she stressed that not taking the final means failing the course)

I believe if your concepts are clear enough and you pay great attention to the prof in class, you're able to get a pretty good grade. However, for the assignments it really depends on what groupmates you have.
For me,
Assignment 1 - 74/76
Assignment 2 - 87/93
Assignment 3 - 70/74
Assignment 4 - 100/100 (seems for this one if you show you put in enough effort, even you get some wrong you still get 100)
Quiz 1 (Topic 1 to 2d) - 22/25
Quiz 2 (Topic 3a to 4c) - 21/25
Final - 90%

In the end I got an A, so i would say the grading's pretty reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too heavy; although there's 4 assignments, my groupmates split the workload, so it's only 2-3 questions per assignment.
However, a bit of revision has to be done after each class as well as before quizzes and the final.

reviews.author: Woo Suk Choi
reviews.title: Short Review Summary
reviews.comment_content: The class content is very adequate. R studio is widely used for Information System even in SNU in Korea.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is very adequate. Although his level of understanding is quite higher than us, he explains us why things happen in this way and such.
reviews.comment_grading: His grading is very adequate. Although we had to ask for re-check for some assignments, his grading overall was very good.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very adequate. The seven assignments that we have for a semester was very doable and challenging for the first year students.

reviews.author: ZhuKexin
reviews.title: easy class, but hard to be perfect.
reviews.comment_content:
Objective and intended learning outcomesThe objective of this course is to equip students with basic concepts and methods in statisticalthinking and reasoning so that they can handle uncertainty intelligently in business environmente ectively. These basis concepts and methods includedescriptive statistics,probability,statistical inference, andlinear regression.The course adopts the following approaches to meet the objectives:Emphasize concepts understanding and results interpretation through di erent methodsof evaluation.Closer connection to real life and business practice through new content of lecturesHand-on experiences on data collection and analysis through in-class experimentsInstructor:Lilun DU, Assistant Professor of ISOM, Room 4068, Phone:  2358-7730 (O);Email:dulilun@ust.hk; Oce hour: by appointment.TA:Ching Wan TAI, Room 5032a, Phone: 3469-2634 (O); Email:imjackie@ust.hk; Ocehour: 03:00pm-04:00pm, Fri.Class Meets:Lecture-1: Rm 4619, 01:30pm-02:50pm/09:00am-10:20am, Mon/Fri.Lecture-2: Rm 4619, 03:00pm-04:20pm/10:30am-11:50am, Mon/Fri.Tutorial section on quiz and Final exam (by Instructor){07:00pm-08:30pm, Rm 4334, Sep. 27.{07:00pm-08:30pm, Rm 4334, Oct. 27.{07:00pm-08:30pm, Rm 4334, Nov. 27.Tutorial section on Excel (by TA){13:30pm-14:30pm, G005 LSK, Sep. 20.{14:00am-15:00pm, G005 LSK, Sep. 21.Course MaterialsRecommended Textbook: \Statistics for Management and Economics, 10nd edition", byGerald Keller.1
Recommended Textbook:  \Statistics for business, decision making and analysis, 2ndedition", by Stine and Foster.Lecture notes, HW assignment, and practice questions will be posted on the course website(https://canvas.ust.hk/).Required software: Excel.Evaluation1.Midterm 40%: there will be two quizzes testing Part I (20%) and Part II (20%) respec-tively. All questions in exams are multiple-choice ones.Quiz I: 07:00pm-08:00pm, Sep. 29, at LTC/LSK-G012.Quiz II: 07:00pm-08:00pm, Oct. 30, at LTA/Rm1504.Final Exam: date and venue to be determined.2.Final Exam 40%: covers Part III & IV, which will also be multiple-choice format.3.Assignments 15%: three sets of homework assignments.4.Participation 5%: Classroom participation is crucial to a lively and e ective learningenvironment. Your participation will be assessed according to both attendance taking( ve times) and contributions to in-class discussion and learning.Academic IntegrityWithout academic integrity, there is no serious learning. Thus you are expected to hold thehighest standard of academic integrity in the course.  You are encouraged to study and dohomework in groups.  However, no cheating, plagiarism will be tolerated .  Anyone caughtcheating, plagiarism will fail the course. Please make sure adhere to the HKUST AcademicHonor Code at all time (seehttp://www.ust.hk/vpaao/integrity/).2

reviews.comment_teaching:
bad accent.
great teacher
reviews.comment_grading: really easy content, but you would have to be perfect to get A+

reviews.author: dani23
reviews.title: Ok So Far
reviews.comment_content:
Currently in ISOM 2500, The course content is quite easy right. It is basic statistics diagram such as box and wiskers, bar graph, pie graph, etc. Also, there are equationg like finding the standard deviation and We are stepping in to probability right now.

Also, use excel to graph stats.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is passionate about the subject, and seem to taught the course for couple of terms already. His notes is good, and there is no book that you need to read. However, the book does help you if you figure out how to use excel on different statistics
reviews.comment_grading:
Not sure, because we have not yet taken any test.
There is going to be 3 quiz, and the first 2 quiz count as mid-term. 60 minutes with 20 multiple choice questions. THe attendence also count toward your grade. You need to be present 5 times to earn the 5% attendence grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is none. THere is no homework right now, but the teacher gives excel examples for you to practice on your own.

reviews.author: lhchun
reviews.comment_content: It is about business statistics models like confidence interval, probability and graph analysis.  It also teaches student basics of business software like Minitab.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is simple and precise.  If you have difficulty following what's being said, just start writing and jotting notes.  It will help you follow the flow of the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you attend lectures and jot down relevant notes, getting B and above isn't that difficult
reviews.comment_workload: Workload could be a bit high for some as there are three to four group assignments.  There is also a participation elements to the final score, which will be determined by how often you answer and ask questions during lectures (10 times maximum)

reviews.author: kakei5844
reviews.title: great course

reviews.author: Kvothe
reviews.title: DON'T TAKE THE 9AM CLASSES
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the content is understandable as the professor will have lots of examples from real businesses. If you learn the case studies thoroughly most of the time you'll remember how to do it in midterm/final.

If you want good grade you might want to buy the textbook, if you're okay with a B grade you can just read off the lecture notes. Like a lot of maths related stuff perfect practice makes perfect.

Midterm 1 - very basic stuff i.e bar charts, line graphs, coefficient, linear correlations, how to detect variance
Midterm 2 - Hypothesis testing, double end and single end testing, alpha and beta errors etc.
Final - Application of midterm 1 + midterm 2 stuff, you need to know how to manipulate equations and then how to test them etc... If you like stats this course is good for you.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Most of the teaching is nice. If you skip lectures you might not understand anything in further lectures as a lot of the content builds upon each other. You might want to attend all lectures and make notes on the lecture slides as it'll help a lot for finals.

I never saw the TA so you might be in trouble if you don't understand what the lecturer teaches.
reviews.comment_grading:
Most of the grading is fair, all of the MCQs during midterm and final were correctly marked i.e no double answers when paper checking came so you can assume that your MCQ grade is usually is correct without having to paper check.

No project, but they occasionally do in class activities which counts as attendance. Not to mention that if you don't show up to class, this prof can recognize you since it's a small class of 20-30 students.
reviews.comment_workload: Super easy workload, there's no assignments, all you have to do is ace the midterms and final for a good grade.

reviews.author: CourseReviewer
reviews.comment_content:
Content was alright, albeit less rigorous than other professors, which isn't good if you're planning on taking more statistics courses later on (for OM / QFIN majors).

To get a good grade, you need to constantly review his questions; about 60% of the exam questions come from a modified version of the review quiz he gives out about 2-3 days before the exam day. Make sure you understand and don't memorize! Although, I've gotten away with just writing the things I don't understand on the cheat sheet.

Graphical techniques
Numerical techniques
Probability
Conditional Probability
Discrete random variable
Covariance and portfolio
Continuous random variable
Sampling distribution
Confidence interval
Hypothesis testing
Simple Linear Regression
Curved patterns and transformation
Regression estimation and prediction
Regression diagnosis
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Du's teaching was horrible. His accent was really difficult to understand, he jumps around from one topic to another. Although, if you approach him personally in his office, he teaches way better there, and may give you some hints on what's coming on the exam.

I think it's a good idea to read the theory from the textbook since it explains it much better than he does.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was alright too, according to last semester's statistics, his A-range was a solid 20%, and to my understanding, it's the same as well for this semester.

Although, he doesn't give A+s away.

Note that grading for spring term is way easier than fall term, since the students aren't that math-oriented in Spring.

Do note that the mean is relatively high too since his exams aren't that difficult.

In addition, four random attendance checks for a total of 4% of your final grade; don't miss this one too!
reviews.comment_workload: The workload wasn't an issue, just three sets of homework that needs to be submitted. I view it as good practice for exams, and try not to screw them up as they're free points.

reviews.author: Abby
reviews.title: Go for James!
reviews.comment_content: The course is mainly about understanding the statistic applied in business model instead of using math equations to get the correct numbers. Getting a big idea how some parameters will affect the final result and making sense to the result either through math or intuition(more recommended). If you have good sense of math but don't want to bother by doing those boring computation, come here. I am a lazy folk, and that's the reason why I was in his session.
reviews.comment_teaching: James is glad to answer any question and jokes around sometimes. As some slides are adopted from some advanced statistic courses(mostly PG courses), I would say going to the lecture and paying attention to his teaching will save you a lot of efforts. He even postponed the course to start from 9:15 in the morning every Friday. If you have hard time understanding why sth works, grab a look at other sessions' slides with more math there.
reviews.comment_grading: Individual Class Participation and professionalism    10%, Group Homework assignments(3) 10%, Bi-Weekly Quizzes-Multiple Choice: best 4 out of 5 quizzes in total 40%, Final Exam -Multiple Choice 40%. My assignments are all mean+0.5 sd, quizzes are full mark, and final is mean+1sd. I ended up getting A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Five quizzes(5MC each) are more likely used to take attendance. He even gave answers to some problems, as missing one quiz out of four will lead to a drop in one subgrade. The mean will be super high for the quiz. Group assignments you can find standard answers in textbook or web. It's more about learning through hw. More computation and better sense of number are required in the final. But it's more about understanding, no need to memorize any formula or follow any pre-set process.

Simple linear regression

Content taught are very useful for futurw studies. However, some knowledge that is taught in other lectures are not illustrated in her lectures.

Starting from HT, the content will be much more difficult, so pay attention is class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Pan teaches well, she understands what you will confuse and explain them in detailes, with tons of examples used.

Her lively tone makes the lesson less boring. Her presentation skills is really good, you can definitely understand the materials after she presents them to you. She will engage as much students as possible in lectures, and encourage us to speak and ask a lot. She is a mainland professor from the Guangdong Province, so she can speak fluent Cantonese, Putonghua and English.

Each year, many students would like to swap in her lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
She is well-know for being lenient in grade, so I don't have much to add.

As long as you can get above 1 SD, or even a little bit lower, you can get an A range, but for A or A+, you need to get around 94-5% of the course total.

However, don't be afraid of the high mean, it is just indicating that her quizzes and exam are with low difficulty.
reviews.comment_workload:
Average.

4 problem sets (the last one is extremely difficult with no information can be found on the net)
2 quizzes (not difficult, a double-sized reference sheet is allowed in each quiz, try hard to put all the things in and revise for some time, no worries)
1 final (on HT and SLR, not difficult, also 1 reference sheet is allowed)

Participation:
most horrible part of the course, you can get them by answering/asking 6 questions in 6 seperate lectures + participating in 2 statistics games. You may also choose to get all participation marks by answering questions in seperate 10 lectures.

reviews.author: hanrich
reviews.comment_content: many mainland students, especially 0900 class. The content is easy at first but quite hard after hypothesis testing
reviews.comment_teaching: language can be easily followed, The professor will say some jokes but his attitude is quite serious. He also does not allow students to use the phone
reviews.comment_grading: students' grade is given according to the class instead of the professor. Therefore, with the same score of two students in different class, they can have different grades.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 problem sets, the third one is the most difficult. The mean of the problem set would probably be high, about 90%

reviews.author: Cedric
reviews.comment_content: Mid Term之前都系教DSE M1學過既野，例如probability, z-test等等，所以讀過M1既mid term應該好輕鬆；但之後就開始教深少少既野，Hypothesis test同linear equation嗰d真系要好俾心機聽先get到
reviews.comment_teaching: 上Kris Pan堂算系比較輕鬆，教既內容好似比其他professor簡單d，而且佢每一個重點位都會重複講3-4次，所以唔驚會miss左重點；佢自己系Powerpoint入面都會list左好多examples，而且有部分會直接系exam paper入面出
reviews.comment_grading:
有10%系平時分，要拎到6張卡(每次舉手問/答問題就會有一張)+玩兩次game(上堂期間進行)就full mark
另外有3份group assignment，大概有5-8題，去到最尾嗰份通常會難到飛起，mean大概90%
有兩次mid term(quiz)同一次final，40題mc，都幾簡單，錯3-4條就有可能跌到落mean
reviews.comment_workload: workload okay，系group assignment比較麻煩，要分工合作先可以搞掂，一個人做既話一定gg

reviews.author: Dicky123
reviews.title: Easy course 送分拉高GPA
reviews.comment_content: Complicated but very easy to understand and put into use
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Du explains the content with a lot ofreal life examples,which is good and concrete. For example,explanning sampling distribution by the credit card example is very good.

The teaching is very good too/
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy to get good grade, can do groupworks to gain free marks. Besides, exams are all mc and open book, we can get a lot of marks easier than any other course.
Participation mark is purely attending the lesson which provides students free marks too
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload, a long deadline before homework submission. Plenty of time to revise exams+ all mc and open book really relives the stress!!

reviews.author: JerryZhu
reviews.comment_content: The content actually is very clear through a way of PPT, basically do not need extra reading material.
reviews.comment_teaching: XIA's Chinglish is very good. PPT is enough for your self-learning
reviews.comment_grading: It's a really easy course, so you need to make sure that you get every quiz full marks to secure A and A+
reviews.comment_workload: Work load is extremely low! The quiz open a whole week, you can do it anytime, The textbook? No we don't need it, just dispose it in the rubbish can, PPT material is quite exhausted for the quiz and exam. No assignment by the way.

reviews.author: himateee
reviews.title: bad teaching but good grades
reviews.comment_content:
Part I: Exploratory Data Analysis
Part II: Variables
Part III: Statistical Inference
Part IV: Prediction with Regression Model
Part V: Prediction with Classification:

his course is quite difficult to understand
he has his own lecture notes but not much details
you need to attend every lectures to understand some concepts
reviews.comment_teaching:
slow but passionate
difficult to understand what he is saying
his lectures are really boring
reviews.comment_grading:
his grading is good
in his first lecture, he promised to give as more "A" and "B" as he can
reviews.comment_workload:
not many workload
two group projects
one midterm one final (all MC with cheatsheet)

reviews.author: Wong Kwun Hang
reviews.title: Student
reviews.comment_content:
The content is about probability, regression and other statistics technique. Many of them is about DSE M1, so
the students who studied M1 before would be beneficial. Zheng Xinhua's ppt content is indeed very few, just abt 10 pages a lecture, total 20 lectures a semester. The content is not hard, but need time to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer is quite helpful but he has a accent for his speaking. The  powerpoint is easy to understand. You need to attend the lesson to have a thoughtful understanding of the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair. The mean is so high, because the mid-term and finals are quite easy. Once you get one or two mc wrong, a grade will be lost.

10% Participation (full)
10% Assignment (full)
23% 1st MT (22/22, mean: 23/23)
22% 2nd MT (20/23, mean: 18/22)
35% Final (32/35, mean: 34/35)

Overall 95% got A- .
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is acceptable and light. There is very little class exercises
We just need to play games in the lesson. There are only 3  assignments with very low workload. Overall, the workload is very light. The quiz and exam is quite similar to the practice question

reviews.author: Maxine
reviews.comment_content: The ppt provided are very detailed, with many sample questions to explain the whole concept. I am a student with poor mathematics foundation, but the course is still manageable to me. The first 1/3 of the course are about probability and was covered in DSE syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kris is a nice lecturer that her teaching is interesting. She is very willing to answer students' questions. Personally I would recommend Kris to all the local students because she can speak in cantonese.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is very reasonable. There are in total 3 quizzes and can get high mark easily because all are MC questions.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is not heavy. 3 Quizzes and fews group assignments. For the assignments, the answer can be founded in many online resources and are easy to handle. Participation is important and every student needs to answer 10 questions in class to get the point.

reviews.author: swaggerjaggerry
reviews.comment_content:
Basic math/stats you learn in high school like probability, types of distributions, covariance, etc.
Content is relevant and about the right size. A little too many MINITAB tutorial screenshots when most students have not owned the software yet, so it may be pretty useless/time consuming explanations
reviews.comment_teaching: Understandable, clear and coherent. He really likes to smile, which makes learning statistics a tad bit less stressful. Guy also likes to say 'so-called' up to the point where it's super overused, but that's fine. Funny guy, but u CANNOT play your phone in class he will call you out and give you a stink eye.
reviews.comment_grading: he does not give any A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm
Finals
3 Problems sets

reviews.author: PawelP
reviews.comment_content: Really interesting stuff. It feels like you can actually apply the knowledge you have gained. The course material really varies between professors.  Everything is write here is about Prof James.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof James is really good and has really interesting teaching style.  He emphasizes real life application, you don't have to remember any formulas by heart.

You don't have to attend the lectures, but some powerpoint slides might be confusing.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's good. There are 3 quizes that are super easy (8/10 is the mean) and the final that is quite hard. You gotta go through all the powerpoint slides. Many questions are exact copies of the ones that are shown in the PPT.

There is also a participation grade, but I think nobody ever got any points for that.

You are allowed to bring EVERYTHING to the exam, even your laptop, but you don't get internet connection.  This makes the exams different. Some people may not like it. It favors thinking over memorization.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much. You can "half learn" everything as you can access the  laptop during your exam.

reviews.author: someoneinust
reviews.comment_content: 唔讀m1真係好唔公平，quiz1根本佢地唔洗溫都識，quiz exam雖然係只係mc，但係難到喊，有得帶cheatsheet 都無用
reviews.comment_teaching: 講得好快，lecture notes又廢，又以為自己好好笑
reviews.comment_grading: 爛grade，話就話俾最多數量A，B range，但係根本好多人都係得C 甚至D range
reviews.comment_workload: 上堂要求好高，唔答問題根本個participation分會爛曬，勁多分組功課要做，好麻煩，又要去做lab

reviews.author: Ronia
reviews.title: 简化版ap stat
reviews.comment_content:
我看别的review都写的差不多了
基本上是ap统计的内容简化版 我觉得4-5分差不多就能躺平吃老本
reviews.comment_teaching:
我的妈... Lilun肯定是个大好人 教学热情邮件秒回 但是这个口音
咋说呢 我开学第一节课听的就是他的课 当时退学的心都有了
但是其实习惯了也好点 再加上他教学内容逻辑其实挺清晰的 仔细听也没多大问题
reviews.comment_grading:
考试内容其实中规中矩 基本没有什么为难人的题 直接导致mean很高
两个midterm比mean高一两分 final高三四分
attended3/5 assignment基本mean上下
最后B+
reviews.comment_workload:
基本没啥活儿 三份作业分group每人半个小时
如果有ap基础的话考前抱抱佛脚也没问题 我基本都是考试前一周开始学...基本也能补的差不多

reviews.author: USTdoll
reviews.title: 佢新嚟㗎？係呀！final分都冇出
reviews.comment_content: It's quite easy to for u to catch up if u have studied M1 before. The only new topics for u are hypothesis testing, and linear regression.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Typical chinglish accent but still understandable.
The professor uses a quite lot of examples in teaching which is quite helpful for our understanding.
reviews.comment_grading:
I have totally no idea how he grades!!!!!

Class participation 5/5
Assignments 14.4/15
Two quizzes 34/40
-Quiz 1 (17/20, mean 14.9)
-Quiz 2 (17/20, mean 14.7)
Final Examination ??/40

The grading process was extremely short, just like a week after my final exam. However I never received my final exam marks !!(I was like 'what???????')

This prof is definitely not 'leng grade' cuz I expected an A range but it turns out B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light.
Just 3 assignment. Each contains 3-4 questions, while to be done in groups of 4. Each assignment can be done in 1-2 hours.

reviews.author: 彭怡家
reviews.title: best prof LI XINLEI
reviews.comment_content: basic financial accounting
reviews.comment_teaching:
LI Xinlei is a good prof who explains things clearly and patiently. And most important, she is sooooo beautiful and elegant that i became her fans after i attending her first course. You can ask her every question that confuses you because she is so nice that will help you a lot.
(p.s she doesn't require the attendance)
reviews.comment_grading:
fair grade.
actually, if you are acct major student, you will be set in the class that are full of local students who study well on accounting, so in order to get a good grade, it's important for you to work harder and harder.
reviews.comment_workload: xinlei asks you to complete 3 of the after-class questions on the textbook, and once you submit your assignment, TA will give you full grades, so the workload is actually quite small.

reviews.author: marcoooooo
reviews.comment_content:
唔洗上堂 mt同final剩係9背就得
係final會有小小programming, 但係基本上都係好易
中間要做個project, 比分相對鬆手 最後個分冇派但感覺我果組唔係特別好
reviews.comment_teaching:
成個sem走左8成堂
當中industry week 計attendence果兩三堂有上到
但係尚算記得lecturer講野唔單止跟ppt讀
都會講下現實生活野, notes入面既野點樣apply落去reality
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm同final都係考前幾日係咁咪書,
project都正正路路 同幾組撞左idea, 最後A+
reviews.comment_workload:
0 assignment
1個大project要做成個sem, 中間1份progress report, 最後交report同埋presentation
mid-term 1個
final 1個
個人認為難度分 3/10
背野佔90％

reviews.author: ustdumbdumb
reviews.comment_content: Basic introduction on the information systems. If you have studied Module 1 Math or attained a rather high level of understanding in Core Math during Secondary school, you will find this course rather easy. It will introduce you to more details of several data mining methods, as well as practical uses of them.
reviews.comment_teaching: His English would be quite difficult to understand if you are only used to lecturers with perfect accent, otherwise i would say its understandable. Quite effective teaching, uses real examples to make concepts easier to understand(or maybe its just an easy course to begin with). The instructor himself is pretty friendly and you can ask him for free extra materials.
reviews.comment_grading: A typical kind of grading method: assignment, quiz and exam. The quiz will be quite easy as long as you attend the lecture before it (it reviews the syllabus with you), as it is just MC questions. For assignments, you should be able to tackle them easily with reliable groupmates. As for final exam, just like any other course, study and you will have a chance. I have friends getting A,B and Cs with various efforts.
reviews.comment_workload: Varies for different types of students, i would say its light for most of the people.

reviews.author: yankin
reviews.comment_content: we learn the basic skill of Python, which is a useful programming tool in business world nowadays.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Everyone has to download a programming tool, Python, which is useful nowadays.
We used the iPython notebook in this session. The professor not only taught us theory, but also taught us how to cope with the problems of new data when using Python. He taught quite well so is is easy to understand,
reviews.comment_grading:
Not very good grade
all assignments: mean
Final exam:mean
B
reviews.comment_workload:
4 assignments (4 in a group,easy to finish)
1 midterm exam
1 final exam
